title: Time Warner's Move Raises Hopes and Hackles
description: To hear Richard D. Parsons tell it, Time Warner's chairman, Gerald M. Levin, made him an offer too good to refuse.

title: Abbey Healthcare Group Inc.(ABBY,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 2,567,000, or 20 cents a share, and $ 3,415,000, or 28 cents a share, for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, which both included a net gain of $ 3,071,000 on disposal.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 367,000, or 4 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,101,000, or 14 cents a share, in the 9 months.Latest 9 months' income from continuing operations of $ 1,233,000, or 28 cents a share, included $ 10.4 million in merger and restructuring charges.

title: G.O.P. Defections Bare Party's Rift
description: A string of defections by prominent Republicans who endorsed Democratic candidates, the biggest in decades, has exposed an ideological rupture in the Republican Party and demonstrated how difficult it has become for the major parties to enforce discipline.

title: American Barrick Resources Corp.(ABX,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Sports of The Times; The Gospel According To Shaq
description: WHILE in Toronto last summer as a member of Dream Team II, Shaquille O'Neal was approached by people telling him they had seen his father on television talk shows. O'Neal called the man he considers his father. "Daddy," he said, "I heard you were on TV." His father said, "No, I wasn't."

title: First Commercial Corp.(FCLR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Quaker Chemcial Corp.(QCHM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a pretax repositioning charge of $ 3.5 million.

title: Harsh Report on Iran Opposition Group Draws Ire in Congress
description: The State Department upset many members of Congress today by issuing a scathing report about a prominent Iranian opposition group without meeting with officials from the group, as more than 100 lawmakers had asked it to do.

title: Southland Corp.(SLCMC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 4.5 million insurance recovery.c-Included extraordinary gain of $ 98,968,000, or 24 cents a share, on debt redemption, in the quarter and 9 months. Both periods also included a $ 10 million expense associated with the disposition of Citijet, and the 9 months was also after a charge of $ 16,537,000, or 4 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Move to Ban Giant Bulls Splits Spain
description: From prehistoric cave paintings to Picasso murals, bulls have always been associated with Spain's national imagery. Or so almost everyone in Spain is now passionately affirming since the Ministry of Public Works has condemned dozens of huge metal cutouts of bulls that dot the countryside.

title: Tommy Hilfiger Corp.(TOM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Revenue represented net revenues.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: MCI COMMUNICATIONS CORP., Washington, said it would be the exclusive provider of pay telephone services for Washington National and Dulles International airports in a five-year, $20 million agreement with Harris Corp., Melbourne, Fla., an electronic systems, semiconductor and communications company.

title: Status of Humphries Is Uncertain
description: The San Diego Chargers might not know until just before kickoff in Atlanta Sunday whether STAN HUMPHRIES will be the starter, the backup or the inactive third-string quarterback.

title: INSIDE
description: Turning to Einstein

title: Midlantic Corp.(MDL,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Reflected about $ 25 million in net gains on disposition of assets, as included in the company's noninterest income for the period, and after a charge of $ 7,528,000, or 14 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.c-After a gain of $ 38,962,000, or 77 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: U.S. Sex Survey Had Flawed Methodology
description: To the Editor:

title: Green Point Savings Settles Depositor Suits
description: The Green Point Savings Bank of Flushing, Queens, said yesterday that it had settled a series of lawsuits by depositors challenging the bank's conversion to public stock ownership.

title: Over 100 Inmates Escape From Haiti's Main Prison
description: More than 100 prisoners at Haiti's national penitentiary, including some former police officers being held on charges of human rights abuses, escaped here Sunday, according to Haitian news reports.

title: GP Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a pre-tax charge of $ 20 million related to a special provision for loan losses on mortgage loans transferred to ''held for sale'' status at June 30, 1993.Year-earlier per-share results weren't provided, as the bank wasn't public a year earlier.

title: Psychiatric Exam Ordered In White House Shooting
description: The dishonorably discharged Army medic who opened fire on the White House on Saturday with a semiautomatic rifle was today charged with four felony offenses, and a magistrate ordered him to undergo a one-day psychiatric examination.

title: DANCE
description: Choreography That's New, But With Baroque Touches Gould Hall

title: Israelis and Arabs Talking Business
description: Two thousand business executives from 60 countries and scores of senior American, Israeli and Arab officials began a two-day conference here today to explore ways of cementing peace between Israel and its Arab neighbors through regional economic projects.

title: U.S. to Spend $80 Million To Restore a Barrier Island
description: Ending 20 years of litigation, the Federal Government has agreed to spend $80 million to help restore a barrier island in the Hamptons where more than 200 homes were swept away in a 1992 storm.

title: Letko Hopes Patience Will Pay Off; A Torrid Start in '93 Marathon, but Nothing Left for a Finish
description: Overheated and dehydrated, Anne Marie Letko finished the 1993 New York City Marathon not in Central Park but in the hospital, not with a medal around her neck but with an intravenous tube in her arm. The next day, she went for a short run, and her legs were so sore that she found it necessary to walk down the driveway backward.

title: No Headline
description: "I'm not going to change my life dramatically. I don't go for fancy restaurants. I'm not a suit-and-tie man." -- FRED JACOBS, lottery winner. [ B1:2. ]

title: Canadian Showman Takes On Broadway With a Swagger
description: Garth Drabinsky, the producer of "Kiss of the Spider Woman" and "Show Boat," has written his autobiography.

title: Italy Finds A Fugitive, One of Many
description: In the end, the bulky overcoat and floppy hat were not enough to hide the movie-star looks of Ferdinando Mach di Palmstein as his pursuers moved in.

title: Seiko Consolidates 2 Brands at Martin
description: The Seiko Corporation of America said yesterday that it had dismissed DDB Needham New York after less than a year handling its Seiko and Lassale watch brands by consolidating those brands, with billings estimated at $10 million, at the Martin Agency in Richmond, which handles Seiko's Pulsar brand.

title: Big Bang's Defenders Weigh Fudge Factor, A Blunder of Einstein's, As Fix for New Crisis
description: EVEN though the universe has infinite ways of humbling them, cosmologists are nothing if not resilient and endlessly creative. They have to be, given their daunting task of standing on the shore of a small world and looking beyond the harbor lights of nearby stars to the arching waves of clustered galaxies, seeking on far horizons glimpses of the entire cosmic history, from beginning to probable end.

title: Family of Errant Genes Is Found to Be Related To Variety of Skeletal Ills
description: FORGET the great human heart and brain, the eyes that see sweeping vistas, the lips that declare "I am"; the real thing standing between us and primordial ooze is the human skeleton. Built of 206 bones, 29 in the skull alone, the skeleton is a living cathedral of ivory vaults, ribs and buttresses -- a structure at once light and strong, flexible and firm.

title: Cadets See Aberration, Not Tailhook Scandal
description: For years, the United States Military Academy has conducted a half-dozen classes a semester on relations between men and women, including frank discussions of sexual harassment and incidents like the Tailhook scandal.

title: ALLIANT TO BUY HERCULES INC.'S AEROSPACE OPERATIONS
description: Alliant Techsystems Inc. has signed a definitive agreement to acquire Hercules Inc.'s aerospace operations for $412 million in cash and stock, about 12 percent less than the price first announced in July. On Friday, the company said its definitive agreement would be less than the $465 million value announced before. The agreement calls for Alliant to pay less cash and more stock for the unit and buy back 57 percent fewer shares. Under the agreement, Hercules will get $300 million in cash and 3.86 million new shares of Alliant stock valued at $29 a share. With the acquisition, Alliant will be a $1.4 billion company employing about 10,200 workers.

title: Southern Indiana Gas & Electric Co.(SIG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Almost Perfect Marathon Presence
description: The blue line that marks the 26.2- mile course will be interspersed with silver, and the sky will be full of red, white and blue tributes, but for all the embellishments of the 25th New York City Marathon on Sunday, to Arturo Montero it will just be more of the same.

title: CHRONICLE
description: "It's very hard to be the President," the comedian PAUL REISER told the audience at the Presidential Gala at Ford's Theater in Washington on Sunday evening, "but you get a lot of perks that no other job has. For example, your own theme song. That's very cool, the whole 'Hail to the Chief' thing."

title: Philip Morris and RJR Nabisco
description: A ruling clearing the way for a wide-ranging class-action suit against the tobacco industry had different effects on the shares of Philip Morris and RJR Nabisco. A planned stock sale helped lift RJR.

title: Baltimore Orioles Hire Syd Thrift
description: SYD THRIFT, let go earlier this month by the Chicago Cubs, was hired yesterday by the Baltimore Orioles as the team's director of player development. Thrift will be in charge of the Orioles' minor league operations. He replaces DOUG MELVIN, who left Baltimore to become general manager of the Texas Rangers.

title: Coastal Healthcare Group Inc.(CGRP,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 1,350,000, or 7 cents a share, for acquisition and related expenses in the quarter; the 9 months was after an extraordinary charge of $ 6,111,000, or 31 cents a share, for acquisition and related expenses, which included loss of $ 402,000, or 2 cents a share, for unrealized loss on investment in marketable securities.c-Stated on pro-forma basis to provide for income taxes on pooled S corporation earnings before acquisitions at the effective tax rates, in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included an extraordinary charge of $ 1,350,000, or 8 cents a share, for acquisition and related expenses.Year-ago periods were restated to include results of Medical Management Associates Inc., Health Management Associates Inc., Southeast Health Systems Inc. and Medical Associates Systems Inc., which were acquired in pooling-of-interests transactions during the first six months of 1994.

title: Red Sox Don't Exercise Berryhill Option
description: The Boston Red Sox declined yesterday to exercise their $1.2 million option on DAMON BERRYHILL, and the catcher immediately filed for free agency. Berryhill, 30, hit .263 in 82 games this past season with 6 homers and 34 runs batted in.

title: Coast Savings Financial Inc.(CSA,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeShare earnings are fully diluted.Coast Savings said its single-family adjustable rate loan originations during the latest third quarter reached an all-time quarterly high, and said nonperforming assets were reduced to $ 209 million, the lowest level since 1987.(Loss)

title: CIGNA TO SELL MOST OF REINSURANCE LINE
description: The Cigna Corporation said yesterday that it would sell most of its international property and casualty reinsurance business to the St. Paul Companies and the Employers Reinsurance Corporation. Terms of the two transactions were not disclosed. The move is part of Cigna's effort to focus more on profitable businesses like trucking and workers' compensation. Reinsurance has been a money loser for Cigna for five years. The acquisition would expand St. Paul's effort to move into the international market for reinsurance, which is essentially insurance coverage for insurance companies. Cigna also said its third-quarter profit before investment gains was $122 million, or $1.69 a share, in contrast to a loss a year earlier of $167 million.

title: Giants Waiting for the Hard Times to Go
description: Embarrassed by the team's five-game losing streak, one Giants player said he was hesitant about calling his mother this week because every time he does she gives him an earful about what the team needs to do to win. Another Giant gets almost three messages a week from friends around the league making fun of the team: "Beep. Nice squad, dude. Beep."

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Sunday about discontent among black voters referred incorrectly in some editions to a Philadelphia resident who said she would not vote this year. She is Bernadette Smith, not Bernadette Handyman.

title: Whitman Approves Stringent Restrictions on Sex Criminals
description: Convicted sex offenders in New Jersey will now be subject to lifetime supervision under a package of laws signed today by Gov. Christine Todd Whitman. Critics, particularly civil libertarians, say that the bills, among the nation's toughest, contain more symbolism than substance and are heading for a certain constitutional challenge.

title: Bolstered Clinton Campaigns for Allies
description: No longer seen by some beleaguered Democrats as a political liability, President Clinton today began an eight-day swing around the country to campaign for candidates in tight races that will help determine who controls Congress next year.

title: Safeguard Scientifics Inc.(SFE,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Includes gains of $ 6,287,000 in the third quarter and $ 10,337,000 in the 9 months, from sales of securities.c-Included gains of $ 387,000 in the quarter and $ 5,038,000 in the 9 months, from sales of securities.Share earnings and shares outstanding were adjusted to reflect 2-for-1 stock split effective Sept. 7.

title: Corrections
description: A report in the Chronicle column on Oct. 21 about Edwin Cossitt, the director and producer of the "Angels on Ice" benefit for Gay Men's Health Crisis, included an erroneous reference, supplied by the group and Mr. Cossitt, to the national Canadian men's skating champion for 1964. The Senior Men's Canadian champion for that year was Charles Snell ing, not Mr. Cossitt.

title: Panel's Sex Abuse Report
description: A Board of Education commission yesterday recommended varied strategies, including screening of all employees and fingerprinting of volunteers, to prevent sexual abuse in the city's public schools.

title:
HORSE RACING;
Lukas and Tabasco Cat in Breeders' Cup Reunion
description: The lives of the trainer Jeff Lukas and the colt Tabasco Cat have been on parallel yet diverse paths since they became forever intertwined last December, but they have been reunited here this week with the kind of muted celebration that has marked so much of Lukas's rehabilitation from a serious brain injury.

title: Con Ed Admits to Conspiracy To Cover Up Asbestos in Blast
description: After five years of denials, Con Edison admitted in court yesterday that for four crucial days in 1989 it failed to tell Federal authorities that asbestos had been released into the air when a steam pipe exploded near Gramercy Park in Manhattan.

title: A Voice for the Voiceless That Still Thunders
description: "Frederick Douglass: When the Lion Wrote History" confirms its subject's crucial place in the struggle of America's blacks of his time even as it demonstrates his relevance more than a century after the end of slavery.

title: New Help Planned for Homeless Veterans
description: Recognizing that thousands of homeless, mentally ill veterans were missing out on Federal benefits and services, city, state and Federal officials are planning a new effort to find and assist veterans with housing and psychiatric needs.

title: Animals Too Pay Cost of Pain
description: To the Editor:

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about efforts to shut a mine in Cortlandt, N.Y., misidentified the neighborhood resident who led opposition to the mine. He was Ralph G. Mastromonaco, not Mark Weiss.

title: DONNA KARAN GETS NEW $125 MILLION CREDIT LINE
description: The Donna Karan Company, the New York-based designer apparel and cosmetics company, said yesterday that it had received a new $125 million credit line from a group of five banks led by Citibank. The new line replaces a $110 million credit line, which was originally set up as short-term financing to provide the company with funds during an initial public stock offering the company planned a year ago. The offering was canceled when its business slowed, and the company has struggled to find new financing since. The new credit agreement extends through 1998, which should alleviate the pressure on the company to find additional financing.

title: California Federal Bank (CAL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 273,700,000, or $ 6.57 a share.c-Net lossThe latest quarter included a gain of $ 135 million on sale of the Southeast division.The latest period included a $ 280 million provision for second and third quarter bulk sales.(Loss)

title: Cigna Corp. (CI,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After total charges of $ 35 million, including a $ 9 million, or 12 cents a share, restructuring charge for substantial withdrawal from the property and casualty reinsurance business, and a $ 26 million, or 36 cents a share, charge for property and casualty reinsurance reserve strengthening, in the quarter and 9 months.c-Net lossd-Included charge of $ 244 million, or $ 3.39 a share, for litigation expenses, in the quarter and 9 months. Both periods also included charges of $ 107 million, or $ 1.49 a share, for restructuring and $ 16 million, or 22 cents a share, for reinsurance exposure.The latest periods also included investment gains of $ 1 million, or 1 cent a share, in the quarter and $ 30 million, or 41 cents a share, in the 9 months. Year-ago periods also included investment gains of $ 73 million, or $ 1.01 a share, and $ 122 million, or $ 1.69 a share, in year-ago periods, respectively.(Loss)

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-17 HAITI'S CAPITAL IS BUSTLING

title: Williams Tastes Victory at Prime-Time Debut
description: At least Venus Williams didn't have to worry about choosing a Halloween costume for tonight's festivities: A player making her professional tennis debut on the WTA Tour usually settles for tennis whites and a familiar pair of sneakers.

title: New York State Election Choices; Karen Burstein for Attorney General
description: Both candidates in the race for state attorney general boast acceptable credentials. The Republican, Dennis Vacco, is a former U.S. Attorney in Buffalo. The Democrat, Karen Burstein, has served as a state legislator, commissioner and judge. Who would do the better job? The clear answer is Ms. Burstein, and we are pleased to endorse her.

title: Biogen Inc.(BGEN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeThe third quarter results included a pretax charge to earnings of $ 25 million as a result of the company's decision to discontinue its Hirulog development program. The reserve relates entirely to third-party expenses associated with the manufacturing of drug supplies and wind-down of clinical trial activities.(Loss)Revenue represented total revenues.

title: Here Come the Republocrats
description: I am possibly the most voting-obsessed young adult in America. Since I turned 18 in 1981, I have never missed a chance to vote. I have cast ballots in general elections, primaries, runoffs, special elections and referendums. I have voted by absentee ballot, punch card and voting machine. I spent my 20's arguing with friends about the importance of exercising their right to vote.

title: The Classic Hears the Thunder of the European Herd
description: It is a race deserted by Holy Bull, deep-sixed by Colonial Affair and won last year by the 133-1 long shot Arcangues. So, here they come, six horses from Europe with credentials and with hopes of catching the eight from America in their richest race, the $3 million Breeders' Cup Classic.

title: Russian Tied to Stock Scheme Gains Election to Parliament
description: In thin voting after a bizarre campaign, the head of the MMM pyramid scheme, Sergei I. Mavrodi, won a seat in Parliament, along with its immunity against prosecution, in a special election Sunday, local officials announced today.

title: Loewen Group (LWNGF,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Banco Latinoamericano de Exportaciones S.A. (BLX,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Female Sailors Just Want to Compete
description: It was an ill-conceived question that was ambiguous at best. It came across as a poison dart in a jungle where men and big boats have hunted for 143 years.

title: New Lines Of Modems By Motorola
description: Motorola Inc., trying to broaden its industry-leading market share in modems, will introduce today its first modems to be sold through retail outlets. The Lifestyle series is aimed at the growing home market for personal computers, while the Power series includes technology to improve their operation with cellular telephones.

title: Liberty Corp.(LC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 3,561,000, or 18 cents a share, for tax law changes, and after a charge of $ 11,940,000, or 61 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest periods included investment loss of $ 842,000, or 4 cents a share, in the quarter and an investment gain of $ 500,000, or 2 cents a share, in the 9 months. Year-ago periods included investment gains of $ 1,478,000, or 7 cents a share, and $ 7,309,000, or 37 cents a share, in the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: Mexican Drops Plan to Buy Most Westin Hotels
description: An ambitious young Mexican entrepreneur has abandoned his plan to purchase most of the Westin hotel chain for $708 million.

title: Rivers's Healing Status May Ease Knicks Logjam
description: Doc Rivers said today that he expects to begin the season on the injured list, temporarily helping the Knicks' overcrowded-roster problem.

title: Huntington Bancshares Inc.(HBAN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Huntington Bancshares said the lower third quarter earnings are primarily due to a dramatic reduction in mortgage banking income coupled with compression in the company's net interest margin. The mortgage banking drop has resulted partially from lower production levels during 1994 - an industry-wide phenomenon. Originations for the first nine months were $ 1.9 billion, compared with $ 4.4 billion in the same period of 1993.The bank said it expects to have a loss of about $ 10 million this year from its Huntington Mortgage Co. subsidiary, compared with net income of $ 15 million in 1993.Results for 1993 have been restated to reflect the acquisition of Railroadmen's Federal Savings & Loan Association in the fourth quarter of last year.

title: Another Shutout in the Progress League
description: Another Monday, another secret meeting, another report of no progress.

title: Supreme Court Roundup SUPREME COURT ROUNDUP; Justices Agree to Consider if University Should Finance a Student Religious Magazine
description: Accepting a case at the intersection of free speech and religion, the Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether a state university must subsidize student-run religious publications if it gives other student publications financial support.

title: Coors (Adolph) Co.  (ACCOB,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
Corestates Financial Corp.(CFL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 3,430,000, or 2 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.c-After a charge of $ 13,010,000, or 9 cents a share, from an accounting adjustment.Year-ago results restated to included Constellation Bancorp, which was acquired on March 16 and Independence Bancorp, which was acquired on June 27.

title: Questions Seen on Tests For Growth Mutations
description: NONE of the new studies of growth factor receptors are likely to lead to treatments for skeletal disorders any time soon. Yet, because the mutations are unusually specific, designing genetic tests based on them should be quite easy. Who should be allowed to use the tests is far less obvious.

title: Market Place; A brokerage house makes bridge loans without losing its shirt.
description: REMEMBER bridge loans? They almost destroyed some big brokerage houses a few years ago when it turned out the bridges had no foundations. But one firm kept making bridge loans all along, and this year is making more than ever before.

title: Lottery's New Millionaire Says He's Keeping His Old Tastes
description: A $45,000-a-year toolmaker from an upstate village -- who bowls every Sunday night, has 130,000 miles on his truck and just borrowed money to finish a house he's worked on for ages -- gulped like a Frank Capra character at the television cameras and microphones yesterday and said aw, shucks, to the $18,125,000 New York Lottery jackpot he won over the weekend.

title: Oakley Nears Pact Extension
description: The Knicks and Charles Oakley are close to agreeing on a contract extension, and the deal may be signed as early as tomorrow.

title: Russians Struggle to Clean Up Spill
description: "More Usinsk oil for the Motherland!" urges a slogan written in red across the rooftop of the tallest building on Construction Workers' Boulevard in this remote Russian city.

title: Grace & Rothschild Wins Mobil Account
description: The Mobil Corporation has expanded its agency roster again by selecting Grace & Rothschild in New York to handle its Mobil 1 motor oil account, which had been at DDB Needham New York for more than 30 years. Billings were estimated at $15 million.

title: Cavaliers Sign the Ex-Knick Campbell
description: The Cleveland Cavaliers yesterday signed TONY CAMPBELL, an unrestricted free agent guard-forward. The 10-year National Basketball Association veteran started last season with the Knicks.

title: Boy, 15, Is Shot to Death As 2 Gunmen Beat Nanny
description: Two men wearing Halloween masks pistol-whipped a nanny outside a home in Flushing, Queens, and then fatally shot a 15-year-old boy in her charge yesterday as he rushed to help her, the police said.

title: Unocal Corp. (UCL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charges of $ 4 million in the quarter and $ 31 million in the 9 months for the write-down of investment and provision for abandonment and remediation of the Guadalupe oil field; a gain of $ 10 million in the quarter and $ 12 million in the 9 months on asset sales; and other charges of $ 5 million and $ 10 million in the quarter and 9 months, respectively. The 9 months also included a charge of $ 17 million for litigation and a gain of $ 24 million for the Mesa settlement.c-Included charges of $ 15 million in the quarter and $ 24 million in the 9 months for litigation; gains of $ 9 million and $ 66 million in the quarter and 9 months, respectively, on asset sales; both periods included a charge of $ 14 million related to the effect of federal tax rate changes on deferred taxes; and other charges of $ 1 million in the quarter and $ 6 million in the 9 months.Year-ago 9 months also included a charge of $ 121 million for the cumulative effect of accounting changes for adoption of SFAS 106, and a charge of $ 9 million for the cumulative effect of accounting changes for adoption of SFAS 112.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Oct. 8 about the reopening of public access to the 3.2-acre gravesite of President John F. Kennedy and his widow, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, and two of their children, referred imprecisely to the grave markers. The markers are fashioned from black slate quarried in Monson, Me., not from granite, according to a letter from the monument maker; irregular stones situated around the graves are Cape Cod granite.

title: Dinosaur Jr.'s Clinic In Anesthesia Rock
description: There are a few things one should know about Dinosaur Jr., which played on Friday night at Roseland. First of all, though it performs as a trio, the 10-year-old band currently exists only as a vehicle for the songs, solos and obsessions of its front man, the anti-hero of alternative rock guitar, J Mascis. Mr. Mascis is the crown prince of slackers: he functions at the lowest energy level possible in interviews, on the stage and in life. Life, if one is to believe Mr. Mascis' songs of dashed hopes and heartbreak, is an ever-widening wound that is best borne under heavy anesthesia.

title: 4 Witnesses Testify About Shooting at Clinic
description: Facing the death penalty if convicted of the shooting deaths of an abortion clinic doctor and an escort here, Paul J. Hill had nothing to say to the jury today as he acted as his own lawyer on the opening day of his state trial.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Frenchmen Advance in Paris Open Cedric Pioline and Arnaud Boetsch, the top players in France, had opening-round victories yesterday at the Paris Open. Boetsch rallied to beat Jaime Yzaga of Peru, 4-6, 6-3, 6-1, while Pioline defeated Patrick Rafter of Australia, 6-4, 6-2. Among the other matches, Petr Korda of The Czech Republic beat Aaron Krickstein, 6-3, 6-1, and Renzo Furlan of Italy beat Chuck Adams, 6-7 (5-7), 7-6 (7-4), 6-4. The 16 seeded players received first-round byes. Pete Sampras is top-seeded while the defending champion, Goran Ivanisevic, is seeded second. (AP)

title: Don't Look For Esiason To Cry Ouch!
description: The question has dogged Boomer Esiason since his Super Bowl days: Does anything hurt?

title: FirstFed MichiganCorp.(FFOM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included write-offs related to branch sales of $ 1.6 million, or 8 cents a share, in the latest quarter and 9 months, and of $ 4.9 million, or 26 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter and 9 months.c-Included an extraordinary restructuring charge of $ 9,147,000, or 49 cents a share, and a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 31,948,000, or $ 1.71 a share.d-Net income(Loss)

title: Gold Drops to 2-Month Low As Inflation Worries Ease
description: Gold plunged yesterday to its lowest price in two months on signs that inflation remained subdued. On other markets, gasoline and soybeans fell, pushing the Commodity Research Bureau index of 21 commodities down 1.18 point, to 233.30.

title: McCall Seeks a Balance Of His Resume and Race
description: "I am very delighted to be here, because this is where it all started," H. Carl McCall, the state's comptroller, said the other day to a small crowd in the heart of Bedford-Stuyvesant. "My very first job in New York was just a few blocks away from here on Bedford Avenue, at the Bedford Y.M.C.A. I came here as a social worker. Major Owens knows this. He was working in the library."

title: Ralcorp Holdings Inc.(RAH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Excluded the effects of 1993 accounting changes.Year-ago fourth quarter and both year periods are pro forma. Ralcorp was formed as an independent company following a spin-off from Ralston Purina Co. on March 31, 1994, halfway through the fiscal year. The pro forma numbers include interest expense on incremental borrowings and additional costs associated with becoming a stand-alone company and assumes the costs were in place for all of fiscal 1993 and the first two quarters of 1994.Pro forma results for 1993 also assume the inclusion for the entire fiscal year of results for the Breckenridge ski area, which was acquired in May 1993.Ralcorp Holdings said that without the pro forma adjustment, the company recorded sales of $ 987 million and net income of $ 53.6 million, or $ 1.59 a share, in the latest fiscal year, compared with sales of $ 902.8 million and net income of $ 42.6 million, or $ 1.23 a share, in year-earlier period. Excluding 1993 accounting charges, net income for fiscal 1993 was $ 51.9 million, or $ 1.50 a share.Ralcorp said net income for the year-ago fourth quarter was affected by adjustments to advertising and promotion expense recorded earlier that year and a retroactive increase in the federal tax rate. The net effect of the adjustments was an increase in earnings of 9 cents a share for the quarter.

title: Iranian Writers Ask for an End To Censorship
description: A group of dissident Iranian writers has called for the abolition of censorship in Iran in an open letter sent to news organizations, saying, "Writers must be free to create their work and express themselves."

title: Howell Corp.(HWL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest periods were after preferred dividends of $ 603,000 in the quarter and $ 1,811,000 in the 9 months, compared with $ 604,000 and $ 1,054,000 in year-ago periods, respectively.

title: Central Park Joggers Need Better Lighting
description: To the Editor:

title: Observer; The Big Hog Wallow
description: Money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money, money --

title: An Atlas of Information Services
description: ASTRONOMERS now conclude that the universe is expanding more rapidly than previously thought. If they would turn their attention to the electronic universe, they would see some really high-speed expansion.

title: Man Held in Robberies of 50 Lottery Stores
description: After a month of stake-outs at dozens of all-night groceries and newsstands in South Brooklyn, the police have arrested a 21-year-old man who they believe has robbed at least 50 lottery stores at gunpoint since March.

title: Poles Review Postwar Treatment of Germans
description: For nearly 50 years, the fate of the millions of ethnic Germans rounded up and expelled by the victorious Communists from the eastern provinces of the Reich and western Poland at the end of World War II has been passed over in silence by most of the rest of the world.

title: Brooks Bros. Chief Resigns
description: William J. Roberti, the president and chief executive of Brooks Brothers, resigned yesterday to pursue other opportunities, according to Christopher Littmoden, director of Marks & Spencer P.L.C., the parent company of Brooks Brothers.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title:
PRO FOOTBALL: TV SPORTS;
If It Comes to Health, Don't Come to Player
description: Momma always told me, ESPN's Joe Theismann is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're going to get.

title: Oklahoma Gas & Electric Co.(OGE,N) reports earnings for 12mos to Sept 30
CUOMO AND PATAKI GO TO LONG ISLAND IN HUNT FOR VOTES
description: The two candidates for governor campaigned today in vote-rich and voter-angry Long Island, a traditional Republican stronghold where Mario M. Cuomo sees new opportunity in the closing days of the race and where Republican infighting has weakened his rival, State Senator George E. Pataki.

title: More Catalogues Clogging Mailboxes This Year
description: Thought you got a lot of mail-order catalogues last year? Just wait. Catalogue retailers say the 1994 holiday season is breaking all records for mailbox clutter.

title: Corrections
description: A report in the Company News column of Business Day on Thursday about the expansion plans of Stein Mart Inc. misidentified the company's headquarters city. It is Jacksonville, Fla., not Baltimore.

title: Parking Rules
description: Alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended today for the religious holiday of All Saints' Day.

title: Gunman Arraigned
description: A former Army medic accused of raking the White House with rifle fire on Saturday was charged with four felonies yesterday, and a Federal magistrate ordered him to undergo a psychiatric evaluation.

title: Fleet Financial Group (FLT,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
It's a Lovely Place, With Space to Die For
description: EVERYONE agreed it was a lovely day for a tour. The sun bounced off the stained glass windows along mausoleum row. The sycamores and weeping willows swayed sweetly above the old tombstones.

title: Digital Wine Steward Caters to Individuals
description: THE subject prefers poundcake or fresh fruit to a hot fudge sundae. Also, he likes Bartlett pears; cola; coffee and tea, both without cream and sugar; baked fish with sauce, and grilled chicken.

title: Paine Increases Incentives
description: The Paine Webber Group Inc. said yesterday that had increased the incentives it was offering to the brokers at Kidder, Peabody & Company, in an effort to keep them from defecting to rival firms.

title: Rooney Faces Intoxication Charge
description: A former trainer for MIKE TYSON and LARRY HOLMES now working with VINNIE PAZIENZA was charged over the weekend with driving while intoxicated and assaulting a police officer.

title: Jersey City School Voucher Plan Is Weak
description: To the Editor:

title: Dublin Journal; Women's Movement in Ireland Slows to a Crawl
description: When a prominent leader of the women's movement, Frances Fitzgerald, was elected to Parliament two years ago, both her own career and the movement itself seemed on the rise in a conservative society where gains for women have been slower than elsewhere in Western Europe.

title: S.E.C. Mulls Shift on Bond Markups
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is considering abandoning a proposal that would have required municipal bond dealers to disclose commissions on some trades, a member of the agency said today.

title: COLLEGE SOCCER REPORT
description: Big East The strength of the conference had gone from Connecticut to Seton Hall to St. John's. Now it appears to be Georgetown's turn. The Hoyas, whose sports centerpiece has been basketball for years, captured their first regular-season title in soccer with a 2-1 overtime triumph over St. John's on Saturday.

title: Ohio University Fires Head Coach
description: Ohio University's football coach, TOM LICHTENBERG, was fired yesterday, two days after his team dropped to 0-8 on the season. Lichtenberg, in his fifth year at the university, will be reassigned in the athletic department after completing this season. The team has three games left.

title: Long Island Bancorp (LISB,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 8,648,000.c-Net loss and included a $ 70,809,000 writeoff of excess cost over fair value of net assets acquired in both the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a $ 47,222,000 amortization of excess of cost over fair value of net assets acquired and a charge of $ 323,545,000 from an accounting adjustment.Long Island Bancorp completed its initial public offer on April 14, 1994.The bank said its net income for fiscal 1994 reflects restructuring activities that were recorded in 1993 whcih included the effects of the sale of $ 836.3 million in deposits, the bulk sale of about $ 124 million of non-performing assets and the elimination of $ 441.6 million of goodwill that had been created by two government assisted supervisory acquisitions in the 1980s.(Loss)

title: By Design; Wardrobes Full of Satin
description: The bias-cut satin dress was last spring's surprise hit, crossing over from evening into day when worn under a jacket or sweater. But satin is not just for dresses. It was also used for jackets, pants, skirts, vests and shirts in the fall and resort collections. It showed up in the spring '95 shows in Europe and is being seen in the New York spring shows that started over the weekend.

title: JAZZ
description: Jazzmobile Celebrates Itself and Black Heroes Avery Fisher Hall

title: New League Plans Partnership for Clubs and Players
description: Learning a lesson from Major League Baseball, the United Baseball League, which will be unveiled today, plans to begin with a "true partnership" between clubs and players. The league, according to its confidential proposal, will offer players 35 percent of a team's pretax profits and a 10 percent equity share in all teams collectively.

title: Forget About the Polls! Hurricanes Are No. 1, A Losing Coach Says
description: Forget Nebraska and Penn State. Syracuse will be playing the No. 1 team, Miami, on Saturday in the Carrier Dome according to one authority, Coach Frank Beamer of Virginia Tech.

title: Magna Group (MAGI,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Pfizer Obtains Namic and Its Chief
description: As a young computer programmer working on contract at the Namic U.S.A. Corporation, Cynthia L. Morris became quite knowledgeable about the company, a maker of specialty medical products. Indeed, in a dazzling ascent, she was hired to help develop new products at age 25, promoted to president at 29 and became chief executive at 31.

title: POP
description: Pews Are Moved for Dancing To Music of Cajun Masters Landmark on the Park

title: MAGMA BOARD REJECTS A TAKEOVER PROPOSAL
description: The Magma Power Company said yesterday that it was rejecting the California Energy Company's latest takeover proposal, for $925 million, and that it would consider alternative proposals. In rebuffing California Energy's offer as inadequate, the board of Magma, based in San Diego, opened the door to other partnerships or transactions that would maintain the value created by the bidding that has raised its shares more than 41 percent. Magma executives said that other parties had approached the company in recent weeks. California Energy, based in Omaha, raised its offer last week to $38.50 in cash per share for 51 percent of Magma's stock. The remaining 49 percent would get $20 a share in cash and $18.50 in California Energy stock.

title: West Point Cadets Face Investigation In Sex Harassment
description: Five members of the United States Military Academy's football team are to face an official inquiry this week at West Point after being accused of groping female cadets who were part of a pep rally crowd that ran past a cordon of football players at the Academy's game-week festivities.

title: Pollution-Control Efforts Zero In on Pleasure Boats
description: Car exhaust has gotten cleaner and cleaner over the years, with catalytic converters and other refinements, but motorboat engines still have all the pollution controls of a '57 Chevy.

title: MINORITIES JOIN CALIFORNIA FIGHT
description: No state is more racially and ethnically diverse than California, and now California's minority communities are beginning to rally against Proposition 187, the immigration-control proposal that has become the hottest campaign issue in the state this fall.

title: AIDS Drugs Fail to Curb Dementia and Nerve Damage
description: DESPITE widespread use of drugs to combat the AIDS virus, which earlier studies had shown to protect against infections that affect the brain and central nervous system, the incidence of such damage is increasing among those with the disease, a new study from a large Federal AIDS project has found.

title: Homestake Mining Co.(HM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included nonrecurring gains totaling $ 23.8 million after taxes.c-Included $ 12.9 million tax benefit from sale of North American Metals Corp., in the quarter and 9 months.

description: b-Included writeoff of $ 10.7 million, or 82 cents a share, for the valuation of goodwill acquired prior to fiscal 1994.c-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 5,803,000, or 45 cents a share.

title: Geneva Steel Co.(GNV,N) reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss on early repayment of debt of $ 9,534,000, or 63 cents a share.(Loss)

title: The Forgotten Serbs
description: In the hall of mirrors that is Bosnian diplomacy, the West especially the five-country "contact group" -- treats Radovan Karadzic and Gen. Ratko Mladic as the sole representatives of the Bosnian Serbs. In reality, they are not.

title: Wisconsin Central Transportation Corp.(WCLX,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-The quarter included equity in the earnings of New Zealand Rail Ltd. of $ 3 million, or 18 cents a share, and included in this amount is a nonrecurring capital gain of $ 2.1 million, or 12 cents a share, on the sale of NZRL's investment in a telecommunications company. The 9 months included equity in the earnings of NZRL of $ 7.5 million, or 45 cents a share.c-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 1,398,000, or 8 cents a share, on loss from early debt repayment, and after a charge of $ 2.067,000, or 13 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Per share data reflected 2-for-1 stock split paid July 5, 1994.

description: b-Net lossYear-ago per share earnings and shares outstanding are not available. The company was under conseratorship prior to Aug. 19, 1993.(Loss)

title: Head of Strong To Start Firm
description: Andrew Ziegler, president of Strong/Corneliuson Capital Management, resigned today to start his own firm.

description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 887,000, or 12 cents a share, on loss from early retirement of debt, in the quarter and 9 months.

description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 1,300,000, or 3 cents a share.Latest 9 months' revenues excluded $ 18.4 million gain on sale of credit card relationships.

title: Nine Years of Resolve; Trial to Begin in a Daughter's Death
description: Libby Zion's death in 1984 at New York Hospital was not going to be just another unexplained tragedy, soon forgotten by almost everyone. Her father, Sidney Zion, would see to that.

title: Rowland Police File Is Ordered Released
description: The State Freedom of Information Commission today ordered the release of a police report on a domestic dispute in April between John G. Rowland, the Republican candidate for governor, and his ex-wife.

title: OHM Corp.(OHM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Revenue is net revenues.

title: Plane Waiting to Land at O'Hare Crashes in Indiana, Killing 68
description: A twin-engine commuter airplane owned by a subsidiary of American Airlines, fighting a gusty rainstorm on the way to O'Hare International Airport in Chicago, crashed yesterday in a cold Indiana soybean field. All 68 people on board were killed, officials said.

title: New York State Election Choices; State Legislative Races
description: Few incumbents face serious challenge this year, which reflects more on the state's closed political process than voter happiness with the State Legislature. Here are our choices in some of the more interesting races in New York City and the surrounding suburbs.

title: Investors' Suit Allowed
description: The Supreme Court refused today to referee a dispute about whether mortgage investments qualify as securities under Federal law.

title: Quebecor Inc.(PQB,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax charge of $ 14 million, or 21 cents a share, related to the rationalization of an operating unit.c-Included a loss on dilution of $ 400,000, or 1 cent a share.Share earnings are fully diluted.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, a news analysis article yesterday about a potential rift between the United States and its allies over Bosnia misstated the cause. It is a threat by Congress to order an end to the arms embargo that has left Bosnian Government forces at a disadvantage, not the Administration's strategy on the issue.

title: Rain Men: Packers Take Battle of Soldier Swamp
description: "I've never played in conditions like that. It was like playing in Hurricane Camille, except it was 80 degrees cooler," said Green Bay quarterback Brett Favre, who ran for one touchdown and passed for another. "It was unbelievable. I went out in pregame and said, 'I might not complete a pass,' and I almost lived up to it."

title: The Dollar Resumes Its Fall As Bonds and Stocks Falter
description: The dollar fell against most other leading currencies yesterday as the American bond market sagged.

title: CUNY Trustees Vow a Fight Against Mayor's Budget Cut
description: The chancellor and trustees of the City University of New York vowed yesterday to fight the Mayor's proposed midyear budget cut of $7 million, which officials said would turn away 7,000 prospective students in January, require staff and faculty layoffs and curtail adult literacy programs.

title: Showboat Inc.(SBO,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 3,131,000 in the quarter and $ 10,194,000 in the 9 months of income from operations of unconsolidated affiliates, and $ 800,000 write-off from termination of agreement with the St. Regis Mohawk Tribe, for both periods.c-Included extraordinary charge of $ 6,679,000, or 44 cents a share, on loss from extinguishment of debt, and after a gain of $ 556,000, or 3 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: UNION PACIFIC TO SELL ITS HAZARDOUS WASTE UNIT
description: The Union Pacific Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to sell its hazardous waste unit, Uspci Inc., to Laidlaw Inc. of Burlington, Ontario, for $225 million. The purchase would also include the assumption of certain financial and environmental liabilities by Laidlaw. The Union Pacific unit provides complete waste management services. Laidlaw provides environmental management and transportation services to municipalities and industries in North America. Union Pacific, based in Bethlehem, Pa., operates a railroad, a motor freight business and mining businesses.

title: Czechs Celebrate Traditions Of the Other Classical Crucible
description: A disproportionately large fraction of the classical repertory stems from small Central European countries that have cultivated great music over the centuries in an intense greenhouse atmosphere. Austria possesses the most illustrious of these everlasting traditions, but Czech musical history is nearly as remarkable. The whole panorama of Czech music was celebrated in an absorbing daylong festival in the Winter Garden of the World Financial Center on Sunday.

title: Questions Are Raised In Phone-Video Venture
description: The chairmen of three regional telephone companies said today that they planned to spend at least $300 million starting a video programming venture with the Creative Artists Agency, raising questions about the agency's growing power in Hollywood.

title: Wilmington Coach Reinstates Players
description: Wilmington (Ohio) College's football coach, MIKE WALLACE, has reinstated most of the 40 players he suspended Friday for violating the team's ban on alcohol consumption. Wallace said yesterday that he admired the players for admitting their violations of the drinking ban when the coach asked the team about it at a meeting Friday. (AP)

title: Cleveland Agency Gets Rally's Account
description: Rally's Inc. in Louisville, Ky., the fast-food chain specializing in hamburgers sold at drive-through restaurants, has ended its relationship with McCabe & Company in New York after three years. As a result, the account, with billings estimated at $10 million, has been moved to Meldrum & Fewsmith in Cleveland.

title: Anchor Bancorp Inc.(ABKR,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
It's the Economy Again, as Democrats Attack the 'Contract With America'
description: In their advertisements and campaign speeches, many Democrats assert that the Republicans' "Contract With America" would entail massive cuts in Government programs ranging from Social Security and Medicare to student loans and border security.

title: Reality's Chaos, Translated Into Art
description: UNDER MY SKIN Volume One of My Autobiography, to 1949 By Doris Lessing 419 pages. HarperCollins. $25.

title: Loyola Capital Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Killing Pain, Ending Life
description: Not long ago I consulted in the case of a 65-year-old woman who had advanced heart disease and intermittent chest pain. For five days a bevy of doctors gave every test and treatment they could think of. Finally her attending physician asked if there was anything else I thought he should do. When I replied no, he said, "Then we're going to start a morphine drip."

title: West Bank Legal Status Is Based on U.N.
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge Blocks Repatriation of Cuban Detainees
description: A Federal judge today issued a temporary restraining order to block the repatriation of Cuban refugees detained in camps at the United States naval base at Guantanamo Bay and in Panama.

title: Foundation Head Resigns
description: Art Becofsky has resigned as executive director of the Merce Cunningham Dance Foundation, the organization has announced. Mr. Becofsky was with the foundation for more than two decades. Michael Bloom, the company's director of education and media, is to serve as interim general manager until a new director is found.

title: Biogen Gives Up on a Drug And Takes Sizable Charge
description: In the fifth major setback for a biotechnology company in a month, Biogen Inc. said yesterday that it would not seek marketing approval for one of its most important drugs, Hirulog, because clinical trials had failed to show the drug to be more effective than an existing drug.

title: Giants' G.M. Is a Firm Believer: It's Better Not to Play It Again, Ref
description: The Giants have been victimized by several incorrect calls or no calls by officials in crucial situations in the last two weeks. But that hasn't swayed George Young, the Giants' general manager, to change his stance against using instant replay as a means to reverse incorrect calls. He's still against it.

title: CLASSICAL MUSIC
description: Music and Flourishes From a Keyboard Engineer Carnegie Hall

title: Swaran Singh, 87, Spokesman For India During War in 1971
description: Swaran Singh, Foreign Minister of India when it backed East Pakistan's breaking away from West Pakistan to form Bangladesh, died on Sunday in New Delhi, where he lived. He was 87.

title: Croatian Serbs Send Troops to Counter Bosnian Offensive
description: The leader of the Serbs in Croatia said today that he had dispatched a special police and military unit to assist the Bosnian Serbs in recapturing territory lost in recent days to resurgent Bosnian Government forces from the northwestern town of Bihac.

title: CLASSICAL MUSIC
description: From Rachmaninoff, The Voice as Instrument Merkin Concert Hall

title: MICRON TECHNOLOGY COMPLETES PACT TO BUY 89% OF ZEOS
description: Micron Technology Inc. completed a merger agreement yesterday to buy 89 percent of the struggling computer maker Zeos International Ltd. Under the terms of the agreement, two units of Micron Technology would trade their shares for about 79 percent of Zeos common stock, 10 percent would be held by individual employees of Micron and 11 percent would be retained by shareholders of Zeos. Zeos has 10 million shares outstanding, with a market value of $55 million, and Micron said the merger would include the issuance of an additional 81 million shares. Zeos, which makes computers and work stations, would become part of Micron Computer and Micron Custom Manufacturing Services.

title: Excesses With Medicaid: Hair Transplants?
description: State Senator George E. Pataki, the Republican candidate for governor, thinks it is terrible that Medicaid, the health-care program for the poor, would pay for hair transplants. But would it?

title: American Power Conversion Corp.(APCC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Fashion; The Incredible Lightness of Beene
description: In a season when many designers are so confused about what women want to wear in the 90's that they're looking backward for inspiration, Geoffrey Beene is, as always, looking ahead.

title: S.E.C. Study Backs Head Of Presstek
description: Robert Howard, chairman of Presstek Inc., and Howard Finkelstein are "definitely" not the same person, the Securities and Exchange Commission said yesterday.

title: Q&A
description: Nicotine Problems

title: Large Newspapers Report New Falloffs in Circulation
description: Nine of the 10 largest metropolitan newspapers in the country lost weekday circulation for the six months ending Sept. 30, compared with the period a year earlier, according to industry figures released yesterday.

title: Facing Social Problems: Proposals by Cuomo and Pataki Often Are Vague
description: In a gubernatorial campaign heavy with talk about crime and taxes, debate about the social problems that cost New Yorkers billions of dollars each year has been light.

title: Mikasa Inc.(MKS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A Woman With an Eye For Talent and Revolt
description: "Mother of All the Behans" is one of those celebrations of Irish lore, song and dance that often tend to leave the uninitiated feeling a bit left out. Fortunately, the one celebrating is Rosaleen Linehan, who weaves the tale with such enchantment that she converts Kathleen Behan's rather ordinary life story into a one-woman music hall.

title: Long Island Lighting Co.(LIL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TRANSACTIONS
description: Baseball American League

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; A new survey finds that for some brands and companies, logos can be image breakers.
description: THOUGH logos play a significant role in determining consumers' perceptions about brands and the companies marketing them, often it appears they can be more hindrance than help.

title: Sir John Pope-Hennessy, 80, Art Expert, Dies
description: Sir John Pope-Hennessy, a former museum director, an authority on the Italian Renaissance and the head of European painting at the Metropolitan Museum of Art from 1977 to 1986, died yesterday at his home in Florence. He was 80.

title: Mexican Candidate's Assassin Is Sentenced to 42 Years
description: The 23-year-old factory worker who admitted that he shot and killed Mexico's leading presidential candidate in March was convicted of murder today and sentenced to 42 years in prison.

title: AIDS Risk Held Twice As High In Women
description: WOMEN are more than twice as likely as men to become infected with the virus that causes AIDS during heterosexual sex, a study by an Italian research group reports.

title: Beating the Clock
description: Daylight is a gift of nature, but humans have successively taken it on themselves to measure, subdivide, standardize and even politicize nature's schedule. Once the motive was to help ancient Egyptian farmers predict the annual Nile flood. In modern times it is to synchronize everything from train schedules and prime-time television to working hours and private appointments.

title: Ruling Backs D'Amato Kin In Fraud Case
description: In a strong rebuke to Federal prosecutors, a Federal appeals court yesterday reversed the mail-fraud conviction of Armand P. D'Amato, the brother of Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato, saying there was insufficient evidence for a jury to reach a guilty verdict.

title: Chess; Boris Gulko, at 47 the oldest entrant, pours on the combinations to win the U.S. Championship.
description: Boris Gulko, a Fair Lawn, N.J., grandmaster, won the 1994 United States Championship last week in Key West, Fla., and along with it a place in the next stage of the International Chess Federation's world championship series. A former Soviet champion, Gulko was a dissident who survived several hunger strikes before he was allowed to leave the Soviet Union in 1986.

title: Treasury Prices Mixed In Slow Day
description: Prices of Treasury securities were mixed in subdued trading yesterday, with no follow-through buying from Friday's rally.

title: Data Give Tangled Picture of World Climate Between Glaciers
description: COULD a small push nudge the relatively benign and stable world climate of the last 10,000 years into abrupt and frequent cycles of warmth and extreme cold? The question is far from academic, some scientists say, given the possibility that heat-trapping gases like carbon dioxide could destabilize today's climate system.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: MISCONDUCT INQUIRY AT WEST POINT

title: F.T.C. SUES TO BLOCK ACQUISITION OF AMERICAN TOBACCO
description: The Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit yesterday to block B.A.T. Industries P.L.C.'s proposed $1 billion acquisition of the American Tobacco Company. The lawsuit, filed in Federal District Court in Manhattan, said the purchase of American Tobacco, a unit of American Brands Inc., would substantially reduce competition in the cigarette market. The companies agreed not to complete the deal until Dec. 5, when Judge Milton Pollack will hold a hearing on the commission's request for a preliminary injunction.

title: For Hunts, a Reckoning Is at Hand
description: Eight years ago, the Hunt brothers, Nelson Bunker and William Herbert, pitched their corporations into bankruptcy. Six years ago, they declared personal bankruptcy.

title: Amoco Canada reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income, which included a $ 100 million gain on the sale of noncore oil and gas properties, in the quarter and 9 months.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Changing ABM Treaty Reverses Arms Effort
description: To the Editor:

title: CHRONICLE
description: The word "righteous" does not often arise these days in connection with the British royal family. But it was the key to an honor that PRINCE PHILIP, the husband of Queen Elizabeth II, received in Jerusalem yesterday in the name of his mother, the late Princess Alice of Greece.

title: Patterns
description: Genesis of a Buzz

title: Baseball Files Charges Over Bonilla and Franco Threat
description: Less than a week after Bobby Bonilla and John Franco made threatening comments about the fate other players faced if they became strikebreakers next spring, the owners' labor relations committee yesterday filed an unfair labor practice charge against the two Mets' players and their union.

title: Ziff Is Selling Its Show Unit
description: The Ziff family agreed yesterday to sell its technology trade shows and conferences to the Softbank Corporation for $202 million. The conferences include Interop, an operator of computer trade shows.

title: Richard Cohen, 71, an Adviser To Major Jewish Organizations
description: Richard Cohen, a public relations adviser to several of the nation's largest national Jewish organizations, died yesterday at his home in Manhattan. He was 71.

title: Court Refused Track Star's Appeal in Defamation Case
description: The sweet but fleeting $27.3 million victory that Butch Reynolds won against the International Amateur Athletic Federation will remain only a memory for the Olympic runner, whose disputed drug test led to a two-year suspension that kept him out of the 1992 Games.

title: New York State Election Choices; Carl McCall for Comptroller
description: In this ugliest of statewide contests, we enthusiastically endorse the Democratic incumbent, H. Carl McCall, for a four-year term as New York State Comptroller -- the state's chief fiscal officer.

title: Fort Wayne National Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Corrections
description: An article yesterday about a New York Times/WCBS-TV News poll that showed Gov. Mario M. Cuomo edging ahead of State Senator George E. Pataki in the New York State campaign for governor misstated the support that the poll showed Mr. Cuomo receiving upstate. It was 27 percent, not 21.

The periods also included charges related to the company's decision to exit the JT8D engine overhaul market. The amount of the charges were not immediately available.d-Net income(Loss)

title: The Wizard of Eyes: Evolution Creates Novelty by Varying the Same Old Tricks
description: ONE of the most fascinating yet awkward problems that have challenged biologists since Charles Darwin is how to explain the evolution of complex structures like the eye and the wing. How does a blind force like natural selection sculpture from almost nothing a supremely delicate mechanism like the inner structure of the ear?

title: Bergen Brunswig Corp.  (BBC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax gain of $ 2.4 million, or 6 cents a share, from the sale of investment securities, in the quarter and year.c-Net lossd-Included a pretax restructuring charge of $ 33 million in the quarter and year. The year was also after a charge of $ 2,570,000, or 7 cents a share, on loss from early extinguishment of debt.(Loss)

title: Were Asteroids Falling? Few Viewers Cared
description: A CBS television movie that tried to emulate the spooky verisimilitude of Orson Welles's "War of the Worlds," while avoiding the mass panic that radio drama engendered, left some viewers confused on Sunday night, others irritated and many more totally unmoved.

title: Republican Comptroller Candidate Denounced as Racist
description: In some of the harshest language of the campaign, nearly 50 leading Democrats yesterday denounced the Republican candidate for comptroller, Herbert London, for what they said were racist and divisive attacks against H. Carl McCall, the Democratic candidate.

title: CLASSICAL MUSIC
description: A Premiere of Rorem Songs Turns Out to Be Chamber Music Alice Tully Hall

title: Moynihan Foe Says Giuliani Pressured Her
description: Bernadette Castro, the Republican candidate for United States Senate, said yesterday that Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani tried to persuade her during a private meeting at Gracie Mansion on Sunday night to "consider distancing" herself from her party's gubernatorial candidate, George E. Pataki.

title: Food Stake To Be Sold By Nabisco
description: The RJR Nabisco Holdings Corporation took a big step yesterday that some analysts predicted would lead to an eventual separation of its food operations and its tobacco business.

title: Haiti's Capital Throbs With New Life
description: Haiti's capital is bustling again. At night, with people no longer fearful they will be kidnapped and killed by the gunmen the army used as enforcers, restaurants are full. People are flocking to bars and music clubs to dance to their favorite songs in the syncopated Haitian compas style.

title: Gag Rule Isn't Part Of G.O.P. 'Contract'
description: To the Editor:

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: Rifts Shake and Rattle Warner Music
description: As a virtual civil war rages within Time Warner Inc.'s music operation, record executives at many rival labels are eyeing a rare opportunity to lure talent from what has long been the industry's most stable, desirable and powerful place to work.

title: After Crackdown, Smugglers Of Chinese Find New Routes
description: More than a year after the tramp steamer Golden Venture went aground off Queens with a cargo of 300 illegal Chinese immigrants, a Government crackdown on the ship-borne smuggling of Chinese to this country has apparently led smugglers to open a new route through the Caribbean.

title: James W. Moore, 89, Legal Scholar and Teacher
description: James William Moore, a legal scholar, teacher and authority on Federal Court practice and procedure, died on Wednesday at his home in Hamden, Conn. He was 89.

title: Shostakovich's 15 String Quartets Form a Thread
description: Perhaps it is only natural that classical music listeners regard certain works by certain composers through a bifocal lens, taking account of both the near and distant perspective. Completists at heart, we apprehend individual pieces as interconnected parts of a larger whole. But inherently suspicious of the mysticism that sustains such a view, we earnestly hold onto a real-world perspective: that the works are also snapshots of distinct emotional states.

title: She's Got a Ticket to Brag, He's Got a 'Ticket to Ride'
description: ISAAC MIZRAHI'S mother was gushing.

description: MANY of this fall's best new cookbooks seek to recapture earlier eras. To reinforce the memories, some have grainy black and white photos that look as if they were peeled from family albums.

title: Political Choices in Connecticut; Bill Curry for Governor
description: The personal income tax that Gov. Lowell Weicker pounded through the Connecticut Legislature corrected a longstanding inequity in the state's revenue system. Both John Rowland, the Republican candidate to succeed Mr. Weicker, and Tom Scott, an independent, want to repeal it. On that issue alone, both men disqualify themselves for the governorship.

description: Calvin S. Fuller, a chemist who was a co-inventor of a device to convert solar energy into electricity, died on Friday at his home in Vero Beach, Fla. He was 92.

By mid-morning on this opening meet of the Essex Fox Hounds hunt, conditions seemed splendid for most any human pursuit -- sunny and dry, leaves falling in a shimmering shower of gold and magenta.

title: NOVELL STOCK RISES ON SPECULATION ABOUT NETWARE
description: Shares of Novell Inc. rose sharply yesterday on speculation that the company would release the next version of its flagship Netware program earlier than expected. Analysts said there was also speculation that a large computer company, possibly even the International Business Machines Corporation, was interested in buying Novell, the world's second-largest independent software company. Shares of Novell, which is based in Provo, Utah, rose $1.50, to $20, in Nasdaq trading. Novell's Netware software may be released as early as this month, which could increase the company's fiscal first-quarter revenue by as much as 20 percent. Analysts had expected the release in January at the earliest.

title: More Than 70 Concerns Seek Wireless Licenses
description: More than 70 companies, from giants like AT&T and Sprint to a new venture formed by the cellular-phone pioneer Craig O. McCaw, have announced their intention to bid next month in auctions for radio licenses to provide wireless telephone service.

HORSE RACING;
Paradise Creek Is Splendor on the Grass
description: In each of the last two runnings of the Breeders' Cup Mile, Lure scored overpowering victories against his archrival Paradise Creek, but lost out at the ballot box to another horse when voters decided the male turf championship at year's end.

title: Crews Search a Muddy Field For Causes as Well as Bodies
description: After a night of cold rain and unanswered questions and prayers, the search for the dead and the reasons they died resumed today at first light across the muddy bean field where American Eagle Flight 4184 crashed on Monday.

description: In a brooding four-page note, Francisco M. Duran, the former Army medic who fired a semi-automatic rifle into the White House, mentioned a possible attempt on the life of President Clinton, Federal law-enforcement officials said today.

title: SIMON PROPERTY ENDS DEAL FOR EQUITABLE MALLS
description: Simon Property Group Inc. abandoned its plans yesterday to spend $1 billion to buy 19 shopping malls from the Equitable Companies' real estate arm, and may try to buy only a few instead. The transaction would have been the largest property purchase ever by a real estate investment trust. Simon, a mall and shopping center owner based in Indianapolis, said it had pulled out of the purchase because some properties it had agreed to buy in August were eliminated from the sale. It also said certain issues arose during due diligence. The company said it expected to announce within 30 days which Equitable malls it would buy. Equitable, based in New York, declined to comment on the problems with the deal.

title: CHRONICLE
description: The end of another movie star marriage: KELLY LEBROCK, the actress and model, filed for divorce from her husband of seven years, STEVEN SEAGAL, the martial-arts actor, on Monday in Superior Court in Los Angeles, The Associated Press reported yesterday. The couple, who separated on Oct. 1, have two daughters, Annalisa, 7, and Arissa, 1, and a son, Dominic, 7. Ms. LeBrock is seeking custody of the children.

Marlas, its chairman, president and chief executive, had proposed to acquire, through a merger transaction, all the shares of its common stock that he does not already own for $3.25 a share. Based on the number of shares outstanding, the deal would be worth about $9.94 million.

title: Italy Detains 2 in Highway Killing of U.S. Boy, 7
description: After a 34-day hunt, the police in southern Italy announced today that they had arrested two men in connection with the killing of Nicholas Green, a 7-year-old American boy who died when highway robbers opened fire on his family's rental car in September.

Pataki, the Republican candidate for governor, said yesterday that he had agreed to a three-way debate with Mr. Cuomo and B. Thomas Golisano, the Independence Fusion candidate.

But everywhere he went, it was his endorsement of Mr. Cuomo that lingered on people's minds.

The transaction, which makes S-K-I the largest ski resort company in the United States based on skier visits, was approved two weeks ago by the bankruptcy court overseeing Waterville's Chapter 11 proceedings.

title: Playwright's Tough Subject Draws Funny Offers
description: In "The Waiting Room," three women from different centuries are waiting to see the doctor: an 18th-century Chinese wife whose feet have been bound and deformed, a Victorian lady who has been too tightly corseted emotionally as well as physically and a contemporary American woman whose breast implants have led to cancer. Each has been abused in the name of beauty, or at least beauty as fantasized by a male-dominated society. Lisa Loomer's new play deals with everything from medical malpractice to misogyny, while crosscutting through time and space.

title: Legal Maybe, but Wrong

Those duties on the account, with $80 million in billings, had been handled by DeWitt Media in New York for the last three years. Burnett was awarded the creative portion of the account, as well as media duties outside the United States, in September 1993.

description: To the Editor:

title: Cheap and Chic in Los Angeles
description: RIOTS, fires, earthquakes, recession. This city has been pretty badly battered in the last couple of years. Faced with the end of the halcyon 1980's, local restaurateurs went around moaning, lamenting the big-money days and wondering if the good times would ever come back. But as catastrophe followed catastrophe something remarkable happened here: The most successful restaurateurs stopped looking backward and started facing reality. If people were reluctant to spend money, they would simply charge less. And do it with style.

title: Race for Governor: Pataki Says Cuomo Is Buying Election
description: CANDIDATE: George E. Pataki PRODUCER: Russo, Marsh & Associates, Sacramento, Calif., and Alexandria, Va. VISUAL: Photographs of Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and the Shoreham nuclear plant, plus newspaper headlines and highlights of the script over ominous music. Ends with photograph of Mr. Cuomo scratching his head. SCRIPT: Announcer: "First, Mario Cuomo cut a cynical deal to buy votes with a $9 billion bailout of Lilco. Now he's cut another deal -- for Rudy Giuliani's support. Just three days after Giuliani's endorsement, The New York Times reported that Giuliani is already counting on $150 million more of your state tax dollars. Billions for Lilco, hundreds of millions for Giuliani and tax increases for us. Don't let Mario Cuomo buy this election with your money." ACCURACY: The Governor has proposed a state takeover of the Long Island Lighting Company, which would cost about $9 billion, to be financed through tax-exempt bonds. Politicians of many stripes and the financial markets greeted the idea skeptically. Mr. Cuomo contends a takeover would lead to lower electric rates, by eliminating shareholder dividends and Federal taxes the utility now pays. Mayor Giuliani's proposed budget modification, announced a day after his endorsement of the Governor, does depend on $150 million in new aid from Albany, although he and Mr. Cuomo insist they never discussed any deal, and no governor can deliver much in the way of state aid without the cooperation of the Legislature. Mr. Cuomo has proposed no tax increases. SCORECARD: Mr. Pataki is vulnerable to the charge -- by Mr. Giuliani and other local officials -- that his proposed state income tax cuts would force higher local taxes. This ad tries to turn that attack around, arguing that Mr. Cuomo is the taxer who is pitting different parts of the state against each other. In making that claim, of course, Mr. Pataki seeks to divide the state further, and energize his base in the upstate areas that have provided a growing share of the electorate. The ad's anti-tax message could hit home, as does its suggestion that the Lilco plan is an election-year gambit. But its conspiracy theory may strike voters as hard to believe, and it does nothing to sketch in Mr. Pataki's own personality or ideas. TODD S. PURDUM
