title: AWAY FROM HOME WITH: Liz Carpenter; With Three, She Gets Nine Inch Nails
description: LIZ CARPENTER is having a great book tour. Sure, there are parties in every city, given by social and prestigious names -- "Age blesses you with a bounty of friends," she said -- but that's not it. It's just that after a long drought, she's enjoying adult conversation, is happily ignoring the vagaries of who's who in the rock world and has wiped the word "homework" from her vocabulary. Well, at least for a couple of months.

title: Lowell Johnson, 82, Business Consultant
description: Lowell Ferris Johnson, a retired consumer-products executive and business consultant, died on Saturday at Muhlenberg Regional Medical Center in Plainfield, N.J. A resident of North Plainfield, he was 82.

title: Reeves Questions Some Personnel Moves
description: In a conference call with reporters in Dallas today, Giants Coach Dan Reeves said that the team may have made some mistakes in the handling of certain personnel situations, especially in relation to the salary cap and free agency.

title: Teen-Ager in Kidnapping Case Tells Court He Ran Away
description: A Jewish teen-ager who prosecutors say was kidnapped by an ultra-Orthodox rabbi and his wife testified yesterday that he had not been abducted but voluntarily ran away from an "unnormal" home in which his mother regularly beat him.

title: A Spy Trader Goes on Trial In Germany
description: A cold war lawyer and spy trader who brokered freedom for 33,755 East German political prisoners in exchange for $2.3 billion paid to the Communists by the West German Government went on trial today on charges of helping the secret police blackmail former clients into leaving houses and property behind.

title: 2 Escape Bus Heading to Juvenile Detention Center in Bronx
description: One was 13 years old when he was arrested on charges of fatally shooting a man in Brooklyn last April. The other, who is 16, has been convicted of arson for throwing a firebomb in an apartment building in upper Manhattan.

title: Victorian Opera at Juilliard
description: The Juilliard Opera Center is to present three performances this month of Rutland Boughton's "Immortal Hour," an opera composed in 1912-13 and based on a Celtic folk parable about lost love. Randall Behr will conduct the production, which is being staged by Frank Corsaro. Performances are Nov. 16 and 18 at 8 P.M. and Nov. 20 at 2 P.M. at the Juilliard Theater, 165 West 65th Street. Tickets are $10. Information: (212) 721-6500.

title: Dicterow Cancellation
description: The violinist Glenn Dicterow has canceled his four appearances as soloist with the New York Philharmonic this week and next because of illness. He was to have played Chausson's "Poeme" and Ravel's "Tzigane," under the direction of Charles Dutoit. The two pieces have been dropped from the program; instead, the orchestra will play Rachmaninoff's "Isle of the Dead" in addition to Prokofiev's "Love for Three Oranges" Suite and Respighi's "Fountains of Rome" and "Pines of Rome." The concerts are tonight, tomorrow and Saturday at 8 P.M. and Tuesday at 7:30 P.M.

title: COLUMBIA/HCA HEALTHCARE CORP. (COL,N)
description: The Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corporation said yesterday that third-quarter earnings surged on increased admissions and outpatient visits at its hospitals.

title: Haytaian, a Trenton Insider, Seeks Senate as an Outsider
description: For years before Chuck Haytaian began running for the United State Senate, he was running the New Jersey State Assembly with a forcefulness that left little doubt about who was in charge.

title: Race for Governor: Cuomo Recounts Tough Times
description: CANDIDATE -- Mario M. Cuomo PRODUCER -- The Garth Group, New York City

title: Implant Easily Surpasses Pill in Averting Teen-Age Pregnancy
description: A study of contraceptive implants in teen-agers has shown that the devices are far more effective in preventing pregnancy than pills and do not discourage the use of condoms to prevent disease.

title: Coffee Prices Slump as Rain Eases Brazil Drought Fears
description: Coffee prices plunged yesterday after rain in Brazil raised optimism about the size of next year's crop, the world's largest.

title: Hong Kong Welcomes Its Return to China
description: To the Editor:

title: METRO DIGEST
description: PEROT SIGNALS HE WILL SUPPORT GOLISANO In a surprise move, Ross Perot agreed to appear with B. Thomas Golisano, the Rochester businessman running a strong independent campaign for governor. A1. The leading gubernatorial candidates vied for the mantle of underdog in a close race. B8.

title: Arabs Now Take Charge (Sort Of) at Allenby Border Post
description: Ahmed Nujoum had re-entered the West Bank from Jordan many times before across the Allenby Bridge.

title: What's Weather Got to Do With It?
description: Three days before the 25th New York City Marathon, the marathon's perennial heated weather debate seems to be tilting away from the Allan Steinfeld sunny-spectator-skies model and toward the colder-the-better runners' position staked out by the marathon's founder, Fred Lebow.

title: One Man's Campaign To Rename a Creek
description: There is little to distinguish Negro Run except its name.

title: Note to Readers
description: The Op-Ed page welcomes unsolicited manuscripts. Because of the volume of submissions, however, we regret that we cannot acknowledge an article or return it unless it is accompanied by a self-addressed, stamped envelope. If manuscripts are accepted for publication, authors will be notified within two weeks.

title: Cytec Industries Inc.(CYT,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and included an increase in its reserve for environmental matters of $ 105.7 million and established a valuation allowance relating to certain deferred tax assets of about $ 48.6 million in both the quarter and 9 months.Year-ago results are pro forma. This shows company's results as a separate entity from American Cyanamid Co. On a historical basis, the company posted a loss of $ 285,819,000 on sales of $ 255,314,000.(Loss)

title: Lenehan and Charisma A Winning Duo Again
description: Leslie Lenehan and Charisma, a team for the last six years, were head and shoulders above everyone else in the field of 32 tonight as they captured the $25,000 International and Open Jumper Grand Prix, the feature event on the opening day of the 111th National Horse Show.

title: Journal; Justice for None
description: With today's publication of "Strange Justice: The Selling of Clarence Thomas," American blood will come to a new boil over the most rending he-said/she-said conflict of our time. But not necessarily because of this gripping book's revelations about Anita Hill and Clarence Thomas.

title: Race for Governor: Pataki Says Tax Cuts Are Possible
description: CANDIDATE -- George E. Pataki PRODUCER -- Russo, Marsh & Associates, Alexandria, Va., and Sacramento, Calif.

title: A Set Up, Williams Gets Stung By Reality
description: Venus Williams, the 14-year-old tennis debutante who made a triumphant transition into professionalism with a straight-set victory on Monday, had the welcome mat abruptly yanked from beneath her tonight by Arantxa Sanchez Vicario, the world's second-ranked player.

title: Food Industry Groups Sue to Stop U.S. Testing of Ground Beef
description: Seven food industry trade associations have filed a lawsuit to stop the Department of Agriculture from testing ground beef for bacteria that may be responsible for as many as 500 deaths a year.

title: Moore Corp.(MCL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
200 Egyptians Die When Blazing Fuel Floods Their Homes
description: At least 200 eople were killed today in southern Egypt when an explosion and floods sent blazing fuel racing through the streets of a small village, security officials said.

title: Breeders' Cup Favorites On Outside Rushing In
description: By the luck of the draw, bad luck as they saw it, four favorites drew outside or next-to-outside post positions today for the Breeders' Cup races on Saturday.

title: Fed Report Said to Point To Rate Rise
description: With unemployment falling most places and every region of the American economy growing, manufacturers are beginning to raise prices, the Federal Reserve said in a report released today. Private economists interpreted the report, prepared with contributions from each of the 12 regional Fed banks, as another sign that the central bank is likely to raise interest rates again soon.

title: 2 Families Unhappily Entwined for 3 Generations
description: ALL OUR YESTERDAYS By Robert B. Parker 401 pages. Delacorte Press. $22.95.

title: Suit Against Bausch & Lomb Is Judged a Class Action
description: A decision by a Federal judge in Alabama to allow a lawsuit filed in May against Bausch & Lomb by three consumers to proceed as a class-action case was met with indifference yesterday by both the eyewear company and Wall Street.

title: AmVestors Financial Corp.(AVFC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Included realized investment loss of $ 369,000, or 4 cents a share, in the quarter and realized investment gain of $ 167,000, or 2 cents a share, in the 9 months.c-Included realized investment gain of $ 1,104,000, or 17 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 7,612,000, or $ 1.19 a share, for the 9 months.

title: BIC Corp.(BIC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-After a loss from cumulative effect of changes in accounting for postemployment benefits of $ 623,000, or 2 cents a share.c-After a loss from cumulative effect of changes in accounting for postretirement benefits of $ 9,816,000, or 42 cents a share.

title: Jets Try to Understand: Bills Are More Complex
description: If you believe in short-term history, the Jets (4-4) should destroy the Buffalo Bills (5-3) Sunday at Giants Stadium. After all, the Jets have already embarrassed the Bills, 23-3, in the season opener.

title: Jack in the Box Goes to Chiat/Day
description: Foodmaker Inc. said yesterday that it had selected Chiat/Day in Venice, Calif., to handle the account of its Jack in the Box fast-food chain, with billings estimated at $35 million to $40 million. The account had been at Cohen/Johnson in Century City, Calif., for eight years until that agency was dismissed in September.

title: Pepsico Pushes a Star Performer
description: Attention snack food aficionados: What will soon be 20 percent larger, 15 percent thinner and stronger tasting?

title: Article 716618 -- No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: Focusing on the 'Anyone' In 'Anyone-but-Cuomo'
description: AS if out of nowhere came State Senator George E. Pataki and his entourage, startling Lisa and Charles Davi as they shopped at the Staten Island Mall. The couple smiled. The candidate moved on. Ms. Davi, of Bay Ridge in Brooklyn, stared after him. "He caught me by surprise," she said. "That was Pataki? I thought he was one of my husband's relatives."

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: Correction
description: Because of an editing error, Monday's column gave an incorrect date for the North American Charity Game. It will be played on Nov. 21.

title:
HOUSE PROUD;
Forging a New Life from an Old Ruin
description: TO leave the rat race, find a patch of unspoiled land, fix up a house and start a new life: since Thoreau, it's been an enduring version of the American dream. Many an urban homesteader, inspired by this encounter with the self-sufficient, meditative life, has imagined an idyll in the woods, conveniently omitting bugs, bad weather and rotting timber. Few put their dream to the test.

title: Health Systems International Inc.(HQ,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Health Systems International said the revenue increase was fueled by a 15 percent enrollment increase in its health plans, to 1,439,013 at Sept. 30, compared with 1,256,219 a year ago. Enrollment increased 7,719 since June 30, and, since the beginning of the year, it has added 140,013 new members.

title: The Suburbs of Johannesburg Stay Cold to Blacks
description: After the cage of apartheid began to open up and the borders of his existence were no longer the pocked roads of Soweto, Vusi Makhubela found a peach-colored house in a white promised land with rose bushes and a two-car garage.

title: COMPUSA INC. (CPU,N)
description: Shares of CompUSA Inc. rose yesterday after the company reported a first-quarter loss that was smaller than expected.

title: Ireland and Britain Praise Clinton's Ulster Aid
description: Ireland and Britain today praised the Clinton Administration's decision to increase economic aid to Northern Ireland as a step toward advancing peace there.

title: CHRONICLE
description: The novelist HERMAN WOUK, 79, made a rare public appearance yesterday at a luncheon at the National Press Club in Washington. He and his wife, BETTY SARAH WOUK, still keep a house in the capital, where he lived for a number of years while researching his two World War II novels, "Winds of War" and "War and Remembrance." Now they live in Palm Springs, Calif., which, Mr. Wouk noted, "is sometimes described rather unfeelingly as God's waiting room."

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday about the campaign for governor in New York misstated the purpose of an evening fund-raiser featuring Hillary Rodham Clinton. The event was for the Democratic Senate Campaign Committee, not for Gov. Mario M. Cuomo. The article also misstated the number of campaign commercials Mr. Cuomo has written for himself. It is one, not two.

title: Chalk It Up to Art
description: IT'S the closest thing to legal graffiti: a chalkboard photo frame that comes with its own chalk, which fits right into the 8-by-7.5-inch frame.

title: No Price Is Too High To Be the Best
description: The expectations could not be higher, and the players know it. So does Pat Riley. Anything less than a championship has become unacceptable to the Knicks.

title: Kormeada Journal; The Unforgiven in Ethiopia: Its Refugee Families
description: Fanta Belete had lived in Eritrea for 17 years when Ethiopia fell to rebel troops in 1991.

title: Deborah Voigt Recital
description: The soprano Deborah Voigt is to sing works by Brahms, Wagner, Mascagni, Griffes and Richard Strauss in her first New York recital, on Nov. 20 at 3 P.M. at Alice Tully Hall. Ms. Voigt, who was the 1992 winner of the Richard Tucker Music Foundation Award, made her Metropolitan Opera debut in 1991 as Amelia in Verdi's "Ballo in Maschera" and has since sung Leonora in "Il Trovatore," the title role in "Ariadne auf Naxos" and Chrysothemis in "Elektra" in the house. Tickets to the recital are $28. Information: (212) 721-6500.

title: Cuomo and Pataki Compete for Undecided Voters
description: New York's leading gubernatorial candidates spent yesterday vying for the mantle of underdog in a close race and reaching out to the women who make up a majority of undecided voters, with pointed appeals from Hillary Rodham Clinton for Gov. Mario M. Cuomo and from the wife of the Republican candidate, State Senator George E. Pataki, in his behalf.

title: Campbell Mithun Adds Unit for Dow
description: Campbell Mithun Esty said yesterday that it would create a separate agency within the agency to handle its new Dow Brands consolidated North American integrated marketing account, with billings estimated at $100 million.

title: Thomas Case Shows Divide At the Journal
description: Across the front page of its second news section yesterday, The Wall Street Journal published an article based on a much-promoted new book by two of the newspaper's journalists.

title: Panama Chief Seeks to Prod The Economy
description: Seeking to stimulate the economy and reduce poverty, Panama's new Government has introduced an ambitious plan to sell stakes in state-run industries, reduce import tariffs and revise labor laws that inhibit foreign investment.

title: VOTERS DISGUSTED WITH POLITICIANS AS ELECTION NEARS
description: Heading into Tuesday's election, voters are profoundly alienated from their elected representatives and from the political process and confess to a deepening powerlessness and pessimism over the future of the nation, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: Linking Centuries At the Louvre Cafe
description: IF the dictum of success in real estate is "location, location, location" then the Cafe Marly, a 300-seat restaurant that overlooks the Cour Napoleon at the Louvre, is a sure-fire winner.

title: Nine West Group Inc.(NIN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax payment of $ 5 million, or 15 cents a share, to the company's principal buying agent for past services occasioned by the completion of the company's initial public offering. The period was also after a gain of $ 11,491,000, or 35 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Outboard Marine (OM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, which included pretax restructuring charges of $ 37.4 million in the quarter and $ 144.8 million in the year. The year also included pretax charges of $ 117.5 million for new accounting rules, a pretax insurance benefit of $ 12.5 million, and after a charge of $ 117.5 million, or $ 6.00 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: Charles Busch Takes On a Trouser Role
description: Christopher, the hero of the utterly winning new comedy "You Should Be So Lucky" at the Primary Stages, is a lonely Greenwich Village electrolysist full of sighing references to diva films like "Laura" and "I Want to Live." But when he first appears, the cinematic quotation that springs to mind is from a very different sort of movie, "King's Row," in which an actor named Ronald Reagan said: "Where's the rest of me?"

title: It's Quantity Rather Than Quality at Nets' Center Spot
description: Butch Beard, the first-year coach, might have to make the decision with his allocation of minutes. Willis Reed, the general manager, could concoct a last-minute trade and save Beard the trouble. Either way, the Nets need to take a long, hard look into their forest of big men and begin whittling.

title: With its fourth Miller Lite campaign in three years, an agency hopes consumers are thirsty for change.
description: IT would be far too harsh when discussing advertising for Miller Lite to repeat the familiar remark about mercurial weather -- that those who dislike it should stick around because it will change any minute.

title: At $3.6 Million, Warhol's 'Marilyn' Is a Star Again
description: In three and a half minutes, Andy Warhol again catapulted to the top of the art market last night. At Christie's brilliant auction of contemporary art, Warhol's "Shot Red Marilyn," the famous 1964 silk-screen of Marilyn Monroe with a repaired bullet hole over the left eyebrow, fetched $3.6 million, nicely above Christie's estimate of $2.5 million to $3 million. The painting, one of the most famous images in contemporary art, was sold to an unidentified telephone bidder.

title: N.H.L. Players Threaten to Reduce Playoffs
description: While the National Hockey League chopped 10 more games from its damaged regular season today, its locked-out players union met here and discussed the possibility of retaliating by threatening not to play some post-season games.

title: The Art of Growing Older Forcefully
description: Turn the word "mom" upside down and what do you have? No guessing here, it's "wow," and one might well ask, so what?

title: Milk Campaign Expanding Markets
description: The popular Got Milk? campaign created by Goodby, Silverstein & Partners in San Francisco for the California Milk Processor Board is being expanded again to include New York State.

title: Cable Networks Keep Tight Rein on Offerings
description: To the Editor:

title: Simpson Strategy: There Were Several Killers
description: Outlining what is expected to become a central defense theory in the O. J. Simpson case, a defense lawyer said today that two or more people were involved in the slayings of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald L. Goldman and that Mr. Simpson did not have to solve the crime in order to prove his innocence.

title: Bridge
description: The North American Pairs Championship, popularly known by its original name, the Grand National Pairs, starts at the grass roots and permits players to earn a free trip to a national final. One qualifier this year is Luella Slaner of Scarsdale, N.Y., who at 75 is one of the oldest players to advance to this final in the open category.

title: And on the 7th Day, Another 26.2 Miles
description: Last Thursday morning, Twen Govender awakened at 4:30 in Durban, South Africa, and went for a six-mile run. That afternoon, he took a one-hour flight to Johannesburg, making his connection for a 10-hour flight to Frankfurt.

title: One 'From the Warrior Class' Fights Another Battle; A Month After Assault in Brooklyn, a Detective's Family and Friends Look Back
description: Louis Cosentino, one of the most colorful and powerful members of the Transit Police Department, dressed immaculately -- his style part head of state, part gangster. He talked tough with his superiors. He sat and smiled with politicians at restaurants, and then screamed at them across the bargaining table.

title: Cascades Paperboard reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 2,480,000, or 5 cents a share, from the company's share of a gain realized by Tartas S.A. in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a gain of $ 4,012,000, or 9 cents a share, on the sale of assets of the company's Rochester, N.Y. plant.c-Net lossd-Included a loss of $ 3,116,000, or 7 cents a share, related to the shutdown of the company's plant in Duffel, Belgium.Results are in Canadian dollars.(Loss)

title: A Playwright's Post-Beckett Period
description: Twenty years ago, Marina Carr, Ireland's most celebrated young playwright, was a girl of 9 putting on plays in the garage of her home in the hamlet of Pallas Lake, deep in the quiet of the rustic Irish Midlands.

title: Shades of the Go-Go 80's: Takeovers in a Comeback
description: The deals are not as big, the fees are not as fat and the personalities are not as flamboyant. Still, corporate takeovers are back.

title: Japanese Pass Bills On Electoral Reform
description: After more than four years of battling, the lower house of Parliament today passed the final versions of bills to set up a new electoral system and to toughen campaign financing laws, part of a long-promised effort to clean up Japan's scandal-haunted politics.

title: Strike Prevents Delivery of San Francisco Daily Newspapers
description: Employees of this city's two major daily newspapers, longtime rivals that have limped along under a joint operating agreement since 1965, went on strike Tuesday night as 2,600 reporters, editors, drivers, press operators and paper handlers walked off the job. They had been working without a contract for the past year.

title: Carr-Gottstein Foods Co.  (CGF,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-Net loss and included an extraordinary charge of $ 20,984,000 related to early debt repayments in both the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a gain of $ 2,160,000 for change in method of accounting for income taxes.(Loss)

title: Corrections
description: An editorial yesterday on the Connecticut elections was in error when it said that Senator Joseph Lieberman voted against President Clinton's budget package last year. He voted for it.

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: Basketball National Basketball Association

title: Ground Round Restaurants reports earnings for Year to Oct 2
Detroit Sets Truck Records As Vehicle Sales Jump 8.9%
description: Drawn by the fresh curves of some 1995 vehicles and the reduced prices on 1994 models, customers continued to flock to new car dealerships in October, buying 8.9 percent more cars and light trucks than were sold during the brisk period a year earlier, the auto makers reported today.

title: Cutting Legal Aid Costs
description: Like all cities, New York is constitutionally obliged to provide legal help for indigent defendants. Unlike most cities, New York contracts the work to a private organization, the Legal Aid Society. Despite a history of dedication to an often thankless job, the society has grown fat with age. Mayor Rudolph Giuliani has correctly chosen to pare the fat. That will cause the society financial pain. But it may also bring about new ways of dealing with the city's immense criminal caseloads and better justice at lower cost.

title: Air Force One 1, Pataki 0
description: State Senator George E. Pataki wanted to be in the state capital this morning to kick off a barnstorming trip upstate and win back some of the media attention from President Clinton, who was at a rally with Gov. Mario M. Cuomo at the state university across town.

title: The Boxing Ring As a Parable On Manhood
description: Oliver Mayer's "Blade to the Heat" is a one-alarm play, but it is getting a four-alarm production at the Joseph Papp Public Theater.

title: Schools in Paterson Lagging On Standards, Report Says
description: Three years after the state took control of the ailing Paterson school district, student achievement still lags far behind state standards, according to a report by independent auditors released today.

title: A Psychiatrist Who Falls For a Knife-Wielding Psycho
description: B movies used to look cheaper than their higher-class counterparts, but today they can have the antiseptically affluent look of a television show. Not to mention the cast: "A Passion to Kill" stars Scott Bakula ("Quantum Leap") as a California psychiatrist who falls for his best friend's wife (Chelsea Field, the mom in "Andre," the summer's pet-seal movie) despite the warnings of his ex-girlfriend (Sheila Kelley of "L.A. Law"). "A Passion to Kill" also has the abundance of close-ups and medium shots that suggest television or video is its natural home.

title: Canadian Tire reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company said its third-quarter earnings increase was primarily due to the company's strong showing at Canadian Tire Retail, with increased shipments and reduced operating expenses.

title: Hear Ye! Hear Ye! Four Days of Talks Scheduled
description: Negotiators for baseball's striking players and owners agreed yesterday to the most ambitious schedule of bargaining sessions since they began working toward resolving their labor differences.

title: Eli Lilly Deal Is Approved By the F.T.C.
description: The Federal Trade Commission gave conditional approval yesterday to Eli Lilly & Company's $4 billion purchase of PCS Health Systems, the nation's biggest prescription drug benefit company, and made clear that it would keep similar deals under surveillance for possible antitrust violations.

title: Interest in Renault Shares
description: Individual investors began to line up today to pay 165 francs ($31.79) a share for Renault S.A., Europe's sixth-largest car maker and fourth-largest truck producer. Institutional investors will pay 176 francs a share.

title: FHP International (FHPC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest share earnings is after $ 5,505,000 in preferred stock dividends, primary earnings attributable to common stock is $ 15,215,000.FHP International Corp. said its earnings in the latest first quarter included results from TakeCare Inc., acquired on June 17, while the year-ago quarter does not.

title: Thomas Nelson (TNEL,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 336,000, or 3 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes.

title: 6 Astronauts Are Launched Into Space
description: The refurbished space shuttle Atlantis rocketed into orbit today on a planned 11-day mission to study Earth's atmosphere, particularly the effects of solar radiation interacting with man-made chemicals on the ozone layer high in the atmosphere, which protects the planet from harmful ultraviolet radiation.

title: UJB Financial Corp.(UJB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 1,731,000, or 3 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.c-Reflected after-tax restructuring charge of $ 12.7 million, or 24 cents a share, in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months was also after a gain of $ 3,816,000, or 7 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Year-ago periods were restated to reflect the acquisition of VSB Bancorp Inc. on July 1, 1994, accounted for as a pooling-of-interests.

title: No Headline
description: " I have prayed to the Lord every day. It's just so sad that someone could take such beautiful children. I have put all my trust and faith in the Lord that He will bring them home to us." SUSAN SMITH, hours before she was arrested in the death of her children. [ A1:1. ]

title: 14 Latin Artists Exist Separately In a Bronx Show With Light Touches
description: "Cartographies" at the Bronx Museum of the Arts is a frustrating exhibition with decent ingredients but no center. The show, organized by the Winnipeg Art Gallery in Manitoba, brings together 14 Latin American artists, several of whom have shown in New York. They are an eclectic bunch, often thought-provoking, in one case genuinely exciting. But neither the specific works nor the essays in the show's vague, buzzword-filled catalogue suggests why they were deemed suitable company.

title: Jury Recommends Death Penalty for Abortion Foe Convicted in 2 Killings in Florida
description: A jury recommended today that Paul J. Hill die in Florida's electric chair for killing an abortion clinic doctor and an escort. The verdict came just a few hours after the defendant, in his first words to the panel, said, "You may mix my blood with the blood of the unborn and those who have fought to defend the oppressed."

title: St. Joe Paper (SJP,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossc-After a gain of $ 20,518,000, or 68 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: U.S. Is Shifting Trade Emphasis Away From Japan; A Focus on Rest of Asia, Latin Nations
description: When Edgar S. Woolard Jr., chairman and chief executive of E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, delivered a speech by satellite to the company's Asian offices recently, not once did he mention Japan, which accounts for half of the chemical giant's Asian sales. Mr. Woolard instead gushed on about new opportunities in China and elsewhere in the Far East, to the annoyance of company employees in Japan.

title: Molson Cos. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an after-tax gain of $ 16.9 million, or 29 cents a share.Molson's class A stock and class B stock with ticker symbols MOL.A and MOL.B, respectively, are listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: SHL Systemhouse (SHKIF,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: b-Net loss, which included a one-time restructuring charge of $ 134.8 million, in the quarter and year.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Redman Industries(RDMN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, which included an after-tax charge of $ 3.4 million for stock options granted management in connection with initial public offering in September 1993, in the quarter and 6 months. The periods included extraordinary losses from discontinued operations of $ 4,585,000, or $ 1.14 a share, in the quarter and $ 4,231,000, or $ 1.10 a share, in the 6 months, representing previous subsidiary in unrelated business spun off in connection with IPO, and extraordinary charge of $ 1,753,000, or 43 cents a share, in the quarter and 46 cents a share, in the 6 months, from extinguishment of debt.(Loss)

title: Cineplex Odeon (CPX,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a one-time charge of $ 3,292,000, or 3 cents a share, associated with debt restructuring in June.c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 7,349,000, or 6 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 8,341,000, or 8 cents a share.(Loss)

title: Continental Can Co. (CAN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge for the purchase and retirement of $ 3 million of Plastic Containers Inc. 10.75 percent senior secured notes of $ 73,000, or 2 cents a share, and a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 263,000, or 8 cents a share.

title: Chilly Partners -- A special report.; Saudi Arabia, Its Purse Thinner, Learns How to Say 'No' to U.S.
description: Defense Secretary William J. Perry was pitching hard, but Prince Sultan was unreceptive.

title: Family Values and Love In Vietnam Aftermath
description: Set in a small Mississippi town and centered on a children's battle over a tree house, "The War" is an allegory about love, death, pacifism, family values and the spiritual and physical wounds of Vietnam. To no small degree it is also about movie stars, who have the power to transform platitudes into warm, affecting insights when they make their presence sufficiently persuasive on screen.

title: Bringing Action to Blind Theatergoers
description: Sitting on a chair at the back of the Marquis Theater, Laura Congleton watched "Damn Yankees" and described what she saw.

title: A Jury Is Chosen to Hear The Simpson Murder Case
description: Nearly five months after he was charged with murdering his former wife and her friend, O. J. Simpson finally came face to face today with the 12 men and women who will judge him.

title: Art in Review
description: 'Ancient Khmer Sculpture' The Chinese Porcelain Company 475 Park Avenue, at 58th Street Through Nov. 12

title: Natural Virus Said to Check Brown Tide
description: A discovery by scientists may help Long Island fishermen who have been plagued for nearly a decade by brown tide, a mysterious, troublesome algae growth that turns sea water the color of coffee and chokes the life out of waterways where shellfish once thrived.

title: Anderson Wants a Peek at the Prize Before Nets Take On the Champions
description: Kenny Anderson said he might ask Kenny Smith, his close friend and backcourt counterpart with the Houston Rockets, to show him his championship ring on Friday night.

title: Critic's Choice/Film; Calm During a Storm: Celebrating Bresson
description: These days, Robert Bresson may be the least-shown of master film makers. His signature style is the clear-sighted film that serenely explores emotional and social upheavals, like "Diary of a Country Priest," the 1950 tale of a quiet priest's religious crises. "The Devil, Probably" is a late, little-known Bresson film that takes the same calm approach to a world crumbling from the inside out. The film was shown at the 1977 New York Film Festival, then virtually disappeared from the United States until today, when it begins a weeklong run at the Walter Reade Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: Democrats Count on Little-Known Candidate for 'Insurance' in Senate Edge
description: The Democrats desperately need an insurance policy for next Tuesday's midterm elections, and they think they may have found one in Ann Wynia, their little-known Senate candidate in Minnesota.

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about Rwanda misstated the United Nations' estimate of the number of people displaced by violence there. It is 1.8 million, not 11.8 million.

title: Horsham Corp.(HSM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a dilution gain of $ 136 million resulting from the issue of common shares of American Barrick Resources Corp. in connection with Barrick's acquisition of Lac Minerals Ltd. in both the quarter and 9 months.c-Included a dilution gain of $ 700,000 in the quarter and $ 1.5 million in the 9 months.

title: Breast Cancer as a Political Issue
description: When the members of 1 in 9, a Long Island advocacy group for breast-cancer victims, sponsored a meet-the-candidates night recently at the Nassau County Medical Center, they were flabbergasted by the response. Not from the voters; from the politicians.

title: U.S. Is Shifting Trade Emphasis Away from Japan; More Growth Predicted for New Markets
description: Suffering battle fatigue after two years of fighting Japan over trade issues, the Clinton Administration is putting a new emphasis on the emerging markets in the rest of Asia and Latin America -- areas that it believes will greatly outstrip Japan as consumers of American exports.

title: Redistricting Heats Up Election Races; Giuliani's Real Motive
description: To the Editor:

title: Knicks' Title Quest Starts With Questions
description: The Knicks are eager to begin their season with a victory and end their season with a championship.

title: A Papal Best Seller -- and One That Wasn't
description: Last month Alfred A. Knopf published Pope John Paul II's "Crossing the Threshold of Hope," a question-and-answer book for which it paid nearly $9 million and which soon showed up on the best-seller list. The huge sum has made the book's commercial fate the latest measure of the Pope's popularity, and that of his papacy -- a state of affairs that sends disquieting signals about the Roman Catholic Church today.

title: Oshkosh B' Gosh (GOSHA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Warm Weather Slowed Retail Sales in October
description: Mother Nature seems determined to keep merchants guessing about their prospects for the all-important holiday sales season, which officially begins the day after Thanksgiving.

title: Immigration Issue Flares Anew in Senate Race
description: The California Senate race, already in turmoil over the issue of illegal immigration, was thrown into even greater confusion today by a case of mistaken identity.

title: Champion Account Goes to Merkley
description: The Champion Products division of the Sara Lee Corporation, which markets sportswear and other casual apparel, said yesterday that it had named Merkley Newman Harty in New York to handle its account, previously at Saatchi & Saatchi Advertising in New York. Billings were estimated at $12 million. After a two-month review, Merkley Newman was chosen over two other New York-based finalists, Angotti, Thomas, Hedge and Deutsch Inc.

title: Cowboys' Smith Is Unhurt in Auto Mishap
description: The Dallas Cowboys running back EMMITT SMITH escaped injury in a two-car collision yesterday morning.

title: Coach at Iowa State (0-7-1) Will Resign
description: JIM WALDEN, whose Iowa State football team is likely to face its first season without a victory since 1930, said last night that he will resign after the season. Walden, in his eighth season as coach of the Ames, Iowa, university, said he was making the announcement to give the university a jump on finding a replacement.

title: Downhill After the Los Angeles Riots
description: "Am I losing my mind? Am I sick?" worries John Boyz (James Le Gros), the unemployed, 30-something narrator of Peter McCarthy's brave but misguided contemporary satire, "Floundering." The Los Angeles riots have barely subsided, and John, who lives in Venice Beach, is haunted by what he calls a "pervasive feeling of doom." His edgy mood is made worse by his morbid habit of obsessively replaying his own homemade videotapes of the riots. Prominently featured in those videos is Merryl Fence (Nelson Lyon), a Los Angeles police chief who suggests a monstrous caricature of the real-life Daryl F. Gates.

title: A 14-Year-Old Provides Taste of Things to Come
description: The grand entrance was short-lived, but plenty auspicious.

title: U.N. Assembly Approves Call for End to Bosnian Arms Embargo
description: The General Assembly adopted a resolution today urging the Security Council to lift an arms embargo on the government of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: New Plans For Petrie
description: The Petrie Stores Corporation said yesterday that it had decided to pursue the sale of its retailing operations separately from a plan to liquidate itself by distributing its 38.8 million shares of Toys "R" Us to its shareholders.

title: Tall Ships and High Expectations in Bridgeport
description: Anna Prizzia, 17, grew up dreaming about a life at sea and a career involving ships, especially tall ships.

title: Art in Review
description: Nicholas Nixon Zabriskie Gallery 724 Fifth Avenue, at 56th Street Through Nov. 26

title: METRO DIGEST
description: CANDIDATES CONTINUE TO SPAR

title:
Market Place;
Austria's market could do well, the Bundesbank and Fed willing.
description: SHARE prices on the Vienna Stock Exchange have drifted lower since last winter, and equity experts here see little chance for a rally before the end of the year. Looking to 1995, however, they are predicting strong gains, driven by Austria's solid economic fundamentals and rising corporate profit.

title: THE 1994 CAMPAIGN: Political Memo; Close Races Are Turning More Jittery
description: How would you expect a jittery campaign year to end? With a bad case of the jitters, of course.

title: Campaigns Focus on 2 Views of West
description: When the Democrats won the West in the 1992 Presidential election, they took it as a mandate to phase out century-old Government subsidies that were used to lure people and industry to the trackless corners of America's public lands.

title: A Warning Sign Surfaces Between Reeves and Young
description: His brutal honesty is what makes everyone around Dan Reeves respect and admire him. Honesty is a priceless commodity but sometimes it can be painful to endure. Now Reeves's trademark has put the Giants in this predicament: For the first time, someone in the Giants' organization has publicly criticized the job General Manager George Young has done with free agency.

title: Group Shows: One Groovy, One Graphic, One Grating
description: Group shows are a mixed blessing. Designers showing together with corporate sponsorship risk being morphed into one blob of trend and fabric, while designers who may never show get the chance to offer a concise and tantalizing morsel of their works.

title: Abroad at Home; Change Of Character
description: If you liked the 1992 Republican National Convention, with its bashing of the un-Christian and the un-straight, you'll love the 1996 convention. Assuming, that is, that the party wins as big as it expects in the upcoming midterm elections.

title: 2 Views of Clinton, Both Unflattering
description: HIGHWIRE From the Backroads to the Beltway: The Education of Bill Clinton By John Brummett 294 pages. Hyperion. $22.95. ON THE EDGE The Clinton Presidency By Elizabeth Drew 462 pages. Simon & Schuster. $24.

title: Rural Social Commentary With a Difference
description: The images that Doris Ulmann made in the South in the 1920's and 30's occupy a curious position in the history of documentary photography. Ulmann's subjects, among them the mountain people of Appalachia and the blacks of the Gullah region of South Carolina, were staples of socially concerned photography during the New Deal era, whether Margaret Bourke-White's sensationalist reportage for Life magazine or the more measured documentary work of Walker Evans and other photographers working for the Farm Security Administration.

title: CONTINENTAL CABLE TO BUY 50% OF ARGENTINE SYSTEM
description: Continental Cablevision Inc. agreed yesterday to buy half of Argentina's largest cable system for $150 million. Continental, a closely held company based in Boston, said it would acquire 50 percent of Fintelco S.A. the holding company for Video Cable Communication S.A. of Buenos Aires and other cable properties. Earlier this year, Continental said it would form a joint venture with three Singapore companies. It also teamed with Optus Communications of Australia and Australia's two largest television networks to develop a network for video, telephone and other services.

title: Rem Koolhaas's New York State of Mind
description: NEW YORK CITY'S most inspiring architect lives in London, works in Rotterdam and has yet to build a thing on the North American continent. But for the next three months, Rem Koolhaas has the stage at the Museum of Modern Art, where New Yorkers can see for themselves how their city continues to shape the world even as their own architecture has slipped below world-class standards.

title: On Stage, and Off
description: Jerry, Yes Almost. Tina, No for Sure.

title: Bosnian Army and Croats Drive Serbs Out of a Town
description: In their most significant military success since the war here began, Bosnian Army and Croatian military units captured the town of Kupres today, driving out the Bosnian Serb forces who overran it in April 1992 with the help of the Serb-dominated Yugoslav Army, local news reports said.

title: NATIONSBANK AND DEAN WITTER TO SPLIT VENTURE
description: The Nationsbank Corporation and Dean Witter Reynolds Inc. said yesterday that they planned to split up their joint venture, the brokerage unit Nations Securities. Nationsbank, the banking company based in Charlotte, N.C., said it would keep the part of the brokerage firm that sells mutual funds and other investment products through its retail branch network. Dean Witter will keep the part that markets brokerage services to other banks. Dean Witter Reynolds, a unit of Dean Witter, Discover & Company, has a sales force of 7,800 in 340 offices.

title: Saluting -- or Doing In -- the Suburban Muse
description: There were actually a lot of women in her era that despised the notion of Laura Petrie, the highly saluted muse of this season. So what if she wore pants? She never used foul language or double-entendres. She wasn't sexy or dangerous. She certainly never wore anything provocative; she and her husband even slept in twin beds.

title: Police Say Woman Admits to Killings as Bodies of 2 Children Are Found Inside Her Car
description: In a turn of events that some people in her town expected but few wanted to believe, a South Carolina woman who reported that her two little boys had been abducted by a carjacker was arrested and charged today with two counts of murder in their deaths.

title: Lee Enterprises Inc.(LEE,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Yes on the Nassau Charter
description: Of all the choices facing Nassau County voters next Tuesday, none bears more directly on their future than Proposal No. 1 -- a charter revision that would create a new 19-member legislature to replace the six-member Board of Supervisors, which has held sway in the county for almost 100 years.

title: McCaughey, the G.O.P. Stealth Candidate
description: It was 9:30 A.M. and Elizabeth P. McCaughey, the Republican candidate for lieutenant governor, had already downed a hamburger and two bagels and given the family chihuahua a bath. This was, after all, a big day.

title: After 3 Years, a PC Alliance Is Ready to Fight
description: Consolidating a three-year-old alliance that had seemed to be faltering, Apple Computer, I.B.M. and Motorola will announce on Monday a new personal computer design with the backing of several other big computer makers.

title: Dangerous Young Lions
description: The conviction of three young men in South Africa last week for the killing of Amy Biehl, a white American student who had ventured into the black township of Guguletu, points to a question mark hanging over the future of the country. Politicized youth were once in the vanguard of the struggle against apartheid; where do they fit into the new South Africa?

title: Zap! Futuristic Fighter Show Is Alien to Canada's Culture
description: Alien-battling guardians of the planet have just taken a body blow from a national broadcasters' regulatory body that ruled that "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers," the popular Los Angeles-produced children's show viewed in more than 30 countries, is too violent for Canadian television.

title: Retired Admiral Assails Senator Over Sex Harassment Complaint
description: In an unusual personal attack, the former commander of the Navy's Atlantic Fleet has lashed out at Senator Patty Murray for trying to delay his retirement because of what she said was his mishandling of a sexual harassment complaint.

title: Creative Executive Is Joining Freeman
description: David Angelo, 33, has joined Cliff Freeman & Partners in New York as executive vice president and co-creative director.

title: Art in Review
description: Hugh Steers Richard Anderson Gallery 475 Broome Street SoHo Through Dec. 3

title: Nazi Executioner and Jew Reunited
description: Genghis Cohn is a comic ventriloquist in Germany in the 1930's. He asks his audience, "How do you kill a Jewish comedian?" Answer: "Same as any comedian. You don't laugh at his jokes." Not quite. Cohn, whose act has died in many a seedy club, finally dies himself at Dachau.

title: Never Mind Those I.Q. Scores: It's Dedication That Counts
description: To the Editor:

title: Never Mind Those I.Q. Scores: It's Dedication That Counts; Breast-Feeding's Role
description: To the Editor:

title: Critic's Choice/Film; Still Scary, Now in Mint Condition
description: Sometimes a cigar isn't just a cigar: for instance, when Stanley Kubrick's camera gazes up at the face of Gen. Jack D. Ripper (Sterling Hayden), the militaristic madman obsessed with "precious bodily fluids" and casually responsible for having triggered Armageddon in "Dr. Strangelove." The cigar-chomping general offers a hilarious if unsubtle image of masculine paranoia, which took on epic proportions in Mr. Kubrick's scathing doomsday comedy.

title: Sealed Air Corp.(SEE,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After extraordinary charge of $ 5,576,000, or 28 cents a share, from early retirment of debt.c-After a gain of $ 1,459,000, or 8 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: MCA's Impatience With Wary Parent
description: The top two executives of MCA Inc. arrived in Japan with a bold proposal to invest in an American television broadcast network. They left feeling, to use the words of one of them, as if they had been "treated as children" by their corporate parent, the Matsushita Electric Industrial Company. And the bad feelings persist nearly two months later.

title: Redistricting Heats Up Election Races; 2 Margins of Error
description: To the Editor:

title: Warnaco Group Inc.(WAC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 8
description: b-After a net charge of $ 3 million, or 7 cents a share, representing loss on California earthquake.c-After a charge of $ 10.5 million, or 26 cents a share, representing the cumulative effect of accounting change for postretirement health benefits.The share earnings and shares outstanding were adjusted to reflect 2-for-1 stock split which became effective Oct. 3, 1994.Year-ago periods ended Oct. 2.Revenue represented net revenues.

title: Ireland's Premier Assures Protestants in North of Their Rights
description: Prime Minister Albert Reynolds said today that his Government was prepared to approve a radical change in the Constitution of the Irish Republic to assure the people of Northern Ireland, with its Protestant majority, that they would never be subsumed into a united Ireland against their will.

title: Crash Inquiry Focuses on Ice And Steering
description: The American Eagle airliner that crashed here on Monday, killing all 68 people aboard, took just 36 seconds to fall out of the sky from more than a mile and a quarter above the ground, first tipping 77 degrees to the right, recovering to 59 degrees, then flipping upside down and plunging at a 45-degree angle, a Federal safety official said tonight.

title: Indonesia's Phony Cleanup
description: Indonesia's rulers see this month's Asia-Pacific economic summit meeting as a terrific opportunity to improve an international image stained by repression in East Timor and other serious human rights abuses. How much more flattering to display a statesman-like President Suharto playing host to his counterparts from the U.S., China, Japan and a dozen other countries and touting the opportunities of the world's fourth-most-populous nation and one of its most vibrant economies.

title: Reinsurance Group of America Inc.(RGA,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Art in Review
description: Luc Tuymans David Zwirner Gallery 43 Greene Street (near Broome Street) SoHo Through Dec. 3

title: Jacobs Engineering Group Inc.(JEC,N) reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-Included special charges totaling about $ 10.2 million, or 40 cents a share.

title: John Whitwell, 84, Princeton Professor
description: John Colman Whitwell, who in 42 years at Princeton University became an expert in applying statistical methods to chemical engineering problems, died Oct. 28 at Applewood, a retirement and nursing home in Freehold, N.J. He was 84.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: Mercantile Stores Co.(MST,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-After a charge of $ 1.1 million, or 3 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.c-After a gain of $ 3.1 million, or 9 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest nine months included a pretax $ 5 million provision for consolidation.

title: G.E. Sees Kidder Loss of Up to $950 Million
description: The General Electric Company said today that corporate losses related to its Kidder, Peabody & Company brokerage unit would range from $850 million to $950 million this year.

title: HOUSE OF FABRICS SEEKS CHAPTER 11 PROTECTION
description: House of Fabrics Inc., a retail chain that sells sewing and craft supplies, has filed for Chapter 11 protection in United States Bankruptcy Court in Los Angeles. The company said its liabilities and those of four divisions that also filed totaled $242.1 million. Their consolidated assets were $373.8 million. The company, based in Sherman Oaks, Calif., said it would continue operations while resuming a debt-restructuring effort. Shares of House of Fabrics tumbled 87.5 cents, to $1, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: David Feinberg, 37, an Author Who Wrote of Life With AIDS
description: David B. Feinberg, an author and Act Up member who chronicled AIDS in his books and battled it in the streets, died on Wednesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 37.

title: Fed Intervenes for a 2d Day And the Dollar Ends Higher
description: The dollar rose against the yen and other leading currencies yesterday after the United States Government entered the foreign-exchange markets to prop up the value of the dollar for a second day.

title: Where Houdini Made His Great Escapes
description: To the Editor:

title: Rome Journal; For the Long-Suffering Colosseum, Intensive Care
description: It's the top, after all -- it's the Colosseum.

title: A Scratch Nets Lukas An Extra Cup Edge
description: Two days before the Breeders' Cup series, Wayne Lukas's chances of scoring a sweep of the 2-year-old races got an unexpected boost today when a fever forced the withdrawal of Call Now, his chief threat in the Juvenile Fillies.

title: Williams Grand Jury to Review Blood Test
description: Grand jurors investigating an automobile accident involving a Cowboys offensive lineman, ERIK WILLIAMS, will be allowed to review a blood-alcohol test that was given after his admission to a hospital.

title: CHRONICLE
description: A familiar figure on the Washington diplomatic circuit, HARRY H. SCHWARZ, the Ambassador from South Africa to the United States since 1991, is on the move. He is stepping down on Nov. 15 to become a senior adviser to the Washington law firm of Akin, Gump, Strauss, Hauer & Feld, the law firm announced yesterday.

title: For Children
description: Rollerbasketball Tompkins Square Park 10th Street at Avenue B Lower East Side Recommended for all ages Saturdays and Sundays

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-16 DEATH TOLL RISES IN EGYPT Survivors searched the smoldering remains of a village in southern Egypt a day after floods spread burning fuel from a damaged depot there. Officials said at least 400 died in the disaster and that about 200 might be buried under mud. A1

title: RELIANCE BOARD LEAVES BID TO SHAREHOLDERS
description: The board of the Reliance Electric Company refused yesterday to either recommend or reject a $1.5 billion tender offer from the Rockwell International Corporation, leaving the decision to shareholders. Reliance's board determined "that it is unable to take a position with respect to the offer and is making no recommendation," the company said in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. On Oct. 20, Rockwell made a hostile offer to acquire Reliance Electric, which is based in Cleveland, for $30 a share in cash. Reliance had already agreed to merge with the General Signal Corporation for $27 a share in stock. Despite its refusal to take sides officially, Reliance said in the filing, "the board believes its continued support of the proposed Reliance-General Signal merger remains in the best interests of the company and its stockholders."

title: Household International Inc.(HI,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Clinton Campaigns Upstate With an Eye on the Nation
description: President Clinton, making his fourth campaign trip for Gov. Mario M. Cuomo and his first to upstate New York, cast Tuesday's gubernatorial election and similar races around the country as contests between forward-looking Democrats and negativist Republicans who, he said, want Americans to "vote your anger."

title: Peter Taylor, Short-Story Master, Dies at 77
description: Peter Taylor, a novelist and short-story writer whose work was often praised for its gentility and its emotional precision, died on Wednesday at the University of Virginia Hospital in Charlottesville, Va. He was 77 and lived in Charlottesville.

title: Hasidic Students Describe Brooklyn Bridge Nightmare
description: Testifying in a Manhattan courtroom yesterday, three passengers described in harrowing detail the terror, chaos and shock when a van carrying 15 Hasidic students across the Brooklyn Bridge came under gunfire in March.

title: Sally A. Knapp; Singer and Actress, 68
description: Sally A. Knapp, a singer and actress who appeared in numerous productions of Gilbert and Sullivan operettas, died on Tuesday at Gwinett County Hospital in Georgia. She was 68 and lived in Atlanta.

title: Legal Vacuum in Haiti Is Testing U.S. Policy
description: Two weeks after 20,000 American troops arrived here, soldiers raided a warehouse looking for a suspected arms cache and took the Haitian owner of the business, Gerry Mourra, prisoner.

title: INSIDE
description: In Trade, Looking Past Japan

title: Bally Entertainment Corp.(BLY,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge for costs incurred in the pursuit and development of new gaming projects of $ 2.9 million, or 6 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 3.3 million, or 7 cents a share, in the 9 months and a gain of $ 1.1 million, or 2 cents a share, from sale of securities in both the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 46,091,000, or 99 cents a share, and an extraordinary charge from extinguishment of debt of $ 20,735,000, or 44 cents a share.c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 11,523,000, or 24 cents a share, and $ 10,658,000, or 22 cents a share, in the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and an extraordinary gain on sale of the remaining Bally Gaming International common stock of $ 6,215,000, or 13 cents a share, in both the quarter and 9 months.The 9 months also included an extraordinary charge from extinguishment of debt of $ 8,090,000, 17 cents a share, and a charge from an accounting adjustment of $ 28,197,000, or 58 cents a share.Year-ago quarter and 9 months' income from continuing operations of $ 11,203,000, or 22 cents a share, and $ 16,528,000, or 30 cents a share, respectively, both included a charge of $ 1.5 million, or 3 cents a share, as a result of applying the change in the U.S. statutory tax rate from 34 percent to 35 percent to deferred tax balances.(Loss)

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Wendy's International (WEN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: Revenue represented sales and revenues.Systemwide sales in the latest periods totaled $ 1,095,000,000 in the quarter and $ 3,149,000,000 in the 9 months, compared with $ 1,022,000,000 and $ 2,909,000,000 in year-ago periods, respectively.

title: Candidates Lament Tone, But Attack Just the Same
description: They lamented the bitter tone of the campaign and insisted that they wanted to talk more about issues, but the two candidates for New York State comptroller fired off a steady stream of personal attacks tonight in the last of six televised debates.

title: A Jury Is Selected In the Simpson Case
description: After weeks of often tedious questioning, 12 jurors -- eight black, two Hispanic, one white and one identified as half white and half American Indian -- were selected for the O. J. Simpson murder trial. Although lawyers repeatedly told prospects that race was not an issue in the case, it was clearly a compelling concern during jury selection.

title: Reynolds & Reynolds Co.(REY,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 19,106,000, or 44 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.All per share figures restated to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split effective March 1.

title: Inside Art
description: A Gift From the Panzas

title: Two Bruised Jets Tailbacks Try to Heal for Bills
description: Johnny Johnson is feeling better. So is Anthony Johnson. But the Jets' battered tailbacks again sat out practice today and remained questionable for Sunday's game against the Buffalo Bills at Giants Stadium.

title: Lawyers Defend Billing System That Got Colleague in Trouble
description: After a Federal jury convicted a lawyer on mail-fraud charges connected to billing practices that are common throughout the profession, the legal community trembled. So when a Federal appeals court reversed the conviction earlier this week, lawyers sighed with relief, then sought to explain how a generalized bill on a fake letterhead could be in a client's best interests.

title: Give 'Em an Eph! Oozing Excellence at Williams
description: When it comes to athletics, there is little humility to be found on this idyllic campus. Rather, the Ephs (the college was founded in 1793 by Col. Ephraim Williams) take for granted victory after victory and championship after championship.

title: Consolidated Natural Gas Co.  (CNG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a non-cash charge of $ 11,429,000, or 12 cents a share, to adjust deferred tax balances to reflect the higher federal corporate income tax rate. Also included an increase in taxes of $ 1,603,000, or 2 cents a share, due to the tax rate change being retroactive to Jan. 1st in both the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months also included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 17,422,000, or 19 cents a share.(Loss)

title: Ivaco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 2,275,000, or 8 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 4,418,000, or 16 cents a share, in the 9 months.c-Net lossd-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 743,000, or 3 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,497,000, or 6 cents a share, in the 9 months.Ivaco said the discontinued operations reflect its share of environmental remediation costs following the sale of Florida Wire and Cable in 1992.Results are in Canadian dollars.(Loss)

title: Diner's Journal
description: What's Sauce for the Guests. . . .

title: SPX Corp.(SPW,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, which included a special restructuring charge of $ 18.5 million in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 31.8 million, or $ 2.52 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Pro forma revenues, to allow comparison with results that reflect businesses acquired and sold during 1993, were $ 230.7 million in the quarter and $ 749.7 million in the 9 months.(Loss)

title:
HORSE RACING;
Wear Advertising, Wear a Fine, Jockeys Told
description: The board of stewards at Churchill Downs today announced that jockeys wearing insignias on their apparel in Saturday's Breeders' Cup races would be subject to disciplinary action.

title: Despite the Distractions, Ward Keeps Riding High
description: McLain Ward's world is horses. At the age of 19, he has some remarkable accomplishments to his credit, and he plans to have many more in the years to come.

title: Prasad Hopes to Avert Painful Stitch in Time
description: After 11 miles, Nadia Prasad of France felt the pain so sharply that she stopped running and doubled over. Two or three miles later, the pain returned and she stopped again, breathing deeply and attempting to touch her nose to her knees. Every runner has dealt with a stitch in the side. But this was no training run. This was the middle of the 1993 New York City Marathon.

title: BRISTOL-MYERS TO BUY CALGON VESTAL FOR $261.5 MILLION
description: The Bristol-Myers Squibb Company agreed yesterday to buy Calgon Vestal Laboratories, which makes skin care and infection control products, from Merck & Company for $261.5 million. The deal is valued at about two and half times Calgon Vestal's 1993 sales of $105 million, spokesmen for the two companies said. Bristol-Myers Squibb said Calgon, which is based in St. Louis, would be combined with its Convatec unit, based in Skillman, N.J. The announcement followed the sale in June 1993 of Calgon Water Management to English China Clays P.L.C. of Britain for $307.5 million.

title: Young & Rubicam Gets Teflon Account
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company has selected Young & Rubicam Inc. in New York to handle its Teflon finishes business in North America and Mexico, with billings estimated at $7 million. For more than 20 years, N. W. Ayer & Partners in New York handled the account, which includes the Silverstone and Silverstone Xtra brands of nonstick cookware, in North America.

title: In Their Own Words
description: JOHN G. ROWLAND

title: Art in Review
description: Isabel Munoz Julie Saul Gallery 560 Broadway (near Prince Street) SoHo Through Nov. 12

title: ARAMARK TO PAY $130 MILLION FOR FLAGSTAR'S PARKS UNIT
description: Aramark, a closely held park-services company based in Philadelphia, agreed yesterday to pay $130 million in cash to acquire a rival, the TW Recreational Services unit of the Flagstar Companies. The unit, which had $130 million in revenue last year, operates hotels, restaurants and gift shops at national parks. Flagstar, which owns restaurant chains, has been trying to sell peripheral businesses. Aramark was formerly ARA Services Inc.

title: Home Sales Rise, Even as Rates Do Too
description: Strong labor markets are helping the nation's housing industry defy gravity, keeping it strong even as mortgage rates climb to three-year highs, a Government report showed today.

title: Home Video
description: Texas' as a Mini-Series

title: BOXING: Moorer Shaky Slipping Barbs; Foreman's Witticisms Keep the Champion Tied Up
description: The heavyweight champion of the world is undefeated, 26 years old, about to fight a 45-year-old fat man who hasn't been in the ring for 17 months.

title: Clinicom
description: Shares of Clinicom Inc. fell 39 percent to a 52-week low of $8.25 yesterday before recovering somewhat. The Boulder, Colo., company, a developer of computer software for hospitals, on Wednesday posted third-quarter profit of 3 cents a share, compared with 12 cents a share a year earlier.

title: CHRONICLE
description: When MERCEDES ELLINGTON walked into the Apollo Theater recently, she wondered whether it was really the same place where she had heard her grandfather Duke Ellington in the 1950's.

title: Edward Wardwell, 90, Lawyer and Arts Patron
description: Edward Rogers Wardwell, a retired New York lawyer and patron of the arts, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 90 and also had a home in Lawrence, L.I.

title: 2 Shops Resign Footwear Accounts
description: Two New York agencies said yesterday that they had resigned the accounts of two marketers of casual footwear and apparel.

title: Reviews/Fashion; 'Tasteful' Comes in Many Colors
description: There is a certain woman in America who places her trust in two designers: Bill Blass and Oscar de la Renta.

title: USLico Corp.(USC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 10.9 million in the quarter and $ 11.8 million in the 9 months of one-time after-tax gains from the sale of the company's ship registry and corporate formation business.The latest periods included investment gains of $ 400,000 in the quarter and $ 1.1 million in the 9 months, compared with $ 1.4 million and $ 3.7 million in year-ago periods, respectively.

title: Value Health Inc.(VH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included merger-related expenses of $ 5,986,000 related to the acquisitions of Prescription Drug Service Inc., Prescription Drug Service West Inc. and RxNet Inc. These acquisitions were accounted for as poolings of interest, and results have been restated accordingly.

title: Jazz Opens N.B.A. Season Without Wright
description: A day before its season opener, the Utah Jazz yesterday waived LUTHER WRIGHT, the 23-year-old center whose National Basketball Association promise has never been realized.

title: Live Action Inspired By Video
description: It is the year 2007, and what was once Los Angeles is now a gruesome post-earthquake trash heap rechristened New Angeles. Seven years earlier, the Big One struck, reducing the city to rubble. The Capitol Records tower sags like a twisted accordion. Hollywood Boulevard has become the highly flammable Hollywood River, and curbside oxygen booths provide the only relief from the suffocating smog.

title: U.N. Envoy Pessimistic About Holding Orderly Election in Haiti
description: A United Nations envoy to Haiti reported today that the security and the political stability of the country were still shaky and might remain that way for some time.

title: Perot to Back Lautenberg Over Republican Candidate
description: Ross Perot will endorse Senator Frank R. Lautenberg of New Jersey, the Democrat seeking re-election, and will campaign with him this weekend, advisers to both men said early today. A Perot endorsement could give the incumbent a boost with an independent bloc of voters that he and his Republican challenger, Chuck Haytaian, have avidly courted.

title: PATAKI REVISITS BASE OF SUPPORT IN UPSTATE CITIES
description: Returning to his base of support with his paramount campaign message, State Senator George E. Pataki, the Republican candidate for governor, swept through four upstate cities today with an entourage of Republican candidates and county executives who reaffirmed his call for deep tax cuts and reduced state spending.

description: b-After a charge of $ 2,169,000, or 6 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest quarter included a gain of $ 360,000, or 1 cent a share, on foreign exchange rate translation. The translation reduced latest year earnings by $ 1.2 million, or 3 cents a share.
