title: His Man Unhorsed, Giuliani Confronts His Political Plight
description: Having gambled and lost in his dramatic endorsement of Mario M. Cuomo, Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani has now been left needing millions of dollars of assistance from the state but facing a Republican governor who owes him nothing and drew little of his support from New York City.

title: Leadership in Albany: A Changing Cast
description: GOVERNOR George E. Pataki

title: St. Jude Medical Inc.(STJM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: St. Jude Medical said the increase in net sales for the quarter resulted principally from an 8 percent increase in heart valve unit sales, offset by a slight reduction in average selling price due to changing geographic sales mix with more units being sold in developing markets.Operating expenses rose to $ 16.3 million in the latest quarter from $ 14.4 million mainly due to strengthening of St. Jude's worldwide sales and marketing organizations to deal with increased competition and one-time costs associated with achieving ISO 9000 certification.

title: Debating Right Of Young Patients
description: WHEN 16-year-old Billy Best ran away from his home in Massachusetts two weeks ago, he raised questions about far more than his whereabouts. Because he fled chemotherapy treatments, his situation addresses complex ethical and practical issues about a teen-ager's role in determining medical care.

title: G.O.P.'s Rising Star Pledges To Right Wrongs of the Left
description: The former history teacher said it felt weird to be making history. But Newt Gingrich adapted quickly.

title: Sovereign BancorpInc.(SVRN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 4.8 million gain from adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No. 109.

title: 3 Teen-Agers Try to Flee Detention Center
description: Little more than a week after five youths escaped from custody on the way to a Bronx detention center, three teen-agers at the center -- including one who took part in the earlier incident -- attacked a guard yesterday in another escape attempt.

title: The Election's Fallout for the Economy; Stocks Rise, But Euphoria Doesn't Last
description: Traders stormed into the stock market like a herd of elephants yesterday morning, pushing prices sharply higher in the wake of the Republican sweep of the House, the Senate and the governors' mansions.

title: Magna Group (MAGI,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: O'Sullivan Industries Holdings Inc.(OSU,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 2,025,000, or 12 cents a share.Year-ago results are pro forma and included estimated additional administrative and interest expenses which would have been incurred as a stand-alone, publicly-owned company. The company closed its initial public offering on Feb. 2, 1994, and previously was a unit of Tandy Corp.

title: Tejas Gas Corp.(TEJ,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Spielberg Recording Holocaust Testimony
description: Steven Spielberg stepped into a modest trailer not far from his offices at Universal Studios and was welcomed by a chorus of ringing telephones. Milie Stern, one of a half-dozen volunteers, cupped a phone to her ear.

title: U.S. Promises To Maintain Foreign Policy
description: Secretary of State Warren Christopher came to Seoul to tell the South Koreans that Washington was committed to their security. But today he found himself reassuring them that Republican victories in Congress would not change the course of American foreign policy.

title: Seafirst Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Seafirst Corp. is a unit of BankAmerica Corp.

title: Western Co. of North America (WSN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Fragrant You, Fragrant Car, Etc.
description: UNISEX colognes may be the rage, but what about fine scents that are multipurpose?

title: Reader's Digest Assn.  Inc.(RDA,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 25.8 million, or 23 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of change in accounting principle, net of tax benefit.Reader's Digest had pro forma net income of $ 73.8 million, or 63 cents a share, in the 1993 first quarter, on revenue of $ 637.2 million. The company said that the pro forma data reflect accounting changes for promotion, premiums and product development costs used in the latest first quarter. The company adopted the promotion accounting standard retroactively July 1, 1993.

title: Derlan Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomec-Included divestment gains of about $ 3.0 million in both the quarter and 9 months.Share earnings for the latest 9 months and year-ago period are after preferred dividends.Results are in Canadian dollars.(Loss)

title: Thermo Instrument Systems Inc.(THI,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
Jordan, Marketing Tool
description: American Association teams are wasting little time in taking advantage of the MICHAEL JORDAN baseball show.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: The Election's Fallout The long-delayed world trade agreement will be the first test of the new alignment in Washington. Although both parties say they support the pact, known as GATT, they still find themselves at odds as soon as they start discussing its details. [ Page D1. ] Euphoria over the Republican sweep quickly faded on Wall Street, with the Dow industrials eking out a tiny gain of 1.01 point. [ D1. ]

title: Mercury General Corp.(MRCY,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest periods included investment losses of $ 2,719,000, or 10 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 6,184,000, or 23 cents a share, in the 9 months. Year-ago periods included investment gains of $ 719,000, or 3 cents a share, and $ 3,034,000, or 11 cents a share, in the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

title: Was Hemingway Gay? There's More to His Story
description: HEMINGWAY'S GENDERS Rereading the Hemingway Text By Nancy R. Comley and Robert Scholes Illustrated. 154 pages. Yale University Press. $23.

title: Boston Journal; Suspicion Is Legacy Of Odd Life
description: When Mary Guzelian was killed by a taxi nine years ago at the age of 68, few people would have guessed what was inside the shopping bags she toted around as she panhandled in the elegant Back Bay neighborhood here, wearing two heavy coats at a time even on hot summer days.

title: National Health Laboratories Holdings Inc.(NH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included pretax special charge of $ 15 million to pay the company's share of a fund to settle shareholder litigation and $ 6 million for expenses related to the litigation, in the quarter and 9 months.National Health Labs Holdings said that the latest third quarter also included the first full quarterly results of Allied Clinical Laboratories, which it acquired on June 23. Allied had sales of $ 48.3 million.Sales are net sales.

title: Alice Miller, 46, Headed Center For Women at Brooklyn College
description: Alice Miller, the director of the Brooklyn College Women's Center since 1985, died on Monday at Cabrini Hospice in Manhattan. She was 46 and lived in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: YACHT RACING Rescue Boat Arrives Newcastle Australia, the 60-foot yacht that rescued the shipwrecked BOC round-the-world racer, Josh Hall, arrived in Cape Town on Tuesday afternoon. On board were Hall and Newcastle's skipper, Alan Nebauer. The sailor from Australia picked up Hall in the South Atlantic Ocean on Oct. 18, eight hours after Hall's 60-footer hit a submerged object. Nebauer -- a day after leaving Charleston, S.C., at the start of the race -- hit an abandoned Cuban refugee raft, which damaged Newcastle's keel. Arnet Taylor Jr., a BOC racer from Portsmouth, N.H., arrived in Cape Town earlier Tuesday.

title:
COMPANY NEWS;
Product Inquiry Is Widening, Copley Says
description: Copley Pharmaceutical Inc. of Canton, Mass., announced late today that the United States Attorney's office in Boston had widened its investigation to include a second generic drug made by the company.

title: Ye Historic Drag Strip
description: DESIGNATED historic places aren't just turreted mansions and spired churches. Drag strips have historic significance, too.

title:
IN PERFORMANCE;
DANCE
description: Trying to Get the Most From Going the Wrong Way Stella Adler Conservatory Theater

title: Special Prosecutor on Suffolk Car Leasing to Withdraw
description: The Nassau County District Attorney, Denis E. Dillon, said today that he would withdraw from an investigation of a car-leasing deal in neighboring Suffolk County amid allegations that Mr. Dillon's name was invoked by the Suffolk County District Attorney to threaten a Suffolk County legislator.

title: Just Don't Call Me King, D'Amato Says of Pataki Victory
description: Even Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato's daughter, Lisa Murphy, one of the state's many jubilant Republican Party committee workers, was calling him "the king" yesterday instead of Daddy.

title: Essay; No Nyah-Nyah
description: The first right-winger to gloat should get booted right out of the tent. This is a moment for quiet reverence by pols and pundits at the wisdom of the people.

title: America Online Buys 2 Internet Companies
description: America Online Inc., facing a challenge from the Microsoft Corporation in the market for on-line computer services, said yesterday that it had acquired two small Internet service companies for a total of more than $34 million in stock.

title: Reeves Pulls the Switch and Goes With Graham
description: Quarterback Kent Graham was lifting weights this morning when Giants Coach Dan Reeves said he had to speak with him. Graham knew that Reeves probably wasn't pulling him aside to invite him home for dinner with the family. Reeves told Graham he was going to make a change at quarterback.

title: Results - New York: The Race for Governor
Fewest U.S. Farms Since 1850: 1.9 Million
description: Continuing a trend that began six decades ago, the number of American farms has dipped below two million for the first time since before the Civil War, the Census Bureau said today.

title: It's Secondary Concerns Primarily for the Jets
description: It was never meant to be easy, this business of being a Jets football player or a Jets fan.

title: A New Unit For Mellon
description: The Mellon Bank Corporation said today that it had merged the retirement services of three units -- Mellon, the Dreyfus Corporation and the Boston Company -- into Dreyfus Retirement Services, a new unit of the Dreyfus Service Corporation.

title: Brascan Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossc-Included a gain of $ 210 million, or $ 2.39 a share, on the sale of the company's 38 percent interest in John Labatt Ltd.Results are in Canadian dollars.(Loss)

title: Starbucks (SBUX,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-Included merger costs of $ 3,867,000, or 10 cents a share.

title: Panamerican Beverages Inc.(PB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included pretax charge of $ 8,136,000 related to financing tender offers to acquire minority interests in Mexico.c-Included charge of $ 7.2 million, or 24 cents a share, related to certain transactions prior to and associated with the company's initial public offering in September 1993, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: Foley, Defending Congress to the Last, Concedes Election Defeat by Newcomer
description: The House Speaker, Representative Thomas S. Foley, a 30-year incumbent, has always said that the best way to insure term limits was at the ballot box. On Tuesday, voters in eastern Washington followed his advice.

title: Siliconix Inc.(SILI,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
Haggar Corp.(HGGR,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
How Democrat McCall Navigated a G.O.P. Flood
description: H. Carl McCall stood before supporters yesterday and tried to explain why he, the candidate who looked most vulnerable a week ago, was the only Democrat left standing after a Republican sweep of the four statewide governmental offices.

title: Regal-Beloit Corp.(RBC,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 131,000, or 1 cent a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Share figures adjusted to reflect 2-for-1 stock split paid Aug. 12, 1994.

title: Many Blacks See Betrayal In This Year's Campaign
description: The defeat of the Democrats was a bittersweet loss for many blacks, long considered the most loyal of Democratic voters. It came after a campaign that left many saying they felt they were the underlying issue, where talk of welfare overhaul and the death penalty seemed aimed at them and where both parties seemed to compete to be the toughest on those topics.

title: Two Sides May Talk, But Will They Move?
description: When baseball's labor negotiators last held a bargaining session, the players were in the 29th day of their strike. Today, on Day 91, the negotiators will resume talks, but no more optimism exists now than two months ago.

title: Rockport Picks Leo Burnett
description: The Rockport Company has ended a brief review on the creative portion of its worldwide footwear account by awarding the assignment to the Leo Burnett Company in Chicago, which handles many large accounts for Rockport's parent, Reebok International. Billings were estimated at $10 million.

title: Houston Effler Changes Its Name
description: Houston Effler & Partners in Boston said yesterday that it had changed its name to Houston Effler Herstek & Favat, to reflect the contributions of Rich Herstek and Pete Favat, the agency's executive vice presidents and co-creative directors. Mr. Herstek, 40, a copywriter, and Mr. Faval, 32, an art director, joined the agency in August 1992 from Ingalls, Quinn & Johnson in Boston.

title: No Headline
description: "I want to let you know right up front that we want to work together where we can." -- BOB DOLE, on the phone to President Clinton. [ B6:1. ]

title: Atmos Energy Corp.(ATO,N) reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: The latest period included charges amounting to about 22 cents on a retirement charge for Greeley Gas Co., accrual accounting for postretirement medical benefits, acquisition costs and assimilation expenses.

title: CHRONICLE
description: LIV ULLMANN, the luminescent Norwegian actress turned director and screenwriter, has returned to her homeland to receive one of its highest honors. She is to be formally named a Commander of Olav by King Harald of Norway in a ceremony tomorrow in Oslo. "I love my country, and it is very good to get such beautiful recognition from your country and your king," she said yesterday.

title: MK Rail Corp.(MKRL,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Figures in 1993 and share earnings in the latest 9 months are not applicable. The company went public in April 1994.

title: Saving the Story for the Game
description: My guess is that Allen Iverson's first contribution to Georgetown basketball will be to end late arrivals by Hoya fans.

title: Central Vermont Public Service Corp.(CV,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: (Loss)

title: Lloyd's of London Sets Plan For Investors
description: Lloyd's of London announced a plan today to allow individual investors to participate in the insurance market with limited liability.

title: Editor Change At Details
description: Joe Dolce, features editor at Vogue, has been named editor in chief of Details, replacing John Leland, whose resignation was also announced on Tuesday.

title: AT&T Gets Mexico Partner For Long-Distance Service
description: Making its bid for one of the biggest prizes in the Mexican economy, the AT&T Corporation announced a $1 billion alliance today with a Mexican partner, Grupo Industrial Alfa S.A., that would provide long-distance telephone service when the present Government-approved monopoly ends in 1997.

description: BOTANICAL prints of flora captured in all its dewy, idealized glory leave David Winter cold.

The company was spun off in an initial public offering by its parent company, Lincoln National Corp., effective Feb. 2, 1994.

description: The company said earnings in the latest quarter are not comparable to earlier periods because Valero Natural Gas Partners L.P. was consolidated into Valero Energy, effective May 31, 1994.The company also said pro forma operating income in the latest quarter fell to $ 43.1 million from $ 51.5 million a year earlier. Pro forma figures reflect the consolidation with Valero Natural Gas at the beginning of each period. Pro-forma operating income in the latest 9 months fell to $ 98.8 million, from $ 161.0 million a year earlier.

title: Lautenberg, on the Brink, Beats Back a G.O.P. Tide
description: In a state where the Democratic Party has repeatedly faltered in recent years, and after a night in which that trend was accelerated locally and nationally, United States Senator Frank R. Lautenberg, the two-term Democrat who has begun each of his political campaigns as the presumed loser, stood again in the winner's circle today.

title: CBS Hopes to Cash In On a Sport for the Elite
description: There was a memorable photograph of a figure skating judge during the 1984 Sarajevo Olympics. He was not hypnotized by the dazzling athleticism and artistry of Katarina Witt and Scott Hamilton, the gold medalists. He was judging the dreary compulsory figures, endless repetitions of the figure 8. He was sound asleep.

description: Two of the best dance works you will see this season are "A Brahms Symphony" and "Fandango." It is no accident that Lar Lubovitch is their choreographer.

description: The latest periods included investment gains of $ 313,000 in the quarter and $ 1,280,000 in the 9 months. Year-ago periods included investment gains of $ 16,000 and $ 594,000 in the quarter and 9 months, respectively.

description: Rear Adm. Edwin Boardman Dexter, a retired executive director of the Pan American Coffee Bureau and the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, died on Oct. 19 at his retirement home in Seminole, Fla. A former resident of Manhattan, he was 88.

description: ATTENTION, Madison Avenue. There's a blue light special on a big advertising account of a big, though troubled, retailer.

title: The Endgame: For Pataki, Fighting Giuliani Became the Way to Fight Cuomo
description: In the moments after Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani endorsed Gov. Mario M. Cuomo for re-election, strategists for State Senator George E. Pataki held their collective breaths. Should they ignore it? Should they denounce Mr. Giuliani as a turncoat?

description: b-Included a gain on the sale of property of $ 741,217, or 3 cents a share.

title: Intricate Planning Is Revealed In Escape From Wallkill Prison
description: The four convicted killers who escaped from a maximum security prison in Wallkill early on Monday used hacksaw blades to cut their jail cell bars and bedsheets to hoist themselves to the prison rooftop, the Ulster County District Attorney, Michael Kavanagh, said yesterday.

title:
Rocken Journal;
No Superman, Perhaps, but the Titan of His Town
description: The change in Friedrich Nietzsche's status in eastern Germany can be seen on the welcome sign of this tiny hamlet in Saxony-Anhalt State where the philosopher was born 150 years ago and lies buried.

title: COX CABLE TO ACQUIRE SYSTEM IN VIRGINIA
description: Cox Cable Communications signed a definitive agreement yesterday to buy a cable television system in Newport News, Va., from two limited partnerships operated by Tele-Communications Inc. Cox Cable, a division of Cox Enterprises of Atlanta, will pay more than $100 million for the system, which serves more than 48,000 customers in Newport News, an executive involved in the transaction said. The system's service area is across the James River from Cox Cable Hampton Roads, which serves almost 200,000 customers in Norfolk, Portsmouth and Virginia Beach, Va.

title: THE 1994 ELECTIONS: CONGRESS -- NEWS ANALYSIS How Lasting a Majority?; Despite Sweeping Gains for Republicans, History Suggests the Power Is Temporary
description: Everything in Washington is changed by Tuesday's Republican sweep. The question is for how long.

title: New and Softer View of a Late Hit
description: Giants wide receiver Thomas Lewis shed some new light today on the controversy involving the hit on Dallas wide receiver Alvin Harper, a controversy that will linger all this week as the league ponders fining players on both teams.

description: Breathes there a college or graduate-school applicant, past or present, who does not know the name of STANLEY KAPLAN?

title: Spacelabs Medical Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: The latest quarter included a one-time pretax charge of $ 2.4 million for costs incurred as a result of the damage sustained at the California manufacturing facility during the January earthquake.

title: Michael O'Donoghue, 54, Dies; Writer for 'Saturday Night Live'
description: Michael O'Donoghue, a comedy writer who helped create two of his generation's best-known institutions of humor, National Lampoon magazine and the NBC television show "Saturday Night Live," died yesterday in Manhattan. He was 54 and lived in Manhattan.

title: As State Split, High Turnout Upstate Elected Pataki and Reflected Change
description: George E. Pataki won the governorship on the strength of sweepingly high voter turnout in the upstate areas that make up his base, where nearly 70 percent of registered voters went to the polls on Tuesday, compared to just under half in New York City and just over half in the suburban counties around it.

description: The F.C.C. giveth and the F.C.C. taketh away.

title: Video-Cellist Tribute
description: To the Editor:

title: The Death Squads Have My Husband
description: After a month of my hunger strike here in front of Guatemala's National Palace, I am thinking of many things. I think, of course, of my husband, Efrain Bamaca Velasquez, and of what he must be suffering in his secret torture cell. I think, too, of my 10-year involvement with Guatemala, with the people I so love, and of the army that has long been branded one of the worst human rights violators in the Western Hemisphere. I think of the Guatemalans who continue to die.

title: Equity Residential Properties Trust (EQR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 879,000 in non-recurring property management expenses in both the quarter and 9 months.Year-ago share earnings are not applicable, as the company's initial public offering was Aug. 12, 1993.Based on $ 12,240,000 in the quarter and $ 32,828,000 in the 9 months, which represents income before allocation to minority interests.

title: S. O. Adebo, 80, a U.N. Envoy; Pioneered Nigeria Civil Service
description: S. O. Adebo, a pioneer of the Nigerian civil service, and a former United Nations envoy and university president, died of a stroke on Sept. 30 at Sacred Heart Hospital in Abeokuta, Nigeria. He was 80.

title: The Gods Transplanted To Texas
description: Camp, once largely the province of gay men and the women who loved them, has been sure-footedly working its way into the mainstream over the last several decades. John Waters movies can be seen at local malls; "Twin Peaks" was, however briefly, a television hit, and aging starlets like Joan Collins have translated the sensibility into flourishing second careers.

title: A New Guideline on History Looks Beyond Old Europe
description: A Federal education panel today will announce new world-history standards that keep William the Conqueror and the Battle of Hastings in public-school lesson plans but also give emphasis to non-European hallmarks like China's Sung dynasty, which developed paper currency, gunpowder and wood-block book printing from the 10th to the 13th century.

title: Ex-Giants Coach Is Named OTB President by Giuliani
description: Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani named a new president yesterday to take over the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation, which for the second year in a row finished the fiscal year with a deficit.

title: Pataki Voices Shock at Learning Size of Gap in Budget He Inherits
description: Governor-elect George E. Pataki expressed shock today upon learning that he would inherit a projected $4 billion budget shortfall next year from the Cuomo administration, but said he remained committed to his campaign pledge to cut income taxes by 25 percent over four years.

title: Corrections
description: A brief report in the state-by-state election summary yesterday and on Wednesday about the results in Alaska misidentified Tony Knowles, a candidate for Governor. He was the Democratic challenger; the current Governor is Walter J. Hickel. The outcome of the race remains undecided. Mr. Knowles holds a slight lead over his Republican opponent, Jim Campbell, but absentee ballots remain to be counted.

title: Mexican Telephone Shares Drop Sharply
description: A day after AT&T announced that it would compete against Telefonos de Mexico rather than join with it in providing long-distance service here, shares of the Mexican telephone company plummeted 8 percent, dragging the stock market to one of its worst losses of the year.

title: Boycott Threatened
description: JOSE SULAIMAN, the president of the World Boxing Council, threatened yesterday to lead a Mexican boycott of fights in California to protest a new law that would deny social services to undocumented immigrants in the state.

title: Elron Electronic Industries Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss from an accounting adjustment of $ 328,000, or 2 cents a share.

title: CHRONICLE
description: How far will powerful women travel to meet other powerful women? Quite a distance, said GAEL GREENE, the restaurant critic, who has noticed increasing numbers of women from out of town and out of state making reservations for the eighth annual Citymeals-on-Wheels Power Lunch for Women. This year, 340 women (and a dozen men) are expected to converge for lunch at the Rainbow Room on Monday.

title: Jet Defense Gets Physical, Gets Well
description: It was never the downfield hit that defined the Jets' defense. It was the phenomenon of the Sack Exchange: a relentless, quarterback-chasing front four that became the darling of Madison Avenue in the 1980's.

title: California Immigration Measure Faces Rocky Legal Path
description: Proposition 187, the anti-illegal immigration initiative approved decisively by California voters on Tuesday, may well turn out to be a classic case of unintended consequences. It is also likely to provoke years of political debate and litigation about its meaning and its constitutionality.

title: The Rising G.O.P. Tide Overwhelms the Democratic Levees in the South
description: As Democrats around the country pick up the pieces from the Republican landslide on Tuesday, nowhere is the shock greater, the losses bigger and the implications harsher than in the South.

For Better Troop Living, $2.7 Billion Is Shifted From Weapons
description: Aiming to avert potentially serious morale and recruiting problems, the Pentagon plans to spend an additional $2.7 billion over the next six years to improve housing conditions, child care and other programs for troops and their families, Defense Secretary William J. Perry said today.

title: Mother Is Called Remorseful in Boys' Killing
description: Susan V. Smith, the woman who reported that her two young sons had been kidnapped in a carjacking and then confessed to drowning them, has expressed "great remorse" to her jailers, a law-enforcement official says.

title: Plea Offered In Gun Death Of 3-Year-Old
description: A drug dealer has pleaded guilty to manslaughter for showing off his gun to two children and leaving it on a television set, where one of the children picked it up and fatally shot the other.

title: Givenchy Is Suing Discounters
description: Parfums Givenchy Inc. sued Wal-Mart, Kmart, Sears, Marshalls, Perfumania and several other discount stores today, accusing the stores of of violating copyright laws by selling its Amarige and Ysatis perfumes without permission.

description: Robert Berlind Tibor de Nagy Gallery 41 West 57th Street Through Nov. 26

title: Louis Nizer, Lawyer to the Famous, Dies at 92
description: Louis Nizer, the shrewd and voluble trial lawyer who made a long career of representing famous people in famous cases and whose autobiography, "My Life in Court," was a best seller, died yesterday at Beth Israel Medical Center in Manhattan. He was 92 and lived in midtown Manhattan.

title: Gap Inc.(GPS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
At the Bar; A code that defines Albania has a mixed role in shaping a legal system for that country.
description: For the last three years, American lawyers and judges have been journeying here to help this Balkan country develop a modern system of law. And despite the rejection of a constitution in a national referendum, their combined pro bono efforts have been successful: a bill of rights adopted by Parliament; a criminal code awaiting approval, and legislation passed on hazardous waste, land use and commercial activities.

title: Schlichter Pleads Guilty
description: The former Ohio State and National Football League quarterback ART SCHLICHTER pleaded guilty yesterday in Las Vegas, Nev., to a Federal charge of bank fraud for stealing and writing $175,000 in bad checks.

title: Usery Restarts Talks, But Ravitch Is Silent
description: In the first bargaining session in two months, baseball's club owners today offered to take their coveted salary cap off the table. The offer, however, wasn't as magnanimous or as significant as it might appear, because the owners attached a large but to the idea.

title: Drowning Case Embitters U.S. Race Relations; Sowing Discord
description: To the Editor:

title: Discovery Zone
description: In a continuing drop, shares of Discovery Zone Inc., an operator of children's recreation centers, fell sharply yesterday after a Paine Webber analyst lowered his stock recommendation. On Wednesday, the company reported a third-quarter loss.

title:
Luxury Rental Buildings;
Project Starts as the Market Picks Up
description: Over the next six weeks, a 31-story luxury rental building is to rise on a long-vacant lot on the Upper East Side. The project is one of only a handful of new privately financed residential buildings to be developed in the city since the mid-80's construction boom.

title: Glimpse of Things to Come As Lopez Puts on a Show
description: The maturation process will progress in a methodical manner for the St. John's basketball team this season with tiny steps being taken here and there. The Red Storm is young and anxious to learn so their improvement on the court will be a daily grind.

title: Dollar Gains, Then Steadies After U.S. Bond Activity
description: The dollar was steady against most leading currencies yesterday, following United States bonds higher before retreating.

title: Suffolk Lawmakers Seek District Attorney Inquiry
description: The Suffolk County Legislature voted today to ask Gov. Mario M. Cuomo to investigate allegations that District Attorney James M. Catterson Jr. abused his powers by threatening lawmakers and other county officials with grand-jury investigations.

title: At Trenton State, Titles Up for Grabs
description: The defense is so efficient, the goalkeeper has nothing to do for long stretches of games. And if the opposition happens to break through, Jeanne Bizzoco is there to deny anyone threatening the goal of the Trenton State field hockey team.

title: At the U.N., Fear Deepens Over Rwanda
description: Senior advisers to Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali met tonight to consider asking that more United Nations troops be sent to Rwanda to counter what they fear is a threat to invade the country by 30,000 members of the defeated Rwandan army.

title: No Execution For Suspect In Shootings, Judge Says
description: Colin Ferguson, charged with killing six people on a Long Island Rail Road train, sought -- and received -- reassurance from a judge today that he would not face execution even if he is found guilty and Governor-elect George E. Pataki signs the death penalty into law.

title: Pepsico's No. 2 Official Will Head New Unit
description: In a move widely seen as strengthening his status as the heir apparent at Pepsico Inc., Roger A. Enrico, the company's second-ranking executive, was named yesterday to head a new unit that would oversee the international operations of its KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell fast-food restaurants.

title: Claire's Stores Inc.(CLE,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
William R. Hesse, 80, an Ad Executive
description: William R. Hesse, an advertising executive who headed one of the nation's largest agencies and the American Association of Advertising Agencies, died Tuesday at his home in Yarmouthport, Mass. He was 80.

title: A Choreographer's Meditations on Death and Loss
description: Death is as eternal as life, as writers and painters -- more than choreographers -- have acknowledged over the centuries. In the last 10 years, however, AIDS has profoundly transformed the dance world and engendered new themes.

title: Topics of The Times; Profiles in Opportunism
description: Talk about slipping out of the hills to bayonet the wounded! As the most conservative Democrat in the Senate, Richard Shelby had already embarrassed Vice President Al Gore on television with his refusal to support the Clinton economic plan, so his desertion to the ictorious Republicans this week was hardly a huge surprise.

title: New York, Shown at Its Best Through a Hero at His Worst
description: "Manhattan by Numbers" was shown as part of the 1993 New Directors/New Films series. Following are excerpts from Vincent Canby's review, which appeared in The New York Times on April 2, 1993. The film opens today at the Quad Cinema, 13th Street west of Fifth Avenue, Greenwich Village.

title: Bass Affiliates In Hotel Fund
description: Two partnerships affiliated with Robert M. Bass, the Texas billionaire, have formed a $250 million fund with Capstar Hotels, a hotel management company, to invest in hotel properties.

title: Jazz Finds a Lonely Follower in the Australian Desert
description: One day in the remote Australian village of Poona Flat, strange music drops out of the sky, and a little boy named John Anderson has an epiphany. It is 1969. A cargo plane carrying members of a jazz ensemble has been diverted to the outback for an unscheduled layover. As the villagers stare, dumbfounded, seven musicians file onto the runway and give an impromptu jazz concert. John is riveted by the sounds coming from the trumpet of the group's lead player, Billy Cross (Miles Davis). "You seemed tuned into it," Billy tells the star-struck boy afterward. "If you ever come to Paris, look me up."

title: Echo Bay Mines Ltd. (ECO,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ground Beef That May Be Tainted Is Recalled
description: The Department of Agriculture has announced the recall of 9,000 pounds of ground beef from Monfort Inc., a food processing firm in Greeley, Colo. The company is voluntarily recalling the meat because it may be contaminated with E. coli, bacteria that was responsible for the deaths of four children and the illness of hundreds of others in the Northwest last year.

title: E.P.A. Delays A Decision On Emissions
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency, which was supposed to announce yesterday whether California's strict automobile emissions standards would be applied to 12 eastern states, will spend an additional month trying to broker a compromise between the states and the auto industry.

title: Big 3 Want Clinton Aid On Rules
description: Saying a Government finding of a safety defect in General Motors pickup trucks "threatens the entire automotive industry," the chief executives of the Big Three auto makers sent a joint letter to President Clinton today urging him to "address the intolerable state of regulatory uncertainty" that the pickup issue could create.

title: Regency Health Services Inc.(RHS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included nonrecurring restructuring expenses of $ 2.4 million, or 14 cents a share, and a reduction of share appreciation rights expense of $ 344,000, or 2 cents a share.c-Included nonrecurring merger and restructuring expenses of $ 10.6 million, or 64 cents a share, and a reduction of share appreciation rights expense of $ 140,000, or 1 cent a share. The period also included an extraordinary charge of $ 975,000, or 6 cents a share, from earthquake damage.d-Net income, which included extraordinary charge of $ 48,000 on loss from retirement of debt.Share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.(Loss)

title: American Travellers Corp.(ATVC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: American Travellers said the year-ago third quarter reflected a tax adjustment because of an increase in corporate federal income tax rates to 35 percent from 34 percent. Accounting rules require that the company adjust its deferred tax liability to reflect any tax rate change.The adjustment, totaling $ 810,000, or 8 cents a share, consisted of a $ 702,000 charge for 1992 and prior, and a $ 108,000 charge for the first 6 months of 1993.American Travellers also said fourth quarter results will benefit from the company's recent acquisition of J.C. Penney Insurance Cos.' $ 25 million book of long term care business, which is not included in the 9 month totals.

title: New Majority's Agenda: Substantial Changes May Be Ahead
description: When Republicans take control of the Senate and House in January, they will propose a legislative agenda drastically different from President Clinton's, which could lead to substantial changes in a broad array of Federal programs and laws, as well as the workings of Congress. Following are brief looks at the main issues. EDUCATION

title: Silence May Speak Against the Accused in Britain
description: In Britain, as in the United States, people arrested for a criminal offense have received a ritual police warning: They have the right to refuse to answer all questions put to them by investigators. It is only what they say that can be used against them.

title: Right vs. Realities in Romania, 1925
description: To appreciate "An Unforgettable Summer," it helps to dismiss the mawkish, romance-novel title. Set in Romania in 1925, the film begins with scenes of cosmopolitan decadence, jazz-age glamour and fierce political undercurrents. On their way to a glittering, fancy-dress ball, Romanian army officers stop by a brothel, where they beat the women yelling antimilitary slogans at them. Next, Kristin Scott-Thomas (the sophisticate from "Four Weddings and a Funeral") arrives at the ball. She plays the beautiful, elegant Marie-Therese Von Debretsy Dumitriu, a woman with bobbed hair, diaphanous dresses and an unaccountably graceful smile. As Marie-Therese dances, an elderly relative at the party describes her background.

title: Pension Liabilities May Lead To Charge at Westinghouse
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation may take a pretax charge of $200 million to $250 million against its fourth-quarter earnings, as workers retiring or being laid off under its restructuring program withdraw money from the company's pension plan.

title: After Big Victory, Sri Lankan Says She'll Resume Rebel Talks
description: After overwhelming her opponent in Sri Lanka's presidential election by a margin of more than two million votes, Prime Minister Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga said today that she would resume talks with the Tamil Tigers rebels to try to end the country's 11-year-old civil war.

title: Worthy Says His Goodbyes
description: James Worthy chose retirement rather than another season of decline. His knees are arthritic, his new teammates are of another generation and his old teammates sit in the Lakers' board room. "It was time," said Worthy, 33, the last link to Lakers' championship era.

title: LSB Industries Inc.(LSB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 24,200,000 gain on the sale of an equity bank.c-Net income(Loss)

title: More Students Than Athletes, as the 44 Losses Prove
description: The day embraced all the essentials of a grand and glorious homecoming football game for small Prairie View A&M. The sun was shining brightly in southeastern Texas. The halftime show featured Prairie View's renowned marching band, typically bold and brassy. The stands of Blackshear Stadium were filled to capacity with 6,000 alumni, students and supporters.

title: Vons Cos.(VON,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 9
description: b-Net lossc-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 1.4 million, or 3 cents a share, on debt refinancing, in the quarter and 9 months.(Loss)The latest periods included a pretax restructuring charge of $ 19 million, or 26 cents a share, after tax, taken to close underperforming stores and reduce administrative personnel. The year-ago periods included a pretax restructuring charge of $ 56.9 million.

title: Temerlin Gets A L'Eggs Account
description: The L'Eggs Products division of the Sara Lee Corporation in Winston-Salem, N.C., said yesterday that it had named Temerlin McClain in Irving, Tex., to handle advertising for its Just My Size brand, previously at Saatchi & Saatchi Advertising in New York. Billings were estimated at $6 million to $10 million.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption yesterday with an article about children serving in rebel military movements referred incorrectly to the role of children in the Zapatista organization in Mexico. While some were trained by the rebels, the children were never reported to have fought with them.

title: Debartolo Realty Corp.(EJD,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 8,900,000, or 11 cents a share.The company said figures are pro forma, assuming the formation of the company on Jan. 1, 1993.

title: Nash Finch Co.(NAFC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 8
Corrections
description: An article in Business Day on Tuesday about a deal for the Sears Tower misstated the effect of the transaction on Sears, Roebuck & Company's fourth-quarter earnings. The company will record an after-tax gain of $195 million; it will not pay $195 million.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-10 U.S. TO SKIRT BOSNIA EMBARGO Breaking with its European allies, the Clinton Administration has directed the American military to stop enforcing the arms embargo against the Bosnian Government beginning on Saturday. A1 SARAJEVO ATTACK TIED TO MUSLIMS Releasing a crater analysis, United Nations officials suggested that the Bosnian Government's Muslim-led forces fired the shell that killed a child in Sarajevo this week. A10

title: When in Rome, Beware of Pickpockets
description: To the Editor:

title: Claim by Wounded Officer
description: The black undercover transit officer mistakenly shot by a white New York City police officer last summer filed a legal claim yesterday against the city and the officer who shot him, charging that the Police Department sought to cover up evidence. The claim by Officer Desmond Robinson, seeking $50 million in damages, was filed with the City Comptroller.

title: Dr. James Watts, 90, Pioneer In Use of Frontal Lobotomy
description: Dr. James W. Watts, a neurosurgeon who performed the first frontal lobotomy in the United States, died on Monday at Sibley Memorial Hospital in Washington. He was 90 and lived in Washington.

title: Images to Cherish in the Realm of the Word
description: On the lower level of the Museum of Modern Art there is an exhibition, "A Century of Artists Books," that harks back to the glory days when the museum was still very young. It has the further merit of being up to date, with the latest in the avant-garde book.

title: Topics of The Times; Connecticut Revisits its Income Tax
description: Let no one quibble about John Rowland's 36 percent victory in Connecticut. His share of the vote for governor in a four-way race was not significantly less than Lowell Weicker's winning share in a three-way race in 1990. Governor Weicker used his victory to force adoption of a personal income tax. Mr. Rowland, a Republican with the advantage of a newly elected Republican majority in the State Senate, is pledged to repeal it.

title: Cancer Activists Boost Immune Response
description: To the Editor:

title: Kuwaiti Government to Sell Santa Fe's Petroleum Assets
description: Kuwait, which has been scaling down its United States petroleum operations, announced today that it planned to sell the oil and natural gas properties owned by its Santa Fe International Corporation.

title: Coke Adds to Operations Of Fruitopia Drink Unit
description: Intensifying the fruit-drink wars in one of the fastest-growing beverage categories, the Coca-Cola Company announced yesterday that it had invested $150 million to expand production of its Fruitopia beverage division and would introduce a new lower-calorie line of Fruitopia flavors as well.

title: SunAmerica Inc.(SAI,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 33.5 million, or 81 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest periods included investment losses of $ 4,558,000 in the quarter and $ 21,124,000 in the year, compared with investment losses of $ 7,746,000 and $ 21,287,000 in year-ago periods, respectively.

title: 2 Haitians Working for U.S. Embassy Slain
description: Two Haitian employees of the United States Embassy here were shot and killed today and a third seriously wounded in what American officials described as a payroll robbery and car hijacking.

title: After 10 Years, Wrongful Death Trial Begins
description: With thunderous, incantatory accusations, a lawyer for the father of Libby Zion, whose nearly decade-old lawsuit against New York Hospital went to trial yesterday, blamed the 18-year-old woman's death not only on the hospital staff's "litany of errors," but on established medical training, which he said produced residents who were "inexperienced, unsupervised, overworked and sleep-deprived."

title: Farm Life of the 20's For Children of the 90's
description: I TOOK my two children to Muscoot Farm on a dreary Sunday in November, when the bored quarreling that begins on a day to be spent indoors sent me running for a map and extra sweat shirts and dry socks to stuff in a shopping bag. The farm, in the Westchester County town of Somers, is a long drive from our house in New Jersey, and there were moments, as we approached the Tappan Zee Bridge, when I had my doubts as the rain and the unseasonably warm temperature wrapped the car in a white haze. My daughters ate the Halloween candy they had brought and submerged themselves in headsets and the silence that usually means the Offspring and Pink Floyd. But it was raining, and I was on the run from a Sunday indoors.

title: Bosnia Army Said to Shell Its Own Area
description: Releasing a crater analysis of a shell that exploded here on Tuesday, wounding a child, United Nations military officials today gave what appeared to be the first compelling evidence that the mostly Muslim Bosnian Army carried out a mortar attack on a Sarajevo neighborhood under its control.

title: DIGITAL EQUIPMENT TO SELL MORE ASSETS TO RAISE CASH
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation plans to sell more assets to raise cash, its chief executive, Robert B. Palmer, said yesterday. He said negotiations were under way to sell about "100 little things," like buildings and parcels of land, but he would not say how much cash the sales could bring. Mr. Palmer made the remarks during a news conference after the company's annual meeting. Digital Equipment, the computer company based in Maynard, Mass., has been struggling to return to profitability after three years of losses. In response to shareholders' questions, Mr. Palmer reiterated his goal to produce break-even results in the current quarter.

title: Jessica Tandy Memorial
description: A tribute to the actress Jessica Tandy is to take place on Nov. 22 at noon at the Shubert Theater, 224 West 44th Street, Manhattan. Among those to speak at the tribute, which is open to the public, are Kathy Bates, Zoe Caldwell, Frances Sternhagen, Karl Malden, Mike Nichols, Alan J. Pakula and Tandy Cronyn, Miss Tandy's daughter. Hume Cronyn, Miss Tandy's husband, is not scheduled to speak. Miss Tandy died on Sept. 11 at the age of 85.

title: Greyhound Deal Averts Bankruptcy
description: Greyhound Lines Inc. avoided a second plunge into bankruptcy by agreeing today to give bondholders 45 percent of the company's stock and two seats on a nine-member board.

title: After Killing, Irish Halt I.R.A. Release Plan
description: The Irish Government withdrew its plans for the early release of Irish Republican Army prisoners today, hours after a postal worker in Northern Ireland was shot dead by men suspected of being I.R.A. guerrillas.

title: Mr. Dole's Packwood Problem
description: For members of Congress eager to exercise real power, there is nothing sweeter than heading an important committee. This week's election means that House and Senate Republicans are about to get that chance. But Senate Republican leaders face one awkward dilemma: the all-but-certain elevation of Bob Packwood of Oregon to head the pivotal Finance Committee.

title: Clinton Asks G.O.P. to Back Free Trade
description: President Clinton appealed today to the newly victorious Republicans to maintain their party's traditional support for free trade and approve a worldwide trade agreement in Congress, arguing that failure to do so would "jeopardize our leadership and our prosperity."

The 6 months was also after a net charge of $ 46,639,000, or $ 1.02 a share, from two accounting changes.(Loss)During the quarter ended Sept. 30, 1993, the company adjusted its net deferred tax asset to reflect a change in corporate income tax rates. As a result of this change, income taxes in the year-ago quarter and 6 months included a credit mentioned above.

title: Giacometti, Surveyed From Start to Finish
description: Exceptional exhibitions of the work of Alberto Giacometti (1901-1966), the Swiss artist who brought a new psychological reality to figurative sculpture in the years after World War II, are becoming somewhat frequent in Manhattan. In the last 18 months, both the Gagosian Gallery and the Yoshii Gallery have examined aspects of Giacometti's achievement in small, focused shows. Now the Acquavella Gallery is taking its turn, with an exhibition, far from small, that presents a brisk synopsis of nearly the artist's entire career.

title: CHRONICLE
description: There are scholarships for people who study Chinese history, brain surgery, chemical engineering . . . and now, for those who want to design perfume bottles.

title: No Headline
description: "It hurts to walk out for the second half and see everybody leaving -- we hate it. But we've grown accumstomed to it. Happens every home game. At other colleges, football players walk around campus and people respect them. Here, you get more respect being in the band." MICHAEL PORTER, a running back on the ever-losing Prairie View football team. [ B9:5. ]

title: With Waiting Game Over, Graham Is Ready to Roll
description: If Kent Graham is lacking in anything, it is definitely not confidence. Now, his task is to spread some of it around to his teammates.

description: To the Editor:

title: Home Video
description: CD-ROM Made Simpler

title: Reagan Revolution Redux
description: Tuesday's carnage was not, as many liberal pundits have claimed, a revolt of random wrath against incumbents. The voters directed their fire at liberal Democrats, and set in motion the second stage of the Reagan Revolution, which will make the one-term Presidencies of George Bush and Bill Clinton seem like political hiccups.

title: U.S. Makes Public Millions of Long-Secret Papers
description: President Clinton today signed an executive order declassifying nearly 44 million pages of long-secret documents, some dating to World War I, in an action delayed for nearly a year by the objections of military and intelligence officials.

title: Defections Among Men to G.O.P. Helped Insure Rout of Democrats
description: Large numbers of men abandoned Democratic candidates in Tuesday's elections, a trend that gave Republicans an edge in races around the nation and one that Democratic leaders fear might be hard to reverse.

title: Sabatini Is in Sensitive Spot
description: Painful to win, painful to lose. That's how Gabriela Sabatini characterized the singular opportunity of facing retirement-bound Martina Navratilova in the opening round of the Slims Championships on Tuesday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: In Their Own Words: The Republican Promises
description: During the election campaign, Republican candidates for Congress gathered in Washington to endorse a set of proposals for legislative action that they called their "Contract With America." They said that in the first 100 days of the 104th Congress, they would introduce bills they described as follows: 1. The Fiscal Responsibility Act: A balanced budget/tax limitation amendment and a legislative line-item veto to restore fiscal responsibility to an out-of-control Congress, requiring them to live under the same budget constraints as families and businesses. 2. The Taking Back Our Streets Act: An anti-crime package including stronger truth-in-sentencing, "good faith" exclusionary rule exemptions, effective death penalty provisions, and cuts in social spending from this summer's "crime" bill to fund prison construction and additional law enforcement to keep people secure in their neighborhoods and kids safe in their schools. 3. The Personal Responsibility Act: Discourage illegitimacy and teen pregnancy by prohibiting welfare to minor mothers and denying increased AFDC for additinal children while on welfare, cut spending for welfare programs, and enact a tough two-years-and-out provision with work requirements to promote individual responsibility. 4. The Family Reinforcement Act: Child support enforcement, tax incentive for adoption, strengthening rights of parents in their children's education, stronger child pornography laws, and an elderly dependent care tax credit to reinforce the central role of families in American society. 5. The American Dream Restoration Act: A $500 per child tax credit, begin repeal of the marriage tax penalty, and creation of American Dream Savings Accounts to provide middle class tax relief. 6. The National Security Restoration Act: No U.S. troops under U.N. command and restoration of the essential parts of our national security funding to strengthen our national defense and maintain our credibility around the world. 7. The Senior Citizens Fairness Act: Raise the Social Security earnings limit which currently forces seniors out of the work force, repeal the 1993 tax hikes on Social Security benefits and provide tax incentive for private long-term care insurance to let older Americans keep more of what they have earned over the years. 8. The Hob Creation and Wage Enhancement Act: Small business incentives, capital gains cut and indexation, neutral cost recovery, risk assessment/cost-benefit analysis, strengthening the Regulatory Flexibility Act and unfunded mandate reform to create jobs and raise worker wages. 9. The Common Sense Legal Reform Act: "Loser pays" laws, reasonable limits on punitive damages and reform of product liablility laws to stem the endless tide of litigation. 10. The Citizen Legislative Act: A first ever vote on term limits to replace career politicians with citizen legislators.

title: Addis Ababa Journal; Where Tyrants Ruled, Cry for Justice
description: Berhanu Meshesha is now 71 and frail, and the events he describes are nearly two decades past. But he remembers every moment clearly.

title: 3 Boys Held in Robbery of Off-Duty Officer
description: Three teen-age boys were arrested and charged with robbing an off-duty police sergeant and two other men on Staten Island yesterday, the police said.

description: The nations of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum, which represent more than half the world's economic output, all say they agree in principle with President Clinton that the path to further prosperity is to lower ever more barriers to trade and investment.

title: The Spoken Word
description: HUDSON VALLEY STORYTELLING FESTIVAL. A weekend of events sponsored by Bard and Vassar Colleges and the Mid-Hudson Teacher Center. Tonight at 8, "Storytellers on Stage!" with Donna Bailey, Jim May and Peninnah Schram at Vassar College, Chapel Building, Raymond Avenue, Poughkeepsie, N.Y.; tickets: $9. Tomorrow, 8 A.M. to 6 P.M., a conference with workshops at Bard College, F. W. Olin Humanities Building, Annandale-on-Hudson, N.Y.; fee: $60. Tomorrow at 8 P.M., "Storytellers on Stage!" with Motoko, Tom Weakley and Marianne McShane at Bard; tickets: $8 in advance; $9 at the door. On Sunday, two storytelling programs, at 1 and 3 P.M., with the Ivy Vine Players, Jonathan Kruk, the Storycrafters and Motoko; tickets: $4 in advance; $5 at the door. Information: (914) 635-3887. WARTIME STORYTELLING, Seamen's Church Institute, 241 Water Street, lower Manhattan. Four World War II veterans who spent time in the port of New York City speak. Today at 3 P.M. Free. Information: (212) 349-9090.

title: Spurious Sequel? Well, Fiddledeedee
description: "Ah doan know nuthin' 'bout birthin' babies!" the hysterical maid screamed at Scarlett O'Hara in "Gone With the Wind." Maybe the poor girl didn't. But the Margaret Mitchell estate sure does, especially million-dollar babies with 5-and-10-cent entertainment possibilities.

title: Fighter Is Indicted
description: A Federal grand jury in Miami returned a drug indictment against the featherweight boxer RUBEN PALACIO of Colombia, who last year became the first boxing champion to test positive for the virus that causes AIDS.

title: Republicans Stand Ready To Transform the Agenda
description: Republican control of Congress holds the potential for an upheaval in the capital's legislative agenda, with Republican lawmakers pressing proposals ranging from cutting taxes to changing the welfare system to reducing foreign aid. The dimensions of the possible changes became clear today when a leading Republican lawmaker said one of his long-range goals was to replace the Federal income tax with other sources of revenue.

The account was previously handled by Campbell Mithun and various other agencies.

While billings on the account have ranged from $6 million to $8 million, the company said it planned to increase spending in 1995 to $10 million to $12 million.

description: The stock market, after a short-lived morning rally, drifted lower yesterday in moderate trading, with only four stocks advancing for about every seven declining on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: U.S. Changes Stance in Case On Obscenity
description: Stung by Congressional criticism of its legal interpretation of a child-pornography law, the Clinton Administration reversed course in a brief filed with the Supreme Court today and disavowed its previous position that the law applied only to depictions of nude children.

title: Paul Frame, 80, Book Illustrator
description: Paul Frame, an award-winning illustrator of 300 children's books and the designer of Lord & Taylor's signature rose, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 80.

title: Woman Can Be Buried Beside Husband
description: The feud between John Biango's wife and his sister began as he lay dying of cancer in 1990. And it has persisted in and out of court since, with the sister, Dorothy Pagano, insisting that her brother's dying wish was that his wife, Christine, should never be buried next to him.

title: Rapture and Terror, Bound by Blood
description: EROTICISM bubbles beneath the surface of every vampire story, but Anne Rice is a writer to make the pot boil. Ms. Rice's hothouse blend of pretension, swooning seduction and avidly sensual horror has brought strikingly contemporary nuances to the vampire genre, infusing it with the literary equivalent of new blood. Her dense, suffocating novels have done as much to plumb old mysteries of the occult as to create new ones atop the best-seller list -- but that's another story.

title: Bausch & Lomb Chooses Bozell
description: Bausch & Lomb Inc. of Rochester said yesterday that it had selected Bozell New York to handle advertising for its Curel and Soft Sense skin-care products, which had been handled by Margeotes Fertitta Donaher & Weiss in New York since June 1993. Billings were estimated at $10 million to $12 million. Bozell was awarded the account after a eight-month review that was narrowed to Bozell and two other New York shops, Lowe & Partners/SMS and Warwick Baker & Fiore.

Hardly the stuff of legal legend, yet the Court's handling of the question constitutes a significant boost for public justice.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Flu Knocks Edberg Out Stefan Edberg yesterday pulled out of the $1.1 million European Community Championship in Antwerp, Belgium, because of a throat infection, giving Jared Palmer of the United States a free ride into the quarterfinals. Edberg had a fever of 101 degrees and could barely speak because of tonsillitis when he withdrew from the tournament. In other tournament play, Pete Sampras beat Richey Reneberg, 6-3, 6-3, yesterday to reach the quarterfinals. Sampras remains the only star player in the $1.1 million event. (AP)

title: First State Audits Show Two Municipalities How to Save Money as Whitman Cuts Aid
description: Gov. Christine Todd Whitman today delivered the first installment of her promise to show New Jersey's municipalities and school districts how to live with her state tax cuts, releasing audits that list potential tax savings of millions of dollars in one town but less in another.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Oct. 23 about anti-incumbent sentiment in Congressional races in the New York region referred incorrectly to the Congressional service of members of the Hamilton Fish family. It has not been continuous since 1922; a Hamilton Fish was elected in 1920 and represented the Hudson Valley area until 1944, and his son, Hamilton Fish Jr., held the seat from 1969 until this year.

title: New Chairman for a Changed Sears
description: It was perhaps one of Corporate America's most poignant changings of the guard.

title: S.E.C. Issues Municipal Bond Rules
description: After more than a year of discussion, compromise and negotiation, the Securities and Exchange Commission enacted new rules yesterday to bring the municipal bond market into the modern age. The rules will provide investors with annual reports from municipalities -- just like corporate reports -- and make it easier for investors to get bond prices.

title: Federal Judge Praises Vote on Nassau Charter
description: The Federal judge who declared Nassau County's government unconstitutional praised voters today for approving a new county legislature in a referendum on Tuesday.

title: Japanese Central Bank Gets a New Governor
description: Japan has an odd way of doing things, but the Finance Minister chose a bizarre way of introducing the next governor of the Bank of Japan. He used a post-midnight press conference this morning to announce that Yasuo Matsushita, a former bureaucrat, would become one of the world's most powerful central bankers in December.

title: Marquette Electronics Inc.(MARQA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Marquette Electronics said that its results for the latest six months included five-months' activity from operations related to Corometrics Medical Systems Inc., acquired on May 31.

title: On Stage, and Off
description: At Last, the Opening

title: Irish End Is Charged
description: Notre Dame's MICHAEL MILLER, a receiver and return man, has been charged in Texas in what prosecutors call a scheme to steal and forge checks to buy $50,000 worth of airline tickets, clothes and alcohol. Miller turned himself in on Wednesday, one day after Notre Dame Coach LOU HOLTZ announced without explanation that Miller had left school.

title: King World Productions Inc.(KWP,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
description: King World Productions modified its revenue recognition practices, which had a one-time impact on the fourth quarter. If prior accounting practices had been employed, net income for the latest quarter would have been $ 18.7 million, or 50 cents a share, on revenues of $ 99.3 million.If prior accounting practices had been employed, net income for fiscal 1994 would have been $ 101.2 million, or $ 2.67 a share, on revenues of $ 541.4 million.

title: Diner's Journal
description: Peanut Sauce and Lotus Jelly

title: Resorts Int'l.(RT,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Reflected extraordinary charge of $ 1.3 million, or 3 cents a share, relating to adjustments to the company's debt restructuring completed in May 1994.c-Included $ 73,108,000 loss on the sale of the company's Paradise Island operations and a $ 20,525,000 write-down of its nonoperating real estate holdings in Atlantic City. The period also reflected extraordinary gain of $ 186 million, or $ 6.13 a share, on the exchange of debt related to the company's plan of reorganization which was effective in May 1994.d-Net loss(Loss)

title: Restoring the Rails on Staten Island; Plans for Economic Revival Stretch Along 15 Miles of Track
description: To the people who live on the north shore of Staten Island, the abandoned railroad that cuts through their neighborhoods is an unsightly ruin where prostitutes and drug addicts hide. It barely resembles the gleaming steel line that 40 years ago linked local factories to their markets and carried passengers to the amusements of South Beach.

title: Resignation at Goldman
description: Goldman, Sachs & Company said yesterday that Mark O. Winkelman, partner in charge of fixed-income and commodities, was resigning. Mr. Winkelman is leaving after being passed over for a top spot at the firm two months ago, when Stephen Friedman announced that he would retire as chairman of the investment banking firm.

title: George Shimamoto, Architect, Dies at 89
description: George Gentoku Shimamoto, an architect of Japan House, the home of the Japan Society, and a former senior partner of the Gruzen Partnership architectural firm, died on Friday at Englewood Hospital in Englewood, N.J. He was 89 and lived in Fort Lee, N.J.

title: Constructing Images Of the Black Male
description: BY its title alone, "Black Male" at the Whitney Museum of American Art, which opened yesterday, promised to be an incendiary event from the moment it was announced. How could it not be? Given the political and social battleground that the issue of the black man is in our culture. Given the storms surrounding Rodney G. King and O. J. Simpson, Clarence Thomas and Marion S. Barry Jr. Given the racial undertones of the recent election. And given the Whitney's penchant for flamboyant political gestures that can end up looking opportunistic and hapless.

title: Why Do Male Athletes Assault Women? Research Begins
description: Somewhere between the West Point football gropers and the heavyweight rapist, Mike Tyson, may be a vast, troubling, uncharted area of sexual assault on women by male athletes, a kind of Bermuda Triangle of sports in which discussion mysteriously disappears.

title: A Simpler Test for Alzheimer's Is Reported
description: Researchers at Harvard Medical School believe they may have stumbled upon a simple test for Alzheimer's disease, one that can easily distinguish between those who have the devastating disorder, which relentlessly robs its victims of their minds, and those who do not.

title: Corrections
description: A map caption yesterday about Rwandan refugees referred incorrectly to the town of Murambi in some editions. It is in Rwanda, not Zaire, and there are no Rwandan exiles there.

title: Abroad at Home; Anger And Reality
description: Newt Gingrich was brilliant at playing to the resentment of Americans. Brilliant and nasty. But those of us who disliked his tactics must not let that shut our eyes to the fact that the resentment is there. It is resentment of what many Americans see as an arrogant ruling class, out of touch with their concerns.

title: G.O.P. May Drop New York From List
description: The chairman of the Republican National Committee said yesterday that he would recommend dropping New York City from the list of places the G.O.P. is considering for its 1996 convention.

title: Leucadia National (LUK,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 129,195,000, or $ 4.41 a share.

title: Scitex Corp.(SCIXF,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included $ 8 million nonrecurring charge for in-process research and development expenses incurred in the acquisition of ImMix on Sept. 30, in the quarter and 9 months.c-After a gain of $ 4,901,000, or 12 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: New Majority's Agenda: Substantial Changes May Be Ahead
description: When Republicans take control of the Senate and House in January, they will propose a legislative agenda drastically different from President Clinton's, which could lead to substantial changes in a broad array of Federal programs and laws, as well as the workings of Congress. Following are brief looks at the main issues. WELFARE

title: Green Isn't One to Mince His Words or Opinions
description: Dallas Green has never had much sympathy for drug abusers. He has always held athletes to a higher standard than the average man on the street. So it comes as no surprise that Green has no desire to see Dwight Gooden back in a Mets uniform when he completes his one-year suspension.

title: Power Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Berlitz International Inc.(BTZ,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossYear-ago 9-month results reflected 8 months since Feb. 1, 1993, as the company broke down 9 months earnings to reflect activities both before and after its February 1993 merger with Fukutake Publishing.Berlitz International had net income of $ 1.5 million, or 8 cents a share, in the month ending Jan. 31, 1993, on sales of $ 19.6 milllion. The one-month data included a gain of $ 3.1 million, or 17 cents a share, from a change in accounting principle.(Loss)

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS END TO ENFORCING BOSNIAN EMBARGO
description: Breaking with its European allies, the Clinton Administration has directed the United States military to stop enforcing the arms embargo against the Bosnian Government, beginning on Saturday.

title: Angola's Rebel on the Ropes
description: By the ordinary calculus of war, Jonas Savimbi, the guerrilla warrior whose quest for power has left Angola in ruins, at last appears to be a beaten man.

title: F.T.C. APPROVES AMERICAN HOME-CYANAMID AGREEMENT
description: The Federal Trade Commission approved an agreement yesterday requiring the American Home Products Corporation to sell some vaccine product lines as a condition of its $9.7 billion purchase of the American Cyanamid Company of Wayne, N.J. The settlement requires American Home, based in Madison, N.J., to spin off its tetanus and diphtheria vaccine lines and to continue to make the vaccines under contract for a new owner until separate production facilities can be established. American Home also agreed to spin off Cyanamid's rotavirus vaccine research and continue the project until an approved buyer can be found.

title: Moss, Wisconsin Star, Suspended After Arrest
description: BRENT MOSS, a star Wisconsin fullback and the most valuable player in the last Rose Bowl, was suspended from the team yesterday after his arrest on a drug charge, the university said.

title: An All-Too-Believable Dad Steps In for Saint Nick
description: It may be early for Christmas, but it's not too early for a clever, entertaining children's film with a realistic edge and a minimum of seasonal mush. "The Santa Clause" easily transports Tim Allen from success on television (he is the star of "Home Improvement") to bright prospects on the big screen.

title: Getting Serious on Bosnian Arms
description: Prodded by Congress, the Clinton Administration is now asking the United Nations Security Council to lift its unjust arms embargo against Bosnia and has announced that American military forces will stop enforcing that embargo tomorrow. Lifting the embargo is the right policy and the fairest, surest path to an honorable and stable peace.

title: Reliance Steel & Aluminum Co.(RS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Reliance Steel & Aluminum said contributing to the higher net income in the latest third quarter were earnings during August and September related to its Aug. 1 acquisition of Affiliated Metals in Salt Lake City.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Companies

title: The Thomas-Hill Question, Answered Anew
description: STRANGE JUSTICE The Selling of Clarence Thomas By Jane Mayer and Jill Abramson 406 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $24.95.

title: FIRST ALERT'S SHARES FALL; STOCK SALE IS POSTPONED
description: First Alert Inc. postponed a $125.4 million stock sale yesterday by its biggest investor, blaming a report that questioned the effectiveness and market potential of its carbon monoxide detectors. Shares of the company fell $1.875, to $17.125, in Nasdaq trading of almost 3.8 million shares. The stock sale, by the Thomas H. Lee Company of Boston, was priced on Tuesday at $19 a share. The company's share price fell after an article in The Wall Street Journal on Wednesday suggested that the company, based in Aurora, Ill., might be exaggerating its growth prospects. Some researchers say gas detectors can overreact to small quantities of carbon monoxide and sound false alarms, but First Alert said its detectors met safety standards.

title: Newborn Found in Garbage By Building Superintendent
description: The garbage smelled its usual smell and buzzed with flies just as it always does. But when it began to whimper yesterday morning, Cesar DeLeon took notice.

title: Speedy Muffler reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Restaurants
description: A great restaurant is like a racehorse: it may take a while to discover its style, but once it does the ride is exhilarating.

title: New Majority's Agenda: Substantial Changes May Be Ahead
description: When Republicans take control of the Senate and House in January, they will propose a legislative agenda drastically different from President Clinton's, which could lead to substantial changes in a broad array of Federal programs and laws, as well as the workings of Congress. Following are brief looks at the main issues. WHITEWATER

title: Hampson Cancels
description: The baritone Thomas Hampson has canceled his performances with the Brooklyn Philharmonic Orchestra tonight and tomorrow evening, because of a throat infection. He will be replaced by Kurt Ollmann and James Maddalena, singing works by Charles Ives and John Adams in the orchestra's "American Transcendentalists" program at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, part of the Next Wave Festival. The concert is at 8 P.M. at the Opera House, Brooklyn Academy of Music, 30 Lafayette Avenue, at Ashland Place, Fort Greene. Information: (718) 636-4100.

title: But Just Who Spoke on Election Day?
description: To the Editor:

title: Bobby McFerrin's Lively Learning Process
description: Bobby McFerrin's gentle ditty "Don't Worry, Be Happy" must seem a perverse taunt to American orchestra executives, whose incessant lament over looming deficits and declining audiences would strike the Ancient Mariner dumb. But could Mr. McFerrin himself be part of the solution?

title: More Than a Monument: The Spiritual Dimension of These Hallowed Walls
description: Americans have long revered places that they link to the shaping of their national identity: the bridge at Concord, the Alamo, the hulk of the battleship Arizona at Pearl Harbor. Few pieces of ground are so hallowed as Gettysburg, where the Civil War battle and Lincoln's address paired national unity and purpose in a way that is seen as almost mystical.

title: Sports of The Times; Ewing Ought To Plead No Contest
description: THE young giant is scary, and just getting started. Shaquille O'Neal has a turnaround jump shot now, a reliable baby hook, and, of course, he is almost impossible to keep away from the rim for too long.

title: Zilog Inc.(ZLOG,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
All Gassed Up With Not Much Place to Go
description: At least "Pontiac Moon" is what it sounds like: a movie about a Pontiac and about the moon. If there is anything else pleasant to be said, it's that the car is a cream-colored 1949 Pontiac Chief convertible in excellent condition. Both it and the moon look nice.

The 9 months was also after a gain of $ 1,010,000, or 5 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.Share figures reflected a 3-for-2 stock split paid Sept. 22, 1994.

description: Today is Veterans Day. NEW YORK

description: Prices of Treasury securities dropped yesterday, falling back from substantial early gains and ending a two-day rally as the dollar stumbled and investor fears again turned to the threat of inflation.

title: Sears, Returning to Its Roots, Is Giving Up Allstate
description: Completing a return to its retailing roots, Sears, Roebuck & Company said today that it would give control of the Allstate Corporation to Sears shareholders, shedding the last remnant of its grand strategy to build a financial services empire on the shoulders of its huge retailing business.

description: The credit ratings of J. P. Morgan & Company and the Bankers Trust New York Corporation may be downgraded by Moody's Investors Service Inc. because they face greater risks in their fastest-growing businesses.

title: Kenneth H. Ross; Manufacturer and Philanthropist, 68
description: Kenneth H. Ross, the chairman of a family-owned clothes-making company based in Milwaukee and a philanthropist, died on Wednesday at St. Luke's Hospital in Manhattan. He was 66 and lived in Milwaukee.

description: To the Editor:
