description: Reading an article on popular music the other day, I was halfway through before realizing I was asleep. This was not the article's fault.

title: Valspar Corp.(VAL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 28
description: On a pro-forma basis, as if the April 1994 spin-off of McWhorter Technologies Inc. had occurred at the beginning of fiscal 1993, Valspar would have reported net income of $ 10,149,000, or 47 cents a share, for the 1993 fourth quarter. For the 1994 fiscal year, Valspar's pro-forma net income was $ 43,538,000, or $ 2 a share, compared with pro-forma net income of $ 35,316,000, or $ 1.63 a share, for fiscal 1993.

title: William Duff-Griffin, Stage Actor, Dies
description: William Duff-Griffin, an actor who frequently appeared in productions by the New York Shakespeare Festival, died on Nov. 13 at the Manhattan home of his companion, the actor Robert Joy. He was 54.

title: Biologists Master the Treetops, The Real Scene of Forest Action
description: FROM the treetops of the Pacific Northwest to the heights of the steamy Sri Lankan jungle, biologists can be found heading upwards in record numbers into the forest canopies to mine the richness of this once remote habitat.

title: INSIDE
description: U.S. Indicts Chinatown Gang

title: Overtime Is Money, but G.M. Assembly Workers Say They've Had Enough
description: If for many workers the American dream is drifting out of reach, the 4,800 General Motors workers here have nailed it down. They own homes, cars, big-screen televisions, sometimes boats. They have the assurance of secure pensions and good medical care. Many of these men -- and most are men -- earn enough that they can comfortably support their families; their wives don't have to work.

title: Xtra Corp.(XTR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago periods' share earnings were after payment of preferred dividends.

title: Sensible Style, Imported From France
description: Ines de la Fressange considers herself a lucky woman. Lucky to be tall and thin and pretty enough to have been Chanel's top model for six years. Lucky to find partners to finance a small boutique in Paris that has grown into a worldwide business. Lucky to be able to fly the Concorde into New York last week to celebrate the first anniversary of her boutique at Saks Fifth Avenue.

title: Arctic Tribe's Hard Life Unchanged For Centuries
description: A NOMADIC tribe of reindeer herders who dress in skins, practice ritual sacrifice and have been using the same types of homemade tools and wooden sleds for more than 1,000 years may hold the key to a mystery that has long baffled archeologists.

title: 33 Suspected Chinatown Gang Members Are Indicted
description: In what law-enforcement officials called a major blow to the largest and last of the traditional criminal gangs in Chinatown, 33 suspected members of a group called the Flying Dragons were indicted yesterday on Federal racketeering charges. Two separate indictments described three murders, 12 attempted murders, heroin trafficking, illegal gambling, arson, extortion and robberies that stretched from Manhattan into Brooklyn and Queens.

title: New York City's Budget Cuts
description: The New York City budget for the current year is at least $1 billion out of balance. Mayor Rudolph Giuliani has proposed cuts to balance it, and City Council members seem ready to accept his overall estimate. But they do not accept each and every cut he would make to reach that total, especially cuts in social service programs. Negotiations to resolve their differences are under way -- in secret.

title: Vanessa Redgrave and Eileen Atkins Bring 20 Years of Letters to Life
description: "Vita and Virginia" is an evening in need of a playwright.

title: Top International Trade Official Urges U.S. to Approve Accord
description: Failure by the United States Senate to ratify the proposed new global trade agreement, the world's top trade official said yesterday, would destroy the existing world trading order, return international commerce to "the law of the jungle" and deprive the world of an estimated $500 billion in economic gains by the year 2005. Addressing a press conference at the Council on Foreign Relations in New York, the official, Peter Sutherland, who heads the Geneva organization that regulates international commerce, said it was inconceivable to him that the Senate could reject an accord that has been supported by both Republican and Democratic administrations.

title: Early Dollar Rally vs. Mark Fades in New York Trading
description: The dollar rose sharply against the German mark in European trading early yesterday before retreating in New York as traders tried to determine whether the dollar's recent gains were justified.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: CORTINES SAYS PLAN COULD CUT TEACHERS

title: Prayer in Public Schools? It's Nothing New for Many
description: As President Clinton and the new Republican leadership in Congress consider measures that would return organized prayer to public schools, it is worth remembering one thing.

title: Oneita Industries(ONA,N) reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-After a pretax charge of $ 10,731,000, including a write-off of goodwill of $ 6,651,000, or 95 cents a share, and other pretax charges of $ 4,080,000, or 36 cents a share.c-After pretax restructuring charges of $ 7,500,000.(Loss)In the latest year, Oneita had a tax provision of $ 27,000, compared with a tax credit of $ 1,632,000 in 1993.

title: Corrections
description: The weather map yesterday forecasting the day's high temperatures and precipitation carried an incorrect date. The forecast was for 2 P.M. on Nov. 21, not Nov. 20.

title: Novel Kind Of Computing: Calculation With DNA
description: IN a bold experiment that is provoking investigators to reconsider what a computer is and what it means to compute, a researcher has used DNA, the genetic material, as a sort of personal computer. Exploiting the extraordinary efficiency and speed of biological reactions, he translated a difficult mathematical problem into the language of molecular biology and solved it by carrying out a reaction in one-fiftieth of a teaspoon of solution in a test tube.

title: Film-Preview Channel Set
description: The New York Times Company and the Torstar Corporation, the parent company of The Toronto Star, said yesterday that they were developing a cable network called the Popcorn Channel.

title: Pulling Punches; NATO Hits Serbs, But Not Too Hard
description: By military standards, the NATO attack carried out today against a Serbian-controlled air base in Croatia was the equivalent of a nasty note.

title: Ladder's Failure Bewilders Fire Experts
description: New York City's Fire Department has more aerial ladder trucks and uses them more frequently than any other fire department in the country, fire safety experts said yesterday. But until Sunday -- when a fully extended ladder buckled and then careened six stories to the ground, killing one person and seriously injuring four others -- no aerial ladder had ever collapsed in New York, city fire and union officials said.

title: DANAHER AGREES TO BUY TWO COMPANIES
description: The Danaher Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the Armstrong Brothers Tool Company of Chicago and Delta Consolidated Industries of Raleigh, N.C., for an undisclosed amount. The manufacturer of tools and environmental pollution control products said the two businesses had combined annual sales of about $100 million. Armstrong Brothers manufactures industrial hand tools and related products, and Delta Consolidated manufactures truck boxes and other storage containers.

title: B.C. to Try To Repeat A Victory Of the Past
description: Ten years ago tomorrow, time had expired on the clock in the Orange Bowl as Doug Flutie's desperation pass from midfield sailed toward the University of Miami end zone. Gerard Phelan caught the ball in a crowd and Boston College was a 47-45 winner.

title: Ameritech Forcefully Stays Home
description: Richard C. Notebaert, the chairman of the Ameritech Corporation, opened a newspaper here last May to find a startling full-page advertisement by AT&T.

title: American Express Unit Settles Laudering Case
description: A banking arm of the American Express Company settled for $32 million today a Federal money-laundering case that involved Mexico's largest drug cartel, also a principal conduit for Colombian cocaine entering the United States. Prosecutors said it was the largest civil penalty ever assessed against an American financial institution for laundering money.

title: Snippets From a Decade When Confidence Ruled America
description: The compactor school of television programming is operating at full throttle in "The Fun and Feel of the 50's," a two-part Disney Channel presentation that begins tonight and concludes next Tuesday. The production, compiled for Reader's Digest Home Entertainment, skitters over the history and culture of an entire decade with material retrieved largely from what it calls the "indelible record" of an emerging medium called television.

title: Helms Shouldn't Take Hard Line on Russia
description: To the Editor:

title: Homedco Group (HOME,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Appellate Ruling Called a Threat to Endangered Species Act
description: IF the United States Supreme Court does not overturn a ruling from a Federal appeals panel, the Endangered Species Act might itself be threatened with de facto extinction, conservation groups, biologists and the Justice Department argue.

title: CBS to Get 3 Stations In NBC Deal
description: In the latest reshuffling of network-owned television stations, CBS and NBC completed a complicated trade yesterday that gave NBC a station in Philadelphia in exchange for two stations the network owns and another it had planned to buy.

title: NATO Pushes Back on Bosnia
description: Serbian forces may now take NATO enforcement of United Nations resolutions on Bosnia a bit more seriously. In contrast to the pinprick air strikes of recent months, waves of NATO aircraft bombed an airfield yesterday in Udbina, Croatia, that the Serbs were using to launch attacks against the besieged Bosnian city of Bihac.

title: Simpson Hearing Delayed
description: A hearing was postponed today on whether the wife of Lance A. Ito, the judge in the O. J. Simpson trial, should be called as a witness.

title: Ciba-Geigy Deal With Chiron Set
description: Continuing the consolidation of pharmaceuticals and biotechnology companies, Ciba-Geigy Ltd. of Basel, Switzerland, agreed today to acquire a 49.9 percent stake in the Chiron Corporation for about $2.1 billion, or $117 a share.

title: Smucker (J.M.) Co.(SJM.A,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Martin Keino Takes a Crown
description: Keino, a legendary name in distance running, was back in the winner's circle again today -- this time at the National Collegiate Athletic Association cross-country championships here.

title: Amid Midwest Roar, Inflation Sleeps
description: Business is booming all across the major industrial centers of the Midwest. In a region that only a decade ago was dubbed the Rust Belt, companies are running at top speed, hiring temporary workers, demanding overtime of employees and straining to meet deliveries.

title: Toro Co.(TTC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 28
description: b-Net loss(Loss)

title: Figgie International Inc.(FIGIA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 1,098,000, or 6 cents a share.c-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 3,719,000, or 21 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 231,000, or 1 cent a share, in the 9 months. The 9 months also included a gain from cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes of $ 5,839,000, or 33 cents a share.Sales represented net sales from continuing operations.(Loss)

title: Officer Accused of Assault
description: A New York City police officer was arrested on assault charges yesterday after shoving and punching his girlfriend in the face outside a Brooklyn nightclub, the police said.

title: Carjacking Defendant Says Victim Is Lying
description: In an uncommon display of irritation on the witness stand, Edward L. Summers today called the surviving victim of a January carjacking a liar and a fraud for telling authorities that Mr. Summers had commandeered the Jeep and murdered its driver.

title: Gene Technique Could Shape Future Generations
description: For the first time, a scientist has developed a technique that can allow the alteration of genes in sperm, passing the changes to the animal's progeny.

title: G.O.P. Splits on Dole Threat on Trade Pact
description: Republicans split today over the decision of Senator Bob Dole of Kansas to hold a worldwide trade agreement hostage to tax concessions from the White House. While a prominent Republican strategist warned against the move, Representative Newt Gingrich of Georgia, a supporter of the pact, said he would not interfere with Mr. Dole's effort.

title: Williams-Sonoma Inc.(WSGC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 30
description: b-Net loss(Loss)

title: Concord Fabrics Inc.(CIS,A) reports earnings for Year to Aug 28
description: b-After a gain of $ 860,000, or 24 cents a share, on the disposition of machinery and equipment in the Chino, Calif., plant.

title: BALTIMORE BANCORP HOLDERS CLEAR SALE TO FIRST FIDELITY
description: At a special meeting yesterday, the shareholders of Baltimore Bancorp approved the proposed $348 million acquisition by the First Fidelity Bancorp Inc. First Fidelity will pay $20.75 a share in cash under the eight-month-old acquisition plan. The transaction is still pending final Federal approval and is expected to be completed "any day now," a Baltimore Bancorp spokesman, David L. Spilman, said yesterday. The acquisition of Baltimore Bancorp, which has $2.2 billion in assets, would increase First Fidelity's network to almost 700 branches spanning Maryland, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York and Connecticut. Holders of 95.5 percent of Baltimore Bancorp shares voted to approve the purchase, the company said.

title: LDDS COMMUNICATIONS GETS APPROVAL TO BUY WILTEL
description: The Federal Communications Commission has approved LDDS Communications Inc.'s proposed acquisition of Wiltel Inc. The two companies announced the $2.5 billion transaction in August and are awaiting approval from several state regulators. LDDS is the No. 4 long-distance company in the country. Its acquisition of Wiltel, a unit of the Williams Companies, will create a long-distance company with about $3 billion in revenue that may be better able to challenge the nation's three big carriers: AT&T, MCI and Sprint.

title: Goldman, Sachs to Cut Bonuses Sharply
description: In the latest evidence of growing distress on Wall Street, Goldman, Sachs & Company announced yesterday that it would slash the annual bonuses that it doles out to most of its employees.

title: Ukraine Leader, Dogged by Economic Woes, to Meet Clinton
description: When the Ukrainian leader, Leonid Kuchma, meets with President Clinton at the White House on Tuesday, he will very likely be praised for moving in the last month to reform the economy and to persuade his truculent Parliament to rid the nation of nuclear weapons.

title: Artificial Liver Study Findings Are Premature
description: To the Editor:

title: Repeated Deals Confuse Bridge Match
description: A furor erupted during Sunday night's play at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall National Championships here when a player discovered that she had played the same deals before and could remember them. A major procedural failure had put into play in the Women's Board-a-Match Team Championship 16 deals that had been played four months earlier in the Women's Knockout Team Championship in San Diego.

title: Hayes Wheels Int'l.(HAY,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Net loss, which was after an accounting charge of $ 24.6 million, or $ 1.40 a share, for the adoption of SFAS No. 106, SFAS No. 109, and SFAS No. 112.Hayes Wheels said that 1993 results included a retroactive charge of 4 cents a share for the impact of the 1993 federal tax legislation.(Loss)

title: Out of the Mythic Mists, Then Back Into Them
description: The Myth and Meaning of Malcolm X By Michael Eric Dyson 215 pages. Oxford University Press. $19.95.

title: Desegregation Study Is Ordered in Bergen
description: After years of futile attempts to integrate the heavily minority Englewood school district with its primarily white neighboring districts, the State of New Jersey today handed the problem of drawing up a racial-balance plan to a private company.

title: Agent Shoots Man With Knife on Subway
description: An F.B.I. agent shot a knife-wielding passenger on a subway train in lower Manhattan yesterday after the agent ordered him to drop the knife and the man continued to approach the agent, law enforcement officials said.

title: Accounts
description: * High Bar Productions Ltd., New York, to Katz Dochtermann & Epstein, New York, to handle corporate and consumer product advertising for the producer of the "Body Shaping" fitness television program, previously handled in-house. Billings were estimated at $6 million. * Edwards Super Food Stores, Windsor Locks, Conn., to Mintz & Hoke, Avon, Conn., to handle the supermarket chain's account, previously at Wyse Advertising, Cleveland. Billings were estimated at $3.5 million to $4 million.

title: Stein and Toklas as Symbols Of Creative Partnership
description: The relationship of Gertrude Stein and Alice B. Toklas is the springboard for Amy Pivar's rambling and inventive dance piece "The Modest Typist." Here again, Ms. Pivar, an experimental choreographer and dancer, combines movement with text as she has in recent collaborations with Freda Rosen, a social therapist who is the co-director of Amy Pivar Dances.

title: Brown Group Inc.(BG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 777,000, or 4 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,282,000, or 7 cents a share, in the 9 months.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 1,792,000, or 10 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,538,000, or 9 cents a share, in the 9 months. The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 2,214,000, or 13 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Meet the New Routine, Same as Old Routine
description: What did we learn from NBC's telecast of "The Gold Championship" Saturday night, the latest made-for-TV figure skating exhibition-as-competition?

title: NATO, Expanding Bosnia Role, Strikes a Serbian Base in Croatia
description: NATO warplanes bombed a Serbian-controlled air base in Croatia today, destroying its runway and its antiaircraft defenses and taking the Western alliance's political involvement in the Bosnian war to a new level.

title: G.O.P. PROPOSAL WOULD OVERHAUL WELFARE SYSTEM
description: The Republican team taking over the House of Representatives will propose a welfare bill that eliminates a decades-old guiding principle of poverty and food programs: that anyone who qualifies for these benefits automatically gets them.

title: Roanoke Electric Steel Corp.(RESC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-After a gain of $ 3,093,940, or 58 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; An oil company tries to enliven one of the basic purchases -- gasoline -- with a light touch.
description: IT has been decades since the enthusiastic uniformed Men from Texaco sang their way through hard-charging sales pitches and Esso insistently promised it would "put a tiger in your tank." Today's gasoline advertising tries selling in a far softer, more low-key manner, as demonstrated by a humorous, at times even winsome, campaign for the Sun Company.

title: F.T.C. SEEKS DATA FROM COLUMBIA/HCA AND HEALTHTRUST
description: The Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corporation and Healthtrust Inc. said yesterday that the Federal Trade Commission had asked the companies to provide more information before Federal regulators decided whether to approve their $5 billion merger. Under Federal antitrust law, the commission generally has 20 days to reach a decision after the companies comply with a second request for information, though the deadline can be extended by mutual agreement. Columbia/HCA and Healthtrust are the nation's two largest hospital chains.

title: CHRONICLE
description: Oh, what a diplomat is DONNA E. SHALALA, the Secretary of Health and Human Services. At a dinner given by Ambassador ITAMAR RABINOVICH of Israel in honor of Secretary of State WARREN CHRISTOPHER on Sunday evening, she found herself seated next to Israeli Prime Minister YITZHAK RABIN. The Prime Minister smoked through the evening, the only guest in the room to do so, she said yesterday.

title: CLINTON IS OPEN TO RABIN'S PLEAS
description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel went to the White House today and came away with firm commitments from President Clinton for most everything he sought: generous foreign aid, further military assistance and the prospect of American peacekeeping troops in the Golan Heights should Israel and Syria make peace.

title: Bridge Gunman Thought of Beirut, Witness Says
description: A defense witness testified yesterday that the man who killed a Hasidic student and wounded three others in an attack on the Brooklyn Bridge in March started firing when he momentarily thought he was back in Beirut, Lebanon, and fighting for his life.

title: Mercy Killing in Canada Stirs Calls for Changes in Law
description: The second-degree murder conviction of a Saskatchewan farmer in the death of his disabled daughter has kindled debate in Canada about mercy killing and has increased pressure for changes in the law to soften such judgments in the future.

title: Roman Catholic Bishop Denounces Repression in East Timor
description: About 135 Timorese protesters against Indonesian rule were arrested last week, and many of them were taken from their homes and beaten by security forces, the religious leader of East Timor said today.

title: Brooklyn Gets Shortchanged on Subway Station Renovation; Nothing to Teach
description: To the Editor:

title: Battle Goes On as Rent Control Is Defeated in Massachusetts
description: Landlords here have complained for years that this city's rent-control laws are ruinous. But when they tried to change the system at the local level, they were always outnumbered by the tenants.

title: House Appointee Favors Tobacco Over Health
description: To the Editor:

title: Marsh Supermarkets (MARSA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 15
description: b-After a gain of $ 1,941,000, or 23 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Arafat Says He Means to Wield Control
description: Yasir Arafat summoned thousands of his supporters into Gaza's streets today to deliver a blunt message to violence-scarred Palestinians that he has political control and intends to keep it.

title: Personal Health; Making it work when opposites attract.
description: LAST summer one of my sons, the product of a Swedish-American father from a Lutheran Minnesota family and a mother of Russian-Jewish descent from New York, married a Filipino-born Presbyterian woman from California. Next spring his twin brother will marry a Korean-born woman who grew up in a Methodist family in Ohio and New York.

title: SAMSUNG IS PLANNING $9.38 BILLION IN INVESTMENTS
description: Samsung, South Korea's largest conglomerate, said in Seoul today that it would invest $9.38 billion in building plants for semiconductors, automobiles and other products and in developing new technology next year. The group said the amount represented a 50 percent increase over this year's total investment. A total of $2.69 billion will be spent on building plants for high-memory semiconductors. About $1.69 billion will be invested in plants for home appliances and advanced liquid crystal displays. Samsung also plans to participate in large Government projects to build ports, railroads and roads.

title: More Than 30 Hurt In Highway Crash Of Bus and Truck
description: A bus carrying about 40 people from New York City to Atlantic City collided with a tow truck on the Garden State Parkway near Holmdel, N.J., yesterday, seriously injuring both drivers and leaving 38 bus passengers with minor injuries, officials said.

title: U.S., in a Secret Deal, Removes Bomb Fuel in Ex-Soviet Republic
description: The United States has secretly negotiated the delivery of a large cache of bomb-grade uranium from Kazakhstan to this country for safe storage, Clinton Administration officials said tonight.

title: Viola Spolin, 88, a Teacher Who Inspired Improv Theater
description: Viola Spolin, who as a teacher and author was an inspiration for the improvisational theater movement, died yesterday at her home in Los Angeles. She was 88.

title: Michaels Stores Inc.(MIKE,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 30
description: b-Included pretax store closing and conversion costs of $ 7,074,000. Before the charge, net income was $ 17,816,000, or 92 cents a share.

title: Corrections
description: An article in Science Times yesterday about an experiment using DNA, the genetic material, as a form of computer referred incorrectly in some copies to a problem solved that way. It was to find a path connecting seven cities, passing through each once, when routes exist between only some of them.

title: Clemente's Widow Keeps His Dreams Alive
description: The number 21 signifies a lot on the island of Puerto Rico.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Chicago-O'Hare International Airport is selling $108.6 million of tax-exempt special facility revenue refunding bonds through Goldman, Sachs & Co. The bonds are priced at par to yield 8.25 percent. They are rated Baa2 by Moody's Investors Service and BB+ by the Standard & Poor's Corp

title:
Real Estate;
The Aura from the 1996 Olympic Games is Helping Atlanta Sell Office Space and Attract Investment
description: WITH the city as host of the 1996 Olympic Games, Atlanta's commercial real estate market has surged.

title: NEW JERSEY PLANS TO CUT PAYMENTS FOR MEDICAID 20%
description: New Jersey officials said today that they planned to cut the amount of money hospitals receive to care for Medicaid patients by 20 percent starting in March. William Waldman, the State Human Services Commissioner, said he expected a court challenge, but is confident the move, which would reduce hospital reimbursements by $135 million annually, would be upheld.

title: TWA Jetliner Hits Cessna in Takeoff In St. Louis, Killing 2
description: A Trans World Airlines jetliner struck a private plane with its wing during takeoff tonight at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport today, killing two people aboard the small craft and injuring several passengers on the large jet.

title: A Classical Music Guide
description: To the Editor:

title: Clinton Thanks Ukraine With $200 Million
description: President Clinton offered $200 million in additional economic aid to Ukraine today to thank that country's new President, Leonid Kuchma, for taking politically difficult steps sought by Washington toward free-market reforms and the elimination of nuclear weapons.

title: Collins & Aikman Corp.(CKC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Net loss, which included $ 130.8 million in the quarter and $ 132.6 million in the 9 months, of goodwill amortization and write-off.(Loss)Figures are pro forma. The company completed a recapitalization in the 1994 second quarter. The pro-forma results assume the recapitalization transactions occurred at the beginning of each fiscal year.

title: Furon Co. (FCBN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: Sales from continuing operations were $ 78,741,000 and $ 223,529,000 in the latest quarter and 9 months, respectively, and $ 67,147,000 in the year-ago quarter and $ 199,984,000 in the 9 months.

title: American Stores Co.(ASC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 15 million, or 11 cents a share.The latest quarter and 9 months' results included a nonrecurring gain of 50 cents a share on the sale of Star Market and charges of 13 cents a share for closed facilities and 10 cents a share for centralizaton costs.Year-ago periods' results included a charge of 4 cents a share reflecting the impact of the federal tax rate change.American Stores said that the year ago first quarter included a nonrecurring gain from the resolution of litigation related to termination of a retirement plan, net of certain miscellaneous one-time charges. A pretax charge of $ 25 million for early retirement of debt which was reported in the first quarter of 1993 has been reclassified as an extraordinary item in the 1993 year-to-date period.Per share amounts for 1993 have been restated to reflect the March 1994 2-for-1 stock split.

title: 4 at Police Center In Washington Die As Gunfire Erupts
description: Four people, including a District of Columbia police sergeant and two F.B.I. agents, were killed today in a wild eruption of gunfire inside the Police Headquarters building, the authorities said. Two other people were reported to have been wounded.

title: S.E.C. Widens Partnership Investigation
description: After years of investigating Prudential Securities' improper sales of limited partnerships, Government regulators are turning their attention to the rest of Wall Street.

title: A Day in the Life of a City Potato
description: THE potato got to the "21" Club at 8:30 in the morning, after having been bounced around plenty in the back of a C & S Wholesale truck. It was a yellowish Yukon Gold variety, and it did not lack for companionship. It arrived packed with 300 pounds of kinfolk.

title: CHRONICLE
description: When 9-year-old JULIE GAL arrived here from Austria in 1961 speaking no English, she started taking classes at the Rudolph Steiner School in Manhattan. And the only child who would speak to her was Beth Rudin, she recalled yesterday.

title: Pataki Says He'll Meet Giuliani, And Help Him in a Budget Fight
description: They still have not spoken, but Governor-elect George E. Pataki offered an olive branch today to Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani, saying he would meet with the Mayor one on one next week and that he would help the Mayor next year in Albany to block two bills that would hurt the city budget.

title: Giant Food Inc.(GFS.A,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 5
description: b-After a gain of $ 3,934,000, or 7 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.The latest periods' results included pretax LIFO charges of $ 900,000, or 1 cent a share, after taxes, in the quarter and $ 2.7 million, or 3 cents a share, after taxes, in the 9 months.Year-ago periods' results included pretax LIFO charges of $ 930,000, or 1 cent a share, after taxes, in the quarter and $ 2.79 million, or 3 cents a share, after taxes, in the 9 months.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: Markets

title: Chase Brass Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per-share earnings were not available, as the company held its initial public offering earlier this month.

title: SERBS PRESS DRIVE ON BOSNIAN TOWN, USING HELICOPTER
description: Undaunted by a NATO air raid Monday, rebel Serbs backed by tanks and a helicopter closed in on Bihac today, pounding Bosnian Government forces and leaving several villages burning and hundreds of refugees without shelter, United Nations officials said.

title: Amstar Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after a loss from cumulative effects of changes in accounting principles of $ 10,957,000.Sales represented net sales.Amstar is a wholly owned subsidiary of Esstar Inc.

title: Fred's Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
Labor Secretary Urges Cuts For 'Corporate Welfare' Too
description: Firing back at conservatives who have vowed to trim welfare costs, Labor Secretary Robert B. Reich today issued a broad but vague call to choke off as much as $200 billion in "corporate welfare" as a way of finding money for jobs programs.

title: Dole and Gingrich Embrace Before Republican Governors
description: Bob Dole and Newt Gingrich today displayed a bonhomie seldom, if ever, seen between the two Republicans.

title: A Separate Pathway Slowly Carries a Caress To the Brain's Attention
description: RESEARCHERS have discovered the scientific basis for enjoying a caress.

title: Appeals Court Upholds Academy's Removal of Gay Midshipman
description: A Federal appeals court today upheld the Naval Academy's removal of a top-ranked midshipman who had acknowledged his homosexuality.

title: Comptroller Sees Waste In Busing Preschoolers
description: Every school day, thousands of handicapped 3- and 4-year-old children spend more than two hours a day on buses to get to and from special training programs in New York City that they may not need, the City Comptroller charged yesterday.

title: Levering Rothfuss, Pianist, Dies at 42
description: Levering Rothfuss, a pianist and vocal coach, died on Monday at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital. He was 42 and lived in Manhattan.

title: The Case for 'Privatizing' Park Wildlife
description: To the Editor:

title: Swiss Bank Holds Off Challenger, but Barely
description: By a tiny margin, Union Bank of Switzerland, the country's largest banking organization, won a shareholder vote today that will keep the $300 billion institution out of the hands of a Swiss financier who had threatened to change management and take control.

title: Friends Pay Loving Tribute To Tandy and Her Career
description: Jessica Tandy, whose talent and graceful presence illuminated theater and films for almost 70 years, was remembered with deep affection and admiration at a memorial celebration yesterday at the Shubert Theater. Tandy died on Sept. 11 at the age of 85.

title: Recalling the Muppet Master
description: It all began in 1955 with a hand in a sock. The hand belonged to Jim Henson, whose impertinent puppets on a show called "Sam and Friends" become a local late-night hit on the CBS affiliate in Washington. From the beginning, Mr. Henson's attitude toward television was, "Let's play with the medium." How imaginatively and memorably he played is recounted on "The World of Jim Henson," tonight's 90-minute "Great Performances" presentation on WNET.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: N.B.A. Bucks Defeat Celtics Todd Day scored 23 points and Vin Baker added 20 as the Milwaukee Bucks used a strong second half to cruise to a 116-94 victory over the Boston Celtics in Hartford last night. Baker, playing at the Hartford Civic Center for the first time since he attended the University of Hartford, scored 14 points in the second half as the Bucks snapped Boston's three-game winning streak. Glenn Robinson added 17 points and Eric Murdock, activated Monday after missing seven games with an eye injury, came off the bench to score 15. Rick Fox, who missed the past two games with a hip injury, returned to the lineup and paced the Celtics with 16 points, all in the second half. (AP) Hawks 102, 76ers 99: Stacey Augmon scored 23 points, including a short jumper with 11 seconds to play, as Atlanta beat visiting Philadelphia to keep the 76ers winless on the road. The loss was the fourth in a row on the road for the 76ers. Philadelphia led by 98-97 after Willie Burton hit a layup for the last of his 22 points with 1 minute 40 seconds to play. Grant Long tied the score with a free throw with 1:17 left, and Steve Smith gave the Hawks the lead for good with two free throws with 46 seconds to play. (AP) Hornets 102, Warriors 98: Hersey Hawkins scored 7 of his 18 points in a decisive fourth-quarter stretch, helping Charlotte hold off visiting Golden State. The Warriors were trying to set a team record for consecutive road victories at the start of the season. Charlotte tried to help by being whistled for four technical fouls, two in the fourth quarter for illegal defense and a third in that period on the bench. Golden State literally gave away its shot at five straight road victories, committing 20 turnovers. (AP) Cavaliers 112, Timberwolves 79: Cleveland collected 37 points off turnovers, while giving visiting Minnesota its worst defeat of the season. Mark Price led Cleveland with 17 points, and Tony Campbell had 16. Bobby Phills and Chris Mills scored 15 each. The Timberwolves got 14 points, but only 3 rebounds, from Christian Laettner. (AP) Bulls 105, Clippers 93: Ron Harper scored 21 points against his former teammates as visiting Chicago ran off 18 straight points in the fourth quarter to rally for a victory over Los Angeles. The Clippers (0-10) remained the league's only winless team after squandering a fourth-quarter lead for the second straight game. (AP) FIGURE SKATING Russians Win Defending champions Maria Petrova and Anton Sikharulidze of Russia won the pairs' short program yesterday in the World Junior Figure Skating Championships in Budapest. In second place were the American sister-and-brother pair of Danielle and Steve Hartsell, who lost points because their side-by-side spins were slightly out of unison. Their coach, Johnny Johns, said he hoped the pair would take home a medal after today's free program. (AP)

title: Fay's Inc.(FAY,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Net loss, which was after a charge of $ 4,806,000, or 24 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: Jergens Chooses Suissa Miller
description: The Andrew Jergens Company has selected Suissa Miller Advertising in Santa Monica, Calif., to handle the creative part of its consumer brands account, with billings estimated at $30 million. That assignment had been handled by Publicis/ Bloom in New York for the last two and a half years until that agency and Jergens parted company in June because of potential conflicts with a larger client of Publicis/Bloom's, Cosmair.

title: Let the Turkey Offer Thanks as Well
description: To the Editor:

title: Julian Symons Is Dead at 82; Author of Stylish Crime Novels
description: Julian Symons, a prolific and urbane writer known for his finely fashioned crime novels, died on Saturday at his home in Kent. He was 82.

title: London Journal; A Tipsy Big Ben Leans Over Bedlam-on-Thames
description: Westminster Bridge is falling down, or would be if engineers had not just embarked on a project to shore it up. Across town, near Sloane Square, one of the Victorian-era iron beams supporting the roof of the Underground station is cracked, forcing trains to crawl through at 15 miles an hour.

title: Oil Markets Unruffled By OPEC Output Limits
description: Oil prices reflected little concern among traders today about a decision by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to freeze current production levels through 1995 in hopes of driving up oil prices.

title: So Witty, So Sophisticated, So Lonely
description: Famed for their stinging wit and conversational savagery, the wags of the Algonquin Round Table would undoubtedly have had claws out for a drama like "Mrs. Parker and the Vicious Circle," Alan Rudolph's name-dropping celebration of their heyday. Surely Dorothy Parker herself, a caustic critic who lacerated even "The House at Pooh Corner," could have had a field day with this film's pretensions, omissions and overweening literary lights.

title: Venturing Several Steps Past Flamenco's Traditions
description: The World Music Institute provided fascinating and informative essays on flamenco and its dance forms in the program for "Flamenco Gitano," presented by the institute on Friday night at the New School. But scholarly notes were of as little use as a road map through a rain forest.

title: Swedes Pick Cup Team
description: The Swedish Davis Cup team that will play Russia in the finals in Moscow on Dec. 2-4 was named yesterday. It will be the last one selected by the Swedish captain, JOHN-ANDERS SJOGREN, who said that he would step down after nine years. The team's coach, CARL-AXEL HAGESKOG, will replace Sjogren, who is 55 years old.

title: Santa Fe Asks Backing For Burlington Merger
description: The Santa Fe Pacific Corporation asked shareholders yesterday to back a proposed merger with the Burlington Northern Corporation, but hinted that it might change its mind if the Union Pacific Corporation sweetened its rival offer.

title: CHS Electronics Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossCHS Electronics attributed its increase in sales in the third quarter to the contribution of CHS Promark, which it acquired June 30.The company said its sales were also helped by its German unit, CHS Electronic Publishing Service.(Loss)

title: Corrections
description: An article yesterday about Sheldon Silver, the Speaker of the New York State Assembly, misstated the party affiliation of Assemblyman Richard L. Brodsky of Westchester. He is a Democrat.

title: By Dorothy Parker, From A to Z
description: THE POETRY AND SHORT STORIES OF DOROTHY PARKER 457 pages. Modern Library. $15.50.

title: Mr. Helms Must Step Aside
description: Senator Jesse Helms is out of control, and the Republicans have to do something about it. What Senator Bob Dole has on his hands is a mean-spirited, loose-lipped legislator who has moved from being an embarrassment to the G.O.P. to being a global liability for the nation.

title: Let the Turkey Offer Thanks as Well; A Vegetarian Feast
description: To the Editor:

title: New Approach Is Tried in Suit Over Homeless
description: Trying a new strategy to prevent New York City from letting homeless families sleep overnight in offices, a state judge yesterday appointed a mediator to oversee negotiations between the city and advocates for the homeless.

title: Minding the Store On Food Ad Claims
description: TO some lovers of Haagen-Dazs frozen yogurts, the idea that the delicious desserts were low in fat seemed too good to be true.

title: Pilot in Friendly Fire Case Is Likely to Avoid Charges
description: An Air Force investigator has recommended dropping all charges of negligent homicide and dereliction of duty against an F-15 fighter jet pilot implicated in the shooting down of two American helicopters over northern Iraq last April, an incident that killed all 26 people aboard.

title: CHRONICLE
description: THE REV. WILLIAM MCDONALD TULLY was instituted as the 11th rector of St. Bartholomew's Church on Monday evening and began his tenure in the spirit of healing and peace.

title: AT LUNCH WITH: William Shatner; Contemplating Death and the Sequel
description: HE'S alive. He's wearing a suit. And he's orange.

title: Cobra Industries Inc.(COI,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results are pro forma, as the company completed its initial public offering in October 1993.

title: With a Nod to Oxford, Stanford Sets Program for Asian Scholars
description: Stanford University is developing a program modeled after Oxford University's Rhodes Scholarships in an effort to attract top college graduates from Asia, the fastest growing region of the world.

title: Suit Faults New York City Over Upstate Homeless Site
description: New York City was sued yesterday by Orange County officials who contend that a city-run homeless shelter in their county has become a dumping ground for criminals and the mentally ill.

title: Cost-Cutters Reviewing Implants
description: On a recent trip to a New Jersey hospital, Kevin Weeks was appalled to witness an operation he considers a waste of money.

title: Rodman Gets Support
description: The National Basketball Association players' union has filed a grievance on behalf of forward DENNIS RODMAN of the San Antonio Spurs. The union says the Spurs had no right to dock Rodman about $105,000 for violating team rules.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Mexican Attitudes Shift In Flood of U.S. Goods
description: The Marlboro Man rode off American television years ago, but in Mexico he is still galloping hard, part of a stampede for products from across the border that is changing and challenging Mexico's modest advertising industry.

title: Down Home In Maine
description: Beal Bean (Patrick McGaw), the stammering backwoods hunk who stomps through the film adaptation of Carolyn Chute's best-selling 1985 novel, "The Beans of Egypt, Maine," brings to mind a Cole Porter lyric from the late 1920's. In "Find Me a Primitive Man," the hankered-after object is described as "someone with vigor and vim/I don't mean the kind that belongs to a club/But the kind that has a club that belongs to him."

title: Like Boxer, Like Trainer
description: Riddick Bowe and Larry Donald are similar fighters with similar builds and similar styles.

title: One Nation, One Vote? That's Not Fair
description: When Congress takes up the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade next week, it should focus on diplomacy, not economics. It should give particular scrutiny to the treaty's proposed offspring, the World Trade Organization, which could cause immeasurable damage to American diplomacy for years to come.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS;
description: The Continental Cablevision Corporation said yesterday that it had agreed to buy the cable systems owned by the Providence Journal Company in a deal valued at $1.4 billion.

title: When Does a Sting Become Entrapment?
description: So, what do Marion Barry, Harrison A. Williams Jr. and John Z. DeLorean have in common? Right! All were caught by hidden cameras in the throes of apparent illegality. Tonight's edition of "American Justice" brings back those embarrassing yet entertaining tapes in the course of a report on sting operations by the law. The question is, at what point does a set-up become entrapment? Or, where is the line between making an illegal act available or luring someone into it?

title: Federal Judge Permits Entry of Haitian-Refugee Children
description: A Federal judge ruled today that Haitian children detained in the United States Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay should be allowed into the United States in the same way that Cuban-refugee children were.

title: DISNEY (WALT) CO. (DIS,N)
description: The Walt Disney Company yesterday reported strong earnings for the fourth quarter as profits from movies like the "The Lion King" offset declines in the theme park and resort business.

title: The Cheering Over, Haitians Face New Trials
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Proposes More Muscle To Aid Bosnia
description: The United States today proposed stiffer military action and expanded use of air power to protect the beleaguered area of Bihac in northwest Bosnia.

title: Film in Review; Military Coup in Australia
description: Few areas of the world have inspired more mystically shimmering cinematography than the Australian outback, the setting for "Resistance," a contemporary political thriller directed by Paul Elliot and Hugh Keays-Byrne. That aura of magical translucence has been heightened by the film's director of photography, Sally Bongers, to evoke a vision of Australian rural life that is hallucinatory in its intensity and precision.

title: Blue Blazers vs. Blue Jeans; Jury in Murder Trial Weighs How Appearances May Deceive
description: At times, Edward L. Summers has appeared on the witness stand in a blue blazer with a handkerchief tucked elegantly into the breast pocket. But at least twice during the trial, he has been asked to change into the hooded black sweatshirt, jeans and boots he wore last January when he was arrested and charged with carjacking a Jeep and murdering its owner, a Rockland County teen-ager.

title: O.K. Corral Budget; Council, Pressed by Giuliani for Cuts In Midyear, Looks to Test Its Powers
description: When the new City Charter took effect four years ago, it vastly increased the authority of the City Council, but it also left the Mayor with unrivaled budget powers that most governors or even the President might envy.

title:
On Campus;
Computer Plan Meets Resistance
description: A plan at three campuses in the California State University system to push students into the information age by requiring them to own computers has run into a very human glitch: resistance from students who will have to pay for them.

title: Clothestime Inc.(CTME,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Net income(Loss)

title: Artists Suffer More From Mental Illness
description: To the Editor:

title: Prices Advance Sharply On Treasury Securities
description: Prices of Treasury securities surged yesterday, with investors coming out of the stock market to buy bonds because of their attractive returns, traders said.

title: Film in Review; Kieslowski's Trilogy Finale: 'Red'
description: "Red" was shown as part of this year's New York Film Festival. Following are excerpts from Janet Maslin's review, which appeared in The New York Times on Oct. 4. The film opens today at Lincoln Plaza Cinemas, Broadway at 63d Street.

title: Kellwood Co.(KWD,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Food Notes
description: A Chocolate Hanukkah

title: At Risk in Gaza
description: Last Friday's fatal clashes in Gaza dramatized the perils that threaten Israel's historic peace with Yasir Arafat's P.L.O. Fourteen people were killed and more than 200 wounded after Palestinian police fired on street protesters, many of them sympathetic to the militant Islamic organization Hamas.

title: BASEBALL: A Natural at Filling the Seats; Weak Bat Adds Skepticism to Jordan's Future in Majors
description: Michael Jordan swung at the first pitch and dumped a double next to the left-field line. The fans at Scottsdale Stadium cheered lustily, but a group of more dispassionate observers reacted differently.

title: Harnischfeger (HPH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $ 2,010,000, or 7 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1,007,000, or 4 cents a share, in the year. The year was also after a charge of $ 66,142,000, or $ 2.55 a share, representing the cumulative effect of accounting changes.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 17,405,000, or 69 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 19,853,000, or 75 cents a share, in the year. The income from discontinued operations in both periods included a gain of $ 16,173,000 on sale of discontinued operations. The year was also after $ 67 million pretax restructuring charges and $ 8 million pretax nonrecurring charges.(Loss)

title: Varity Corp.(VAT,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 27.6 million, or 62 cents a share.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 3.3 million, or 9 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 2.2 million, or 7 cents a share, in the 9 months. The 9 months also included an extraordinary loss of $ 1.7 million, or 5 cents a share, from early redemption of debt.d-Net loss, which was after a charge of $ 146.1 million, or $ 4.28 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: Knicks Use Old In-Your-Face Tricks
description: Moments after the Knicks defeated the San Antonio Spurs Monday night at the Garden, Pat Riley praised their defense and intensity, and he basically said they were returning to being the old Knicks. In a humid and happy locker room, his players echoed those sentiments. Meet the new Knicks, same as the old Knicks.

title: Market Place; Small Power Producers Brace for Consolidation
description: The California Energy Company's attempt to take over the Magma Power Company has put the spotlight on the young industry of independent power producers.

title: Clinton Backs Off on School Prayer Proposal
description: One week after he seemed to open the door to a constitutional amendment to allow organized prayer in schools, President Clinton seemed to slam it shut today, saying his earlier remarks had been "over-read."

title:
Real Estate;
The Aura from the 1996 Olympic Games is Helping Atlanta Sell Office Space and Attract Investment
description: WITH the city as host of the 1996 Olympic Games, Atlanta's commercial real estate market has surged.

title: On TV, a Heightened Gay Presence
description: As a script in process, it could be titled "The Closet and the Conservative Ascendancy." Few developments over the last decade have been more startling than the growing visibility, proud and demanding, of gay men and lesbians. But the recent election triumphs of the Republican right have re-energized crusades and catch phrases -- "family values" is one -- that have traditionally been used against homosexuals. Will gay men and women be forced to step back, even if only part way, into the closet? The question at the moment is this: Is the door half open or half closed?

title: Glimpsing Promise In the Human Voice As an Instrument In the Future of Jazz
description: In the early 1980's, when the rank and file of young jazz musicians started a pilgrimage to New York, one instrument was conspicuous by its absence: the voice. In the last decade, one important singer has emerged, Cassandra Wilson, and a few others of less than historic ability are hanging around. Jazz singing seems to have entered a long, deep winter.

title: NEW STOCK REPURCHASE PLAN IS APPROVED AT MERCK
description: Merck & Company, the giant pharmaceutical concern, said yesterday that its directors had approved the repurchase of up to $2 billion of Merck common stock. The approval comes as Merck nears completion of a January 1993 plan to buy back $1 billion of stock. The company said it would buy shares on the open market and through privately negotiated transactions, using the shares for employee benefit plans and other purposes. Merck, based in Whitehouse Station, N.J. has 1.26 billion shares outstanding. They closed down $1.25 yesterday, at $35.75, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: A Lawyer Who Spoke Up
description: The privilege against compelled self-incrimination, said the dean of Harvard Law School, is "one of the great landmarks in man's long struggle to make himself civilized." Forty years ago, when Erwin Griswold spoke out in that manner, not many were willing to defend the Bill of Rights against Senator Joseph McCarthy, who railed against what he called "Fifth-Amendment Communists" -- traitors, he charged, hiding behind their rights.

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: Baseball American League

title: Nutrition Guides May Be Deceptive for the Aged
description: IT should surprise no one to learn that people's bodies change in significant ways as they age. But researchers are just beginning to discover important nutritional differences between the old and young that, if ignored, could adversely affect the health and well-being of older Americans.

title: Teacher Advising Education Chief Draws Lessons From Own History
description: Since Terry Dozier, late of Irmo High School in Columbia, S.C., arrived at the Education Department, meetings have not been the same.

title: Public & Private; Out of the Hands of Babes
description: Would you buy a rug if you knew that it had been woven in India by 10-year-olds beaten if they didn't work fast enough? Would you wear a shirt if it had been sewn by a 9-year-old locked into a factory in Bangladesh until production quotas for the day had been met? Would you eat sardines if the cans had been filled by 12-year-old Filipino children sold into bonded servitude?

title: PetSmart Inc.(PETM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 30
description: b-Included $ 10.6 million in merger charges from the Weisheimer Cos. acquisition in March 1994, and a $ 1.7 million benefit related to a net operating loss carryforward.c-After a gain of $ 233,000, or 1 cent a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Evelyn Anderson, Dancer, Dies at 87; A Baker Co-Star
description: Evelyn Anderson, believed to be the last surviving member of the troupe that danced with Josephine Baker in "La Revue Negre" in Paris in the 1920's, died on Oct. 29 at Misericordia Hospital in Philadelphia. She was 87.

title: Resisting O.J.-itis
description: EARLY next year, when the O. J. Simpson trial kicks off in earnest and full-time coverage returns to television, J. W. Johnson vows that the Cottonwood Cafe will be an O. J.-free zone. He will not tune the cafe's television to Court TV, nor will he lend an ear to barflies who wish to dissect the latest about Cato Kaylin or Marcia Clark's skirt lengths.

title: Italy's Premier Named in Corruption Investigation
description: Italian magistrates told Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi today that he was being investigated on corruption charges because of bribes paid to tax inspectors by his business empire.

title: Israelis Ask if Gaza Outpost Is Worth Defending
description: This Israeli settlement, where farmers grow tomatoes and bearded men study the Talmud, is looking more and more like Fort Apache each day.

title: Algoma Central reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Frazier Appeal Denied
description: Nebraska learned yesterday that quarterback TOMMIE FRAZIER won't receive an extra year of eligibility to make up for this season, most of which he missed because of recurring blood clots. The N.C.A.A. administrative review panel denied Frazier's appeal for medical hardship.

title: On Campus; Fraternity House Is Now Monumental
description: The Alpha Rho Chi fraternity house at the University of Southern California has been declared a city cultural and historical monument.

title: CHC Helicopter reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: 2 Bridge Titles Decided Amid Dispute
description: Two major team titles were decided Monday night at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals amid a controversy that prompted a brief strike by players. This concerned Sunday's qualifying stage of the Women's Board-a-Match Teams, during which one player reported, correctly, having played the same deals four months ago in San Diego.

title: Morgan Keegan Inc.(MOR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
BJ Services Co.(BJS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charge of $ 10.4 million, or 67 cents a share, for cumulative effect of accounting change.c-Included gains totaling about $ 1.5 million, or 10 cents a share, related to bond and tax issues, in the quarter and year.

title: Inmac Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
Survivors of 2 Different Wars as Kindred Spirits
description: TAKA, a child who has every reason to be afraid of everything, seems to be afraid of nothing. Laughing and dancing, he leaps into a stranger's lap and then pulls him by the hand through a tour of his home in Greenwich Village. The stranger follows, noticing the scars from a machete wound on the side of the child's head, and marvels at the survival of innocence.

title: California Tells Insurers to Pay $1.25 Billion
description: California's Insurance Commissioner, John Garamendi, followed up today on a promise to go after car insurers, ordering 28 of them to pay premium rollbacks totaling $1.25 billion.

title: Sleepy? Maybe It's The Turkey
description: Ben Franklin would be pleased. The turkey, which he so persistently tried to promote as America's national emblem, has come into its own. Not only will it take center stage tomorrow, when 45 million turkeys are expected to be consumed for Thanksgiving dinner around the nation, but for the year it is also piling up a record production of 300 million, more than a 50 percent increase from a decade ago.

title: Book Notes
description: Get Busy, Nicholas Evans

title: Some Owners Anxious As N.H.L. Talks Recess
description: So what will happen to the National Hockey League's proposed luxury tax, that penalty for high payrolls meant to slow salary escalation, which is the biggest reason why the owners have locked out the players?

title: Pilot Offers Explanation For Odd Noise On USAir Jet
description: A USAir captain says he may have created an unusual noise on a Boeing 737 by accidentally turning on the public address system during a flight a few hours before the airplane crashed near Pittsburgh on Sept. 8, killing all 132 people aboard.

title: City Council Supports Mayor On a Sex-Store Moratorium
description: City Council members yesterday agreed to Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's plan for a one-year moratorium on opening or expanding any sex-oriented video store, theater or bar.

title: Jet Rookie Is Hoping His Dance Catches On
description: Ryan Yarborough had all season to think about what to do when he caught his first National Football League touchdown pass.

title: Off the Menu
description: New Places

title: INSIDE
description: Navy Dismissal Upheld

title: Holiday on Thursday
description: Thanksgiving is tomorrow. NEW YORK PARADE: Begins at 9 A.M. at 77th Street and Central Park West. Travels south on Broadway to 34th Street. Concludes at noon. GOVERNMENT OFFICES: Federal, state and local offices are closed. POST OFFICE: Main post office open at 33d Street and Eighth Avenue for Express Mail and special delivery only. BANKS: Closed. PARKING: Alternate-side street cleaning regulations suspended or Sunday rules in effect. SANITATION: No street cleanings and recycling. SCHOOLS: Closed. FINANCIAL MARKETS: Closed. TRANSPORTATION: Subways and buses and the Long Island Rail Road will run on a Sunday schedule. Metro-North trains will be on a holiday schedule, including extra service to New York City between 6 A.M. and 10 A.M. and from New York City between 12 P.M. and 2 P.M. NEW JERSEY GOVERNMENT OFFICES: Closed. POST OFFICES: Closed BANKS: Closed. SCHOOLS: Closed. TRANSPORTATION: Buses and rail service are on holiday schedule. CONNECTICUT GOVERNMENT OFFICES: Closed. POST OFFICES: Closed. BANKS: Closed. SCHOOLS: Closed. TRANSPORTATION: Buses and rail service are on holiday schedule. Traffic Alert TODAY THANKSGIVING DAY PARADE: Preparations for the parade will close several streets: 77th and 79th Streets between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue will be closed at 3 P.M., and Central Park West from Columbus Circle to 86th Street and Broadway between 34th and 35th Streets will be closed after 10 P.M. TOMORROW The parade will close Broadway between Columbus Circle and 34th Street from 9 A.M. to noon and 35th Street between Fifth Avenue and Broadway. In addition, Seventh Avenue between 34th and 40th Streets and 34th Street between Fifth Avenue and Broadway will be closed until 1 P.M. Dismantling until about 3 P.M. will affect those streets where preparations occurred on Wednesday.

title: Baker (J.) Inc.(JBAK,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
Bryan Ferry in Concert: Old Times Remembered
description: "Though your world is changing," Bryan Ferry vowed from the stage of the Beacon Theater on Monday night, "I will be the same." In the song, he's a steadfast lover, but he could also have been describing his first New York concert since 1988. Now, as then, he performed in a ceremonial haze of frankincense, which was burning in a large urn on stage. And as in 1988, he played the careworn, genteel, pensive lover, his hair falling over his eyes, his voice progressing from humble croon to troubled bleat.

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: Council and Giuliani At War Over Budget
description: Bucking some of Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's proposals to trim city spending to close a $1.1 billion budget gap, City Council leaders broke off talks with the Mayor yesterday and pledged to draft their own budget. The impasse sets up the most serious fight yet over what powers the Council has under the new City Charter, which gave that body expanded responsibilities.

title: COMPANY NEWS;
description: The Southern New England Telecommunications Corporation, known as SNET, said yesterday that it had agreed to buy certain cellular properties from the Bell Atlantic Corporation and the Nynex Corporation for $450 million in cash. The cellular properties are in Rhode Island, Massachusetts and Connecticut, next to areas where the SNET Mobility wireless unit now provides cellular services. After the purchase, SNET, based in New Haven, will have 192,000 customers.

title: BMTC Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Mayor and Council Break Off Negotiations on Budget Cuts
description: The City Council broke off negotiations yesterday with the Giuliani administration over how to cut spending to close a $1.1 billion gap in New York City's budget, and each side said it would proceed without the other.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A2-13 SERBS CONTINUE ATTACK Serbs continued to close in on a northwest Bosnian town, in defiance of NATO after air strikes the day before on a base held by the Serbs, and NATO appeared to be preparing for further air strikes. A1 An American proposal to protect a Bosnian town. A13

title: VW TO PUT DAYTIME RUNNING LIGHTS ON GOLFS AND JETTAS
description: Volkswagen United States Inc., the American unit of Volkswagen A.G., said yesterday that it would equip all Golf and Jetta cars with daytime running lights, making Volkswagen the first German auto maker to offer the safety devices in the United States. The lights are intended to help prevent accidents by making a car more visible to other drivers during daylight hours. The lights automatically go on when the ignition is turned, and stay on at a reduced intensity during daylight hours. The General Motors Corporation has said it expects to equip all its North American-made cars and trucks with daytime running lights by 1997.

title: What Women Can Teach Men
description: By now, the benefits of single-sex education for girls and women have been reported so often and so fully that you might think the advocates of women's institutions could snap their briefcases shut and declare the case closed.

title: 18 MILLION COMMON SHARES OFFERED BY MOTOROLA
description: Motorola Inc., the electronics giant based in Schaumburg, Ill., offered 18 million common shares yesterday, priced at $58.50 apiece. The company is expected to use proceeds of the sale for debt repayment and general corporate purposes. Motorola's stock closed down $2 a share, at $57, on the New York Stock Exchange, where it was the most active issue, with more than 7.7 million shares traded. The company sold 17.1 million of the shares. A trust affiliated with Robert W. Galvin, the chairman of the executive committee of Motorola's board, sold the other 900,000.

title: MFP Technology reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: More Scrutiny of a Microsoft Merger
description: The Microsoft Corporation and Intuit Inc. said today that they had received a second request from the Justice Department for information on their proposed merger. Both said the request had been anticipated and that they were cooperating with the Government.

title: No Arms to Indonesia
description: To the Editor:

title: Abortion Foes Face Enemy At Doctor's Negligence Trial
description: When a physician who filled in for a murdered abortion-clinic doctor in Pensacola, Fla., came before an administrative court in New Jersey today on malpractice charges growing out of previous abortions, he saw two particularly unfriendly faces in the courtroom.

title: Kohlberg, Kravis Begins Borden Tender Offer
description: The battle for Borden's 41,000 shareholders began yesterday as Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company began its expected $2 billion tender offer for the financially troubled consumer products giant.

title: No Headline
description: "London is like a piece of Gruyere cheese; there are holes everywhere. If hole digging were an Olympic sport, I can tell you this: Britain would win the gold medal every time." GERRY BRENNAN, a cabdriver. [ A4:3. ]

title: Bank of Montreal (BMO,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Tejas Power Corp.(TPC,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TCG Int'l. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss(Loss)Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Beauty Queen Is Convicted Of Reduced Charges in Attack
description: For months, the story of the beauty queen accused of attempted murder has fascinated the two Virginias. It seemed, as one lawyer in the case put it, a case of "psycho Barbie doll gone bad."

title: El Paso Electric Co.(ELPAQ,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included reorganization charges of $ 2,343,000 in the quarter and $ 6,961,000 in the 9 months; and an undisclosed gain from sale of the company's interest in Triange Electric Supply Co., in both periods.c-Included reorganization charges of $ 2,499,000 in the quarter and $ 11,055,000 in the 9 months; The 9 months was also after a charge for cumulative effect of a change in accounting principle of $ 96,044,000, or $ 2.70 a share.The net income and net loss figures are applicable to common shareholders.(Loss)

title: Film in Review; Macaulay Culkin Finding Himself in a World of Books
description: Unless Macaulay Culkin gets lost in some age-defying time warp, "The Pagemaster" has to be one of the last films in which this 14-year-old can play a cute little boy. He still does it very well as a scaredy-cat named Richard, who is fearful of everything, including his own treehouse. His father (Ed Begley Jr.) is worried by the way Richard can recite the statistical odds of being injured while playing baseball.

title: The Schools Chancellor's Future
description: Even as he struggles to weather the latest budget crisis, New York City's Schools Chancellor, Ramon Cortines, has the support of a solid majority of the Board of Education, enough to insure the renewal of his contract -- if he wants it. But lingering differences between Mr. Cortines and Mayor Rudolph Giuliani could result in his departure. Neither Mr. Giuliani nor Mr. Cortines should allow that to happen.

title: Film in Review; Black Action With Jokes
description: In the funniest moment of "A Low Down Dirty Shame," a lighthearted detective yarn written and directed by and starring Keenen Ivory Wayans, the star deflects the charge of three dripping-fanged Dobermans by slipping into a James Brown imitation. From a supercool private eye, Mr. Wayans abruptly transforms himself into a caricature of the godfather of soul, barking instructions to his backup singers on how to perform "Say It Loud, I'm Black and Proud." Caught up in the spirit, the canines halt their pursuit and begin rotating their heads in time with the beat.

title: Stocks Plunge In Hong Kong
description: Stock prices plummeted here today as investors redeemed their equity mutual funds and switched into bonds and cash.

title: Jones Quits as Coach At Oklahoma State
description: PAT JONES resigned as Oklahoma State's football coach yesterday to let someone else guide a program still trying to recover from National Collegiate Athletic Association sanctions leveled five and a half years ago. Jones won 62 games in his 11 years, more than any coach in school history. But the Cowboys had six straight losing seasons and have gone without a victory in the Big Eight during three of the last four years.

title: Fluke Corp.(FLK,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 28
METRO DIGEST
description: NEW JERSEY PLANS CUT IN HOSPITAL AID

title: Out of Cash, Eastern European Health System Has a Relapse
description: In the shabby maternity ward of the county hospital in this Black Sea port, Dr. Veronica Niculescu threw a greasy slab of brown soap onto a table. Crudely made from cheap fat, the soap smelled like a barnyard.

title: Wine Talk
description: IS there another creature as forlorn as a person staring in obvious and total incomprehension at a wine bottle?

title: President Of Lagerfeld Is Replaced
description: In a move that took the retailing community by surprise, Karl Lagerfeld S.A., the French fashion house, said yesterday that Ralph Toledano, its president for the last 10 years, had left the company.

title: U.S. Limits Gains From Sale Of Mutual Savings Banks
description: Federal regulators adopted new rules today covering sales of mutual savings banks to other banks or investors as a final step in a 10-month crackdown on deals in which savings executives legally pocketed millions of dollars.

title: COOKSON AND JOHNSON MATTHEY ABANDON MERGER TALKS
description: Cookson Group P.L.C. and Johnson Matthey P.L.C., the British materials and metals companies, called off merger discussions yesterday, only a week after the talks were announced. The two companies, however, plan to continue their joint venture, Cookson Matthey Ceramics, which began operations earlier this year. A merger would have created a $3.9 billion company.

title: Charles Baskerville, 98, Dies; Portrait Painter and Muralist
description: Charles Baskerville, a prominent portrait painter and muralist, died on Sunday in Manhattan. He was 98.

title: Accounts
description: * The Desktop Document Systems division of Xerox Corp., Palo Alto, Calif., to Young & Rubicam San Francisco, as the first agency to handle its account. Y.& R. New York is the agency for the worldwide Xerox account. Billings were not disclosed.

title: Shorewood Packaging Corp.(SHOR,NNM) reports earnings for 13wks to Oct 29
M.T.A. Board Votes Plan Calling for 10 Fare Rise
description: Brushing aside the objections of New York City officials, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority approved a long-range strategy yesterday that calls for a 10-cent fare increase next year to help pay for monthly passes with unlimited rides and free transfers between subways and buses.

title: Brady (W.H.) Co.  (BRCOA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Sonics Win Game, Nets Pass Blame
description: That big happy family that had won three of its last four games is squabbling again.

title: Saatchi to Absorb A Campbell Office
description: Saatchi & Saatchi Advertising Worldwide said yesterday that it would absorb the troubled New York office of Campbell Mithun Esty, which like Saatchi Worldwide is owned by the Saatchi & Saatchi Company P.L.C.

title: Varlen Corp.(VRLN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 29
description: b-Included a charge of $ 2 million, or 22 cents a primary share, against the company's research laboratory appliance products operation, in the quarter and 9 months.Year-ago periods were adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split paid in October 1993.

title: ASARCO PLANS TO SELL MOST OF STAKE IN GRUPO MEXICO
description: Asarco Inc. expects to sell most of its 23.6 percent stake in Grupo Mexico S.A. de C.V., the Mexican mining business, in the next two years and record a $420 million pretax gain in the process, Asarco's chairman said yesterday. Asarco, which is based in New York, produces copper, silver, gold and other metals. The stake in Grupo Mexico is now worth $505 million, said Richard de J. Osborne, the company's chairman. The company converted a longstanding stake in a mine operator, Mexico Desarrollo Minero S.A. de C.V., into its Grupo Mexico holding in August. Shares of Asarco were off $1.125 yesterday, to $26, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Fab Five? Try Pretty Darn Good Five
description: Their shorts will be hemmed, their playing time will be monitored and their memoirs will go unpublished. The new Fab Five is no reincarnation of the old Fab Five -- so help Steve Fisher.

title: Gay Officials Gather to Share Ideas
description: Like many colleagues in state capitols and city halls around the nation, the officials who met here over the weekend are concerned about race relations, religious conservatism and re-election.

title: Arden Group Inc.(ARDNA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Included recognition of contractual credits against union health and welfare payments, which increased operating income by $ 2.5 million. The period also included a $ 1.3 million nonrecurring charge for the estimated losses related to the Northridge earthquake.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 1,019,000, or 63 cents a share, and $ 2,021,000, or $ 1.25 a share, in the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and an extraordinary gain on sale of Telautograph of $ 1,838,000, or $ 1.14 a share, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Times Square Job To Artkraft Strauss
description: Times Square Center Associates has awarded the Artkraft Strauss Sign Corporation in New York contracts to design, build, market and manage outdoor advertising where 42d Street intersects with Seventh Avenue and with Broadway. The terms of the agreement were not disclosed. The contract calls for as many as 10 new illuminated signs on the corners, as well as management of the signs already at those sites. The signs are part of the redevelopment plan for the Times Square neighborhood.

title: ANNENBERG GROUP INCREASES WELLS FARGO STAKE TO 8.6%
description: An investor group led by the publisher Walter H. Annenberg has increased its stake in the common stock of Wells Fargo & Company to 8.6 percent from 7.9 percent. In its most recent transactions, between Sept. 13 and Oct. 26, the group bought 25,160 common shares of the company for $144.75 to $152.75 a share. The purchases were reported in a Federal filing. Shares of Wells Fargo, the bank holding company based in San Francisco, rose 75 cents yesterday, to $141.75, after reaching $144.50 earlier in the day. The Annenberg group now owns 4.52 million common shares of Wells Fargo, which it bought for investment, the filing said.

title: Administration Says Deal With Dole on Trade Is Near
description: Administration officials said tonight that they expected by Wednesday to reach a deal with Senator Bob Dole that would pave the way for his support of a world trade agreement scheduled for a vote in a lame-duck session of Congress next week.

title: Seeing the Future, Darkly
description: "I am Michel de Nostradame," the French actor Tcheky Karyo says in English, his impassive face and monotone suggesting he might be an android. But no. "I am a scientist," he says. "Nostradamus" is an overstuffed historical soap opera about the 16th-century doctor, astrologer, prophet and all-around great guy. Its silly, anachronistic dialogue must have been hard to take seriously, which may account for the entire cast's poker faces.

title: Helms Takes New Swipe at Clinton, Then Calls It Mistake
description: Senator Jesse Helms, the likely next chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, created a new uproar today when he was quoted saying that President Clinton was so unpopular on military bases in North Carolina that he "better have a bodyguard" if he visits the state. Mr. Helms later called the comment "a mistake."

title: Victory Helps Frieder Scratch 5-Year Itch
description: In the Bo Schembechler Bowl tonight, Bill Frieder defeated Steve Fisher.

title: Rebelling for the Sake of Rebelling
description: In "The Wild One," one of the classic portrayals of youthful malcontent, Marlon Brando is asked what he is rebelling against, to which he coolly replies, "What have you got?" If Mr. Brando's interlocutor had held up a mirror, that would be the current state of punk rock. At two sold-out concerts on Saturday night, Bad Religion at Roseland and NOFX at CBGB, punk rock not only reacted against its traditional enemies -- society and mainstream rock -- but also against itself.

title: Similar, but Separate
description: RIDDICK BOWE and LARRY DONALD are similar fighters with similar builds and similar styles. That's true, up to a point.
